review: By far best rpg i have ever played. Much better than witcher in my opinion.

overall 6/10

Skyrim with wallclimbing and a bit of sailing.

Genral Points:
- The combination of open world and climbing from assassins creed fixes the annoyment that other opon world rpgs have.
- I was stupid to buy the xp boost, you get flooded with so much exp that without doing any side missions, just exploring a bit the world I was already max level before half of the game. Also you need to upgrade your gear at each level up so it actually made it grindier because it was impossible to get all the materials for the fast level up.
- a few parts seem to make more sense if you play as Kassandra, intead of Alexious

Pros:
- Really nice world and you dont feel hampered in the movement at all.
- for those who like history its quite nice to just wander around(of course its not really accurate since then it would be bad gamedesing)

Cons:
- legendary items are too easy to get and have no real questline related to their backstory. so much wasted potential
- game balance between the classes is bad, warrior is just exceedingly strong. especially against all the bosses you cant assassinate because of cutscenes.
- Quests: to many, to short, to little npc development. They lack depth and interaction. Depending on your use of fast travel you might end up skipping parts. Also often faaaar to easy to complete. 
- Locations: to many, to short, to little npc development. They lack depth and interaction.
- boss fights are booring and too few, need more stages and thought. Also they forgot to put in scaling health with level. I killed one in below 10 seconds. Also assassin and hunter skills are mostly useless in those fights.

One of the most fun AC games in a long time. Some new things to make it interesting. Combat dynamics could be improved - basically you have too many keys to push, to do what you need to do. Probably improved by having a fancy MMO mouse or something.

This game is a like a really hot chick you meet IRL.  I mean she's hot and beautiful with a lot of ambition and is full of life, but later on, you realize she also a bit shallow, greedy, and expects you to do everything.  However, you can't break up because you've already invested all this time, and she's too god damn good looking.  So you overlook her flaws and you stick around for a while until you burn out from all your frustration and finally end your relationship.

On the bright side, you'll look back with fond memories and regret nothing.  The end.

Имел удовольствие играть во все игры серии и смело могу сказать - Assassin's Creed Odyssey отличная игра! 
Здесь вам и огромная карта и РПГ элементы и захватывающие морские сражения, за которые мы так полюбили Черный Флаг и очень приятная глазу графика. Каждый ролик смотрится как хорошо срежиссированный фильм. Все это вкупе с совмешением всего или почти всего того, что мы любили в предыдущих частях серии и получается игра, в которую я погружаюсь с огромным удовольствием каждый раз, когда беру в руки геймпад.

Do I recommend the game? Nope, no bloody way!! My system exceeds the recommened specs, yet the game will not start properly, after something like 30 tries it ONCE got to the part where I could press "new game". Every other time it would just disappear, no error message, no crash warning...nothing!!
For Ubisoft to release this game for a minimum of £49.99 and say its ready is an insult. It is far from ready, for so many people to have the same problem is unacceptable, and from what I can see very little in the way of communication from the devs.
If you buy a cooked meal and it is served cold, you ask for it to be replaced, you buy a car and it doesnt start, you get it fixed.....yet here we buy a game that doesnt work and the devs say nothing leaving us with little choice but to hope Steam give us a refund, that is an unacceptable way to treat its customers.
I will be getting a refund, and from now on regardless of what games Ubisoft release I will never purchase from them again.

meh...

Как очередному Ассасину-5/10
Как просто игре-7.5/10
真是漫长的旅程，90多个小时才完成全部地点，还有10几个谜题没有解出来。说说感想，地图很大，但是传送点比起源少了，无法直接传送城镇，其实无形中拉长了时间，这一点其实我觉得不好，玩的太累了。不过会有不同结局这对于刺客信条系列也算是一种突破了。总体来讲令人惊艳，本身是起源之前，所以刺杀元素降低也说得过去。

奥德赛真的很奇妙，看似是育碧开放世界老套路，但是能让人玩上一整天停不下来，刺客信条系列从一到起源都玩过，奥德赛还是第一个能让我整天整天地玩的刺客信条，预购时还抱有怀疑，现在无疑是真香了。

1.战斗系统进步。由于RPG化，奥德赛加入了很多实用的主动技能，比如回血，爆炸射击，金色闪光等等，有强度也有趣味。而且猎人、战士、刺杀三条线路的不同加点，能让你体会到不同的快感，选择猎人，那就是将起源的狂射信条坚持到底；选择战士，拆盾，踹人，回血，不死，让你真正做一名狂战士；选择刺杀，在入侵要塞时，悄无声息，背刺，连闪，隐身，做一名真正意义上的刺客。只要有钱，随时都可以洗点，也让玩家在面对不同的环境时有了不同的选择，比如要塞刚不过必须潜入那就洗成刺客，征服战刺客技能没卵用，那就洗成战士或者猎人，当然到了后期技能点基本足够就没有这个烦恼了。

2.对话选择系统的加入，让你对游戏剧情有了更深的思考。以往的刺客信条，我基本上不咋带脑子玩，盲目地跟着任务指示跑图杀人看看剧情。奥德赛里，玩家有了自我选择的权利，而且有些还是很重要的决断，所以我在玩的时候会更加注意可以互动的人和物，对选择可能导致的后果会加以思考，玩家会更加沉浸在游戏世界中。

3.悬赏和佣兵系统。这个系统也算是起源异乡人的超级强化升级，不过感觉单独说这个系统，感觉很普通，在佣兵界面看佣兵的简介和强弱点时，莫名像是在玩中土世界暗影战争……。捕捉佣兵算是有趣，但是只能上船当副手是美中不足，如果可以叫出来打架，或者是可以在征服战里上场，那可以说是相当好玩了。

4.地区统治和征服战，这个系统我感觉很无聊，征服战打上几场就厌倦了，如果不是给大量经验和钱，我是不会去打的。

5.海战系统这一点没什么多说的，黑旗，叛变，起源都有海战，奥德赛可以说是集三者大成者。接舷战副手如果强一点，都不用自己动手，后期我船上全是五星技能的传奇佣兵，本船长边缘OB就好。

6.非常优秀的支线系统。奥德赛的支线真的是很用心了，这里特指那些黄色叹号的支线，基本上每个区域都有，这些特殊的支线将探索、战斗、神教、佣兵、对话选择、主线推进很好地结合了起来。当你完整做完一个地区的支线后，你可能会:打了一场刺激的boss战、刺杀了一位神教成员、这个区域基本探索完成、佣兵收集列表加一、经历了一场艰难的抉择导致了一个或喜或悲的结果。

缺点：1.依然多的BUG，有些很影响游戏体验，杀美杜莎的任务从头到尾让我重新读了四五次的档，其他的卡墙什么的就不说了。
2.游玩时间一长依然会感觉到枯燥乏味，育碧游戏难以逃脱的通病。
오리진 할때는 뭔가 좀 지루했는데 이번 오디세이는 시간 가는지도 모르고 하고 있네요.

良い点

・世界観は良い

悪い点

・基礎のところからバグが多すぎる
・8割バグ、戦闘がスムーズに出来ない
・マップのいたるところが不具合が多い
・クエストの進行ができないところがある（再起動すればやれたりする）
・岩の中にサメがいる
その他全般的にバグが多すぎて、半年後、または半額以下になったら買ったほうが良い


放送しながらしてたんで、見ればわかる

I Could write an essay to explain my experience of this game.
But yesterday i watched skillups review of oddysey and although lenghty it really summarises it perfectly for me. 

The TLDR; version is that the start and the end of the game is really good , but it's tainted by the middle.
The game forces you to do meaningless sidequests to bloat the game with "content" so you can grind past the level gates in the game. 

The world is too big . Assests are reused to fill up square miles and its hurts the experience. A more focused half sized map would feel more meaningful. like the moment you ride into sparta! That is one of the only places in the game that feels different from the rest of the game. 

Combat is waaaay more enjoyable than origins but still shows cracks. Killmoves are again only on the last enemy which annoyed me alot in orgins aswel. You can become very OP with skills and the game counters that by giving enemies stupid strong skills. And last but not least enemies have way to much health.

Costumisation is amazing and the rpg element of the weapons and yourself as a character work really well.

Alexios at times feels like a dumb strong doofus. Kassandra her voice actor is better imo but is written like a male character. This really doesn't work well. (There's a technical reason behind it i think but it's no excuse).

The world itself is really pretty and the assassin mechanic without spoiling anything is done really well and i hope to see it in future games .

This is not the game if you want that asasssin feel and story. There are no assassins or templars in this game ! Some ISU elemets are done well and others well... are pretty shit. 

If the forced sidequests weren't well.. forced i would recommend this game to everyone. Now i'm not to keen on doing so. because the middle of the game I know is going to push away alot of people.

Good game that could've been great...

So from what I get out of the comments you can summarize this. This game is absolutely amazing. The people who don't like it funny enough are the people who want the same crap. They are mad this isn't the same thing as all other AC games. Yet those are the type of people to complain AC isn't doing anything new lol. This game is Witcher 3 on steroids. It's a fun sandbox open world, choose what you want to do first and not get boxed in game. There are multiple systems in this game. It will keep you entertained far longer than any other $60 price tag game. Don't be one of those people who ignore every quest except the Main Storyline and you'll not have a problem with levels. If you're wondering about buying this game don't, just buy it it's worth it.

I was happy to see that the internet was filled with people saying they didn't need to grind for levels or equipment during the game. Boy, were they wrong. Really, Ubisoft wouldn't sell XP and gold boosters if there wasn't a grind. I often found I didn't have enough gold or materials to keep my favorite gear leveled. All of the enemies are leveled, so if you have, say, a bow that is a few levels under the enemies', you'll have to shoot them fifty times in the head if they are an elite enemy or something.

Everytime I leveled up, I though "Oh, crap, I hope i have enough resources to upgrade or buy gear" that compliments my playstyle."I play on hard, but it's just artificially hard. Enemies get obscene amounts of health and damage. I can't imagine playing on nightmare. Ubisofts actual answer to this is to play on easy, but that does not help me.

I don't want to steamroll though easy. I just want solid gameplay that doesn't feel hindered by RPG mechanics.  There is no middle ground like that to Ubisoft, they just want you to buy boosters.

Some of the quests are decent enough, but others are lamesauce. It's pretty disappointing to start off the game fighting the Persians with the 300 and then go on to... deliver letters. Some quests are even lamer. The NPC justs ask you for some money, which you  can decide to give or not. That's the quest. Why Ubisoft? 

I also gotta mention just how large and detailed the world is in the game. It's kind of amazing. Unfortunately,  I felt like the RPG mechanics constantly conspired to take me away from it. Ugh, I got to go back to the blacksmith, or go to my inventory and dismantle a bunch of crap weapons I will never use.  The different areas in the game are also restricted by level, because some guys' eyeballs are much tougher to stab I guess. 

I actually like RPGs, but this is obviously designed to push people toward instant gratification microtransactions. It's annoying. Maybe this is what pay 2 win MMOs are like?

Kısa ve öz ilk 4 saat sonrası inceleme yapalım.

Oyundan beklentim ne olmalı diyenlere şöyle özetliyelim.

-Oyunun açık dünyası o kadar güzel ki.Sürekli durup durup vay be dedirten oyun.
-Grafikleri gayet iyi.
-Combat (dövüş) sistemi gayet hoş olmuş.3 farklı skill ağacında istediğimiz gibi bir build yapabiliyoruz.
-Deniz evet bu oyun da beni en çok sevindiren uçsuz bucaksız deniz.Sıkıldığınızda önünüze gelene dalabildiğiniz amansız deniz savaşları.Black Flagden sonra çok hoşuma gitti.
-Hikaye - Rpg öğeleri bana göre aşmış durumda.Gram sıkılmadan soluksuz oynadım.
-Ya her şeyi geçtim.Sparta ya kalkanı kılıcı her şey on numara.Efsane bir dönemde geçiyor oyun.

Peki bu oyunu beğenmeyenler neden beğenmiyor : 

-Origins dlc diğenler var.Hiç kulak bile asmayın derim.
-Eski Ac (1-2-Brother-Reve) hikaye anlatımını bekleyenler var hala.Yani adamlar çağı yakalamak için ne kadar tek düzelikten kaçıp ne kadar süre daha oyunu oynatırsak o kadar iyi demişler.Bence doğru yoldalar.Originsi beğenmeyen hiç bulaşmasın.
-Ve evet malesef fiyat problemi bu konu da ne desek boş :) 

Son olarak herkese gözü kapalı alın derim.Rpg-hikaye-güzel açık dünya - güzel combat sistemi arayan herkes yapıştırsın.
跟起源差不多。

Oyunu ön siparişle almıştım, ultimate edition 385 tl idi sanırım şimdi fiyat uçmuş.

113 saatin ardından
Oyun inanılmaz büyük, baştaki küçük tutorial adasını bile tamamlamanız saatlerinizi alıyor, oyunun geri kalan haritasının içinde kayboluyorsunuz zaten, şu an bile benim keşfetmediğim bölgeler var.
Başlarda origins e çok benzetmiştim, ama sonra bambaşka bir oyun olduğunu anladım.
yan görevler biraz abartılmış sanki yani heryerdeler, çok fazlalar, keza keşfedilecek yerlerde öyle.
diyaloğ seçme özellliği ile artık yaptığınız seçimlerin GERÇEKTEN etkisini yaşıyorsunuz, yani oyunun başında yaptığınız seçimin sonuçları sonlara doğru ortaya çıkabiliyor.
Yeni gelen yetenekler ile farklı savaş stratejileri kurabiliyorsunuz, oyuna nightmare zorluğunda başladım başlarda çok zor geldi ama sonradan kurduğunuz build lerle çok daha rahat edebiliyorsunuz.
Grafikler muazzam (bana göre)
optimizasyon originsten biraz daha iyi
şu ana kadar oynadığım witcher 3 den sonra en iyi açık dünya rpg diyebilirim.
8.5/10

Game can feel like a grind* but for me personally I enjoyed the side content and the game only started to feel grindy once I got to around level 43 out of the 50 levels.

Soooo here it is. I think i can make a fair review with 10 hours. 

The first five hours are really great the game is beatifull and athuentic and the exploration is great and u get your moneys worth kinda but heres a question and a answer if u should buy it for 60. 
The answer is no. Not unless u like exploration and dont mind a grind. But now what kind of grind u say. If u like doing repetive boring tasks over and over and dealing with horrible combat mechanics now dont get me wrong the combat is cool and fun at times but when fighting near walls or steps or hatches cliffs etc it just gets dumb. Dumb cuz the enemy just attacks u with these stupid unblockable attacks and while your trying to get out of the corner they just keep swinging and u cant move cuz the hatch or whatever is the way. Then u get your reward wich is ussally just bs. Thats the grind. 

Now why cant we just play the story and do what we want like a good rpg. And thats were the grind comes in. Cuz theres a level lock. But now why is there a level lock if all the enemys are just gonna level up with u. Whats the point of loot if its just to get by. Theres no serious loot that will make u immortal. I get that there should be a challenge but the way the loot is handled is just bad. It makes it feel pointless. Leveling in this game is pointless if the enemys are just gonna level with u. There needs to be some sort of seperation between low levels mid levels and high levels. Instead it rare u find one below your level very commen to find one at yours or a little higher. So everything thats a rpg about this game is just piontless. Its shoulda stayed a action adventure. 

So this is the grind. Its a grind cuz everthing is useless. Why make us do boring fetch side quests and get loot and level for a capped quest that really wouldnt matter cuz they level with u. Lets say we play without level cap but enemys still level with u. Level 16 fighting level 16 at a quest. Normal right. Move on to the next quest and play some more. now your level 20 and play a story quest. level 20 fighting level 20. normal right. So why the cap. 

Cuz they want u to grind and its a grind cuz its boring and is piontless. They only did it that way cuz guess what. Thats right MICROTANSACTIONS. This game is the most littered with them. They make the game a pain in the butt and never want u fighting lower levels cuz it would be to easy. And if its easy well i guess u wont have to pay for the awsome armor or sword or boosters. So they level with u to keep the thought in your head that u need better armor and the cap is there to make u grind. But now u can just pay to solve all your problems and have fun with the game. Well u shouldnt cuz u already spent full price for the damn game. The whole game is designed around these dumb Microtranactions. 

Listen u dont need to buy them. There not required. But the game is boring and grindy for that very reason. U know that this was there intenion too cuz why would they be there and be so specific right. "time savers". BS. Some games u dont need to pay to have fun with cuz there already fun. Microtransactions can be OK. Depeding on what they are and do. But they should not feel forced cuz of boring grindy gameplay or pay to win or loot boxes. Thats just BS. 
Now there isnt loot boxes in this thank god. But u can pay  for better gear (pay to win in a single player game cuz u know thats bs) and the time savers. They have specific catagory for the stuff. ik right. 

Some people like the grind and diffuculty cuz its rewarding. But to add cheats to buy and save time is just bs. Cuz then u made a game not cuz u wnat to reward players but cuz u want to make them feel like they want to buy them and thats just wrong. Some games are grindy and hard cuz its supposed to be like that for fun. Cuz people will buy cuz thats what there into. But if the game doesnt tell u or the series isnt known for that is unfortunate to some but whatever. But then u add cheats for sale cuz u know there uninformed is just horse crap. And for people who are into hard games guess what theres a grind to it to make u pay cuz u just want to advance and not have to do these dumb side missions. Theres a little a bit for everyone. And its a shame cuz i really wanted to enjoy this game but i just cant and im not paying more that what it is. Maybe i just suck or maybe its just me. But its wrong.

So hopefully after reading this review that i put lots of efforts in i hope u make a good decision that your hapy with. Its a good game dont get me wrong. U might actaully like it. But just know its grindy and will want to make u spend more money then u should. And thats litterly the whole piont of the game. The game is litterly a fraud of the rpg genre.

Sério isso ubisoft, vcs lançam o jogo cheio de problemas e nem se quer fazem uma única atualização?
A otimização está péssima. Quem progredir no jogo fora da ilha onde começa verá que em diversos momentos o fps cai para 1 do nada e chega até a travar por completo, te forçando a fechar o jogo pelo gerenciador de tarefas pois do contrário ele continua aberto todo congelado.
Algo que odiei nesse jogo foi de longe essas micro transações que nem deveriam existir já que essa maravilha de jogo custa caro pra krl. Quem não gasta dinheiro nessas micro transações é obrigado a gastar horas absurdas para melhorar um equipamento e seu navio, mas você não é obrigado a comprar (obviamente), mas infelizmente, alguns dos conteúdos mais legais do jogo só se consegue com Hélix (moeda paga do jogo).
Fora isso, o jogo é maravilhoso, está muito bem ambientado, muitas coisas para fazer e um mundo extremamente grande para explorar.
Como forma de protesto e repúdio às empresas que colocam micro transações em um jogo PAGO E MUITO CARO não irei recomendar ao menos até arrumarem o problema da otimização e dos bugs que óbviamente existem mas parece que a ubisoft só está preocupada em entregar o produto ao cliente (sei que não vão remover as micro transações, então ao menos espero que arrumem esses problemas)

都说奥德赛一出，起源就是个弟弟，其实也不尽然。
这作在RPG转型上是比起源完成度更高：更大的地图，更多的任务[strike]更爆的肝[/strike]，更丰富的互动。但作为代价，这一作的细节比起源就少了不少，同时中画质下对比起源有所缩水[spoiler]本人960M落泪了[/spoiler]。无聊繁琐的支线依然存在，许多对话选项完全可以加到过场里，强行让玩家点对话显得有点多余。
说归说，本育碧boy还是吹爆这一作[strike]毕竟起源没玩过瘾[/strike]。这作剧情算是把先行者补完了，全程的感受就是：“惊了，这么扯！诶？还挺酷？”
[strike]毁灭射击天下第一！[/strike]

O jogo esta maravilhoso, me encanto mais e mais em cada hora de gameplay. Esperei por mt tempo, pra ver a ressurreição do Assassins Creed. Mas tem aquele velho problema do jogo ser meio mal otimizado. Espero q melhorem isso, pfvr. Mas de resto 9/10. Se fosse mais optimizado, seria 10 de 10. Parabens UBI. Um dos melhores Assassins, nmrl.
game is great having so much fun right now.. plus it runs good on my potatoe i7 7700 and gtx 1080

Jogo ótimo, gráficos lindos, história ótima e longas horas de jogo. Único problema é a péssima otimização, rodo o jogo à 60~70 FPS com as configurações no médio (texturas e personagens no alto) e processador fritando entre 65 e 76 graus, o calor da minha cidade provavelmente também contribui esquentando a CPU. Mas, enfim, dá pra jogar, se divertir e curtir bastante a história, upar sua árvore de habilidades, atributos do navio e usar os equipamentos que quiser (não precisa descartar o equipamento por estar nível baixo, basta upá-lo no ferreiro), caso tenha um bom computador, principalmente processador pois é muito requisitado pelo jogo, vale a pena o dinheiro gasto.

Minhas configurações:
GTX 1060 6GB Overclockada em 2050mhz
Ryzen 5 1600 Overclockado em 3,725ghz
16 GB de ram (2x8) 2400mhz

If it weren't so easy to 'knock out" enemies and allies alike, that'd be dope. my biggest complaint so far is that i'll go to talk so someone, and then pressing "E" makes me knock them out. And then I just sit there. wankin my donk to see if they come around again. -_-

Aside from that, it's a great Assassin's Creed game. Somewhat similar to Origins, but Origins was far superior *IMO*. 

The combat isn't quite what I was hoping for (as far as Assassin's Creed goes) but it is definitely fun. 

9/10 would recommend

8/10 game play - (in comparison to the others, specifically fighting)
9/10 graphics
4/10 Hunting experience - (if you lead your shot using the bow with the animals, it's almost impossible to hit them - you have to use that dumb system where if you aim directly at a running animal, the arrow curves/auto-aim's for you.. GRRRR).
7/10 Ship battles.
5/10 Dialogue - It's a bit ridiculous sometimes, and feels like the fallout 4 dialogue system.
1/10 Anime Tiddies - there's times where you can seduce who you're talking to, but it goes to a black screen while you "do the deed"... lemme see dem jugs already fam. 

All in all, if you like AC, you'll get in to this. The lore, the assassin/mercenary vibe, the general idea of roaming mythical Greece and it's surrounding areas... It's quite the experience. #wherethebuttsat?

This game is awesome.  It is what I wished Dragon Age Inqusition was.  This is my first Assasin's Creed as I am more of an RPG player which is why this game caught my eye.

Pros

-Environment
-Dialogue Choices

Cons

As of this review I've only completed 41 hours but I am having a blast.  Still havent completed the story but I am highly invested in my beautiful Kassandra's tale :)

以前的刺客信条我玩了两三个小时基本上就卸载了，这次我竟然肝了五十多个小时。
现在要给差评总有发言权了吧。
首先说下优点：
1.刺客信条的操作感是几乎所有游戏中最顺滑的。可以上天下地，动作行云流水，没有一点生硬。
反观勇者斗恶龙和最终幻想，做了那么多年，都在忙些什么。
2.战斗比以往的更加有乐趣。不同的技能组合产生不同的玩法，给玩家更多的自由。。玩家可以研究更加高效的战斗方式。
3.一流的画面水准. 这可能是我还能继续肝下去的理由... 
缺点才是我想说的重点：
1.沙盘游戏很难做。因为玩家自由度高，很难去设计和引导玩家的进行方式。以育碧一年一作的尿性，更没有时间去琢磨清楚这件事情。所以等级压制来了。看起来是个沙盘游戏，其实已经被设计者强行限制了活动区域。假如作为一个高水平的质量游戏，当玩家去挑战高等级敌人的时候，奖赏是丰厚的。但是刺客信条的等级压制纯粹就是为了限制而限制。如果硬要跨等级，不仅没有奖励，而且战斗也非常的低效。技巧是不够用的，也不能智取。既然没有任何好处，跨等级战斗时非常的不明智。很多被玩家认为是神作的游戏都有最速通关视频。而奥德赛不是。奥德赛是一款谁都能够轻易通关的游戏，如果把奥德赛当一款动作游戏就会很失望，它貌似庞大的世界，并没有太多的自由度留给玩家，玩家更像个傀儡一样，按照他的流程一步一步走下去。
2.大就是好吗？这句话肯定不是在说小比大好。但是做的如此之大到底又有什么好？大多数场景并没有什么区别，我不认为一个好游戏就是要耗时间。为什么这次能玩五十几个小时，就是因为大多数时间浪费在跑路和LOADING界面。上一个通关的游戏是羞辱2.
虽然说不是一个类型的游戏，但是通关的成就感是满满的。而奥德赛给我的感觉就是累。奥德赛的路不用琢磨怎么走，反正怎么走都行，主角上天遁地。没有一个城市能好好的记住。也许能记住几个雕像，但是没有一个可以细细的品味。也许不是城市设计的不够好，而是设计的太多了！每个任务都是不停的跑路,并没有引导玩家在每个城市里面好好探索.因为他们估计也知道,他们并没有好好设计,就是做大,让你跑,耗你时间.
3.把游戏设计成一个全家桶,什么都有,什么都没有做精致.什么恋爱系统,海战系统,潜入,战斗,都是点到为止.这就像是看一部肥皂剧的感觉.虽然吃起来婉如嚼蜡,但还是能吃.剧情选项大多数抖机灵过去了,没有深度.不求从游戏中悟出什么道理,但是这样的剧情,给我的代入感不高.
4.游戏的方式在最开始的2个小时和之后都是一样的. 游戏可以选择战斗和潜入, 但是战斗的花样单一. 技能只能是锦上添花的作用.  敌人兵种少的可怜.,唯一有亮点的是美杜莎的BOSS战.  这个游戏并不需要玩家磨练自己的操作技术,跟着游戏走就完了. 所以育碧还是育碧, 从刺客信条一代就有的毛病, 到现在还是一样. 不一样的是把地图设计1000倍大.给你刷装备刷武器. 虽然玩起来感觉在吃屎,但是人性的弱点还是让你停不下来.
总结:  刺客信条进步了, 育碧找到一种省时省力, 又能让玩家叫好叫座的制作策略了. 之前FARCRY5 也是这么干的. 我都忘记我也买了.只不过玩了5个小时放弃了. 我相信下一款刺客信条还能做的更大. 装备更炫, 任务更多. 这就像那些喜欢刷抖音刷微博的用户. 明明停不下来,回过头却什么也不记得. 
PS: 单机游戏还做什么经验金钱加成的氪金. 育碧你良心不会痛吗?

Pretty fun game but falls pretty short. This was my first AC game. Overall, it's fun and visually stunning, but quickly grows boring. I think it's super easy of a game even on the higher level settings. Seems like the most important gear is lumber. Which you need crazy ammounts for upgrades which is fine, but you get so much loot and gear as you move along that it seems like if you upgrade your stuff, then 10 minutes later you find something better than your upgraded gear that you spent a ton on. I don't understand the whole ISU ancient alien stuff, but I wasn't impressed with it. The story is kind of lame as there is know connection or explaination as to how the main characters survive. The paths that you choose have no real affect on the game. For example if you choose not to kill your dad, the story still makes you say and act like you did.  After getting my boat I think I found like 8 LT.s for it within 30 minutes and only got it up to be able to hold 3 slots. The combat is fun but very limited. You get all of these skills but can only use 4 at a time unless you pause and reassign but that grows old fast.  It felt very confusing about what alignment you were with. You couldn't choose a side which is fine but with all of the quests going on, I never knew who to fight or not to fight. Oh I need to kill spartans now...oh I need to kill athenians now. Oh 100 meters to the west it's a town of people I need to go see, but do I need to fight them or not?  I like how big the world is and it's gorgeous but after jumping into water and diving for loot for the 100th time, I got pretty bored with it. The bird almost feels like a cheat as you can fly it find everyting you need to loot or kill with it. THe whole VR experience was confusing and seemed out of place. For example a bit of a ways in you step out of the VR and say you need to take care of stuff. Well you then are be able to interact with old emails and videos and notes  from what I researched off line to be from other games? Why did they not offer that at the begining of the game as a means of introducing the background to the player. Seemed really out of place and poorly planned. The cult of kosmos thing was kind of neat, but again too easy.  Also I learn about my homeland where I start being in trouble but when I Hear of thise and return, except for the visual change, I have no interaction to find out what happened and how I could help. Why bring this up during the game if you can't do anything about it? The purple things to buy gear seems cool to do, but was afraid to spend any of it because of what I said before is that every time I got new gear or upgraded, then I would immediatly find something better within 30 minutes. Kassandra as a character is pretty bad ass but the way the game was directed makes her out to be the biggest hypocryt in the world.  I enjoyed my time but outgrew it in a hurry. Would recommend it only when it hits 25-30 dollars or less.

I've been playing AC games since AC 1. It's odd, I've never really LOVED them, but they are those rare "event" games; particularly ones that are NOT an FPS/Shooter.

So I kept buying them. Blackflag and Origins are my two favorite AC games. Origins for the graphics/setting and BF, for well, wel all love BF because...BF.

That said, this may (I'm only 9 hours in) go down as my favorite AC game ever. If you are reading this you probably know the game, and there is no reason to retred. I've only written one other review on steam before (Tex Murphy), so it says something that I'm writing this!

It's fun, it's beautiful and so far the story is holding me. I'm exploring again...it's great.

Stupid design decisions:

- You run from place to place like a berserker on your way to the next main quest and butcher everything on the way. There is no need to play stealthy anymore in all small camps, because soldiers are just stacked together and it is faster to just go in and kill everything
- Everywhere you go, there are collectible ores and plants laying around for some reason. In caves they even hide ores on the ceiling so you have to spam the scan ability to find everything and then climb on every third wall (time consuming and not fun at all...)
- In the level-up menu, everything is just called a "skill". You dont know if its a skill you have to equip to 4 melee or 4 ranged slots, if its a passive or an active ability that is replaced by another button, so you never know how the skill will work
- After every activity you run at least 1000 foot to the next location (game is way too huge with not enough interesting locations you come back to and start to enjoy)
- The game is filled with low quality sidequests (sand watch icon missions), which are way worse than the quests from origins
- Every "boss" human or animal is just an hp sponge which also does more damage to you
- You can unlock the "this is sparta" kick very early in the game, which lets you cheese all kind of enemies, by going on a high place and kicking them down, inflicting tons of damage (ability is also on a very low cooldown)
- Performance is way worse than in Origins
- The combat is slightly more fun, but does not feel really balanced anymore
- Exp boosters and material packs


The game doesnt feel either good or bad, just really mediocre, aside from the graphics.
If you are looking for enormous quantity and can play this game calmly without expecting too much, you can give this game a try for sure and might even find nice moments here and there. However if you expect some exciting challenge, that absorbs you and doesnt feel like a pure hiking chore, you will not enjoy this or the last Assassins Creed pretty much. I would say Syndicate is the best modern Assassins Creed "game" so far, in terms of fun gameplay, story and pacing (vertical map design in dense cities <3). Origins and Odyssey might be the better historical artworks.

TO ME, it is by far the best Assassin's Creed I have ever played - and the best game in 2018.

The Story is engaging and great, the graphics are really good, the Soundtrack is godly (for real though), there is almost too much to do, I am now nearly 40h in and have completed ~30 Percent of the Game.

If you ever planned to go to (antic) greece without buying a time-machine, this game is made for you - it is filled with mythology, historical things - for someone like me, loving greek mythology and history since highschool, this is a dream come true (even though not everything is 100% accurate) - the first time I saw Thermopylae I had the urgent need to kick someone down a well, I don't even know why.

The Voice-Acting of both, Kassandra and Alexios is top-notch - yeah sure, the accent is off sometimes, but It is really nice to have greek actors speaking and acting as the main-characters.


TLDR - It has the witcher-feeling and is, especially if you are a fan of greek history, a dream come true - if you are, it's a must-buy, if you are not it is for you to decide if you like it - it offers a ton of content and different activities, thats for sure.

Completed the game with all achievements and side quests (except for a few minor ones + collectibles) but its hard to give a verdict. I'll try to break it down.

Pros:
[1] Visuals are absolutely stunning. Gorgeous open world with lots of interesting areas to explore.
[2] The main story was interesting with some nice plot twists.
[3] Lots of variety in combat depending on your skill builds.
[4] Cultist system is one of the best implementations of assassination targets and it feels like you are hunting them down by finding clues and moving up the chain.
[5] Crafting system is fun and give you the option of upgrading what you like, albeit at a cost.
[6] The characters are interesting enough to keep me invested. Too bad it's mixed with grindy side quests that do nothing to progress character building.

Neutral:
[1] Naval combat was pretty meh. Nothing special but not bad either.
[2] Mercenary system was fine, it did its job for the most part.
[3] Dialogue options are a good addition to the system but really underused. The main quests has some key choices that do affect the ending, but the rest of the time its inconsequential so you do whatever you like. No paragon/renegade style effects.
[4] The romance options are so bad that they're almost good. Take it as a comedic relief and its fine.

Cons:
[1] The world is just too big with little to "fill" that space with. Cities have copy-pasted buildings and temples and they start to feel like more of the same. Many locations are just barren expanse of nothingness that you have to travel across because there's no fast travel point anywhere nearer.
[2] Level gating. Seriously, I don't want to play the boring and repetitive fetch quests to earn xp just to progress further. Conquest battles are fun the first couple of times, then it just gets boring with underwhelming rewards. XP requirements definitely need a lot of tweaking for the main quest because the side quests are dull af. The grind is too monotonous to be worth the time.
[3] The auto save system is just garbage. It puts you far back from your objective if you die, and there's no other option but to walk/ride there again. Put some more fast travel points for gods sake.
[4] This game is trying really hard to imitate The Witcher 3 but failing to deliver anything close to the story that it provides. In my opinion, the story makes an rpg a good game, not the game mechanics and latest gen graphics. There's definitely potential here but not everything has to be like the witcher.

Conclusion:
Its not a game for everyone. I personally enjoyed it and would like to see it improved with some tweaks. Most people would likely put it down when they hit the mid game grind. Its a shame because the main story is quite interesting if it hadn't been forcefully expanded into this vast open world with copy-paste fetch quests. Cultist and Atlantis storylines are definitely worth completing if you can slog through the level grind. If you like that kind of game then its definitely for you. If you're expecting a story rich rpg like the witcher 3 then skip this game or buy on deep sale.

I have been a huge critic of Ubisoft and the AC series since the last good one (Black Flag)…but Odyssey IMO is a huge success.  Alexios is MILES better than Kassandra, Bayek, & the rest since Kenway and the great Etzio graced the cover.  Not only do you not have to deal with the horrendous campaign of Origins and the incredibly annoying and obnoxious Aya, but you don’t have to deal with Layla as much either in this story.  (Although when she is in the game you feel disconnected from the universe, but still manageable)  Anyways…graphics are amazing and run Hundo P better than origins. Alexios is fun and actually believable and relatable to the actual character unlike Kassandra, which literally makes no sense as a plausible storyline, but hey if you want to play as a female that’s fine with me it’s an RPG.
I understand the issues that people have with the story, etc...but there are so many fun elements that have been improved upon from Origins and the environment is breathtaking and immense.  I will also add that I modded this game in order to fully enjoy the experience which I would recommend to everyone, because the microtransaction problem becomes irrelevant when modding.
Overall, I would recommend this game for anyone looking for an immersive RPG open world game that outshines all its predecessors since AC 2 and AC 4.  Wait to buy the season pass $40 is an absolute mugging.

Review: My Assassins Creed: Odyssey experience so far

The new Assassins Creed as a promised fullblown RPG game.
Which is set in the peloponnes war in greece (404 to 431 b.c.).
I´ve played almost every AC game, expect Syndicate. Because AC felt boring and out of ideas, gameplay wise.
But behold, Origins was a very good game, which I enjoyed to the end.

Now Odyssey picks the formular which made Origins a good game and mixes it with some new gameplay elements.
Decisions that really have a impact, for example.
I had to make a decision if I would kill or save a family that seem to have somekind of virus.
Of course I spared their lifes, just to see the whole land get plagued with their sickness, later in the game. I was shocked and amazed at the same time. I thought that my decision wouldnt make a difference in the Game.
 

World:
The Gameworld is larger and even more beautiful than the World in Origins.
It is packed with locations to discover, boss animals to defeat or beautiful cities to explore.
And dont even get me started with the sea which can be sailed with your own ship.


Combat / Gameplay:
The Combat is the same as you are used to AC games, expect the adition of “abilities” that can be leveld up and be used while in combat.
Its too bad that you cant use a shield like your enemies do.
Depending on the location where you are, enemies are on a higher or lower level than you are.
Which makes some fights really hard and challenging. Some enemies can only be slayed, if you have got a almost equal level as them. Just like in Origins.
The “God Challenges” and “Papyrus Riddles” from Origins make a return in Odyssey.
The Challenges are mighty and majestic animals that you need to track down.
But the “Papyrus Riddles” are only extra perks for your weapons instead of legendary equipment and weapons.
Which is kind of a let down.


Story:
The Story is interesting and versatile. I have played around 36 hours to this date of this review and it feels like that the story is almost as good as the story in AC 2.
Alexios (The protagonist) has character depth to him and even some humor, based on your answers to the NPC´s.
I am curious how long the Main story will take me to finish and how it will end.


Graphics:
The Graphics are just as good or even a bit better than in Origins.
The Lighting is vivid, textures are highly detailed and the performance seems good.
I get around 40-60 fps on a 1920×1080 resolution, with a GTX 1060 (6 Gb), at High to Ultra Settings.
But there is a problem with the texture streaming sometimes.
Some textures seem to take a longer time to load and appear blurry and messed up for a short period.

Conclusion:
A first review of this game, even if I am kind of early in the game.
The Story and gameplay is very good and just got some minor flaws until now.
Alexios is a charismatic and likeable guy, who acts based on your decisions.
The gameworld is vivid and one of the most beautiful I have ever seen.
Even if the Game has some Ghost Recon: Wildlands vibe to it,

I would recommend this game to every Assassins Creed fan or newbies to the franchise.

9/10

One of the best for sure.  The story is good, the world is INCREDIBLE, combat is good, great voice acting, everything is very well done and the SJW's didn't mess it up much at all, thank the gods!  However, there are way too many women warriors, but its tollerable.  Women wear mens armor because- equality I guess?  Some of the mercs look like male bodybuilders with womens voices- really, they should have just made them all men instead of trying to meet a gender quota.  There is a black female pirate leader that looks like a WWE wresler, but that's only 1 bad character out of hundreds so not a major issue.  Almost all of the NPC characters are really good.  The modern day character and her 'girl power' team are just annoying, but you only play her for a few minutes so its not a big deal.  Those are my only complaints, and measured against all of the good things this game offers they are very minor.  

None of the these issues detracted from the overall experience and I highly recommend this game.  It is well worth the $60 price.  All the special editions and add-ons are not needed at all, and don't seem to be of much value.

Скукота и уныние просто не дают играть дальше. Игра оказуалена до безумия. Наиграл 10 часов и до сих пор делаю это через силу, в надежде найти хоть что-то интересное. Все доп. задания делятся на 2 типа: иди и убей и пойди принеси, убив кого-то. Их не хочется выполнять. А неиследованные области на карте? Зачисти лагерь или найди сундук с баблом. Интереса нет вообще. А сюжет игры построен на череде скучных и унылых миссий, благодаря которым нужно будет опять же пойти и убить. Игра про ассасинов и тут нужно убивать, но это настолько уныло сделано, что играть и не хочется. Возле каждого лагеря есть кустик, туда засел и свистишь. Враги всегда по 1 подходят, где их спокойно можно убить на глазах у остальных. А почему? Потому что мы в кустиках. Причем это работает даже в траве по колена. Хочется выйти одному против всех? Да без проблем. Врываешься и вовремя клацаешь уклонение или блок. Всё, лагерь уничтожен. Слишком много недругов? Клацай магический скилл регена здоровья с откатом в 10 секунд. Никаких тактик больше не нужно, не нужно думать, не нужно никого нанимать для упрощения прохождения. Хотя нет, нанимать можно всяких проходимцев на свой великий и могучий корабль, которые дают +2% к урону или защите :D
Ах да, корабль. Круче главного героя здесь только корабль. Только на нем можно выйти в одиночку против 5 противников и победить в бою.
Что радует в игре? Графика, неплохой сюжет. Всё, плюсы закончились.
В игре даже лазить по скалам можно. Практически любой обьект дает возможность на него залезть. Причем теперь не заморачиваются с прорисовкой выступов и элементов декора, по которым можно лазить. Гладкая тестура камня, по которой персонаж просто залетает вверх. Конвеерность не дает прописать детали в игре, которые и цепляют игрока. Все выглядит слишком топорно и примитивно. Игру насильно растянули всем чем только можно.
Вспоминаю первые части игры и сравниваю в с этим конвеерным отстойником. Жирный минус. Жалею о покупке.

首先，这是一个好游戏，毋庸置疑的，形似起源，却几乎完全不同。
然后，这游戏有着刺客信条一贯的作风，就是刺杀超强，总之超强，不过，除了刺杀之外，还有另外两种风格的战斗方式，譬如在下，狂战士流刺客，没办法，手残还没什么耐心，总被发现，然后冲上去砍砍砍·····
最后，被人所诟病的游戏内氪金····这难道不是愿打愿挨的么，装备，又不是打不出来更好的，皮肤，也不会对战斗力造成影响，地图，探索本就是乐趣所在，只能说仁者见仁。









最后的最后······抱歉，你在神教犯了太多的错，余生无法弥补，你去冥界与你手上的鲜血道歉，我在大地上，替你赎罪，沾满鲜血，再见了，诶莫斯····卡珊德拉·····

Just addressing some of the most mentioned points of criticism here:

Grinding: 
If all you ever want do to in this game is the main storyline, then yes, there might be some grinding in between. Otherwise this criticism is laughable. I've overleveled the main story line by some levels just by exploring the sorroundings, killing some enemies and checking out some locations. And still there is so much unexplored non-main-story stuff in my level range left. People who call this game grindy are probably better off playing WoW with an instaboost to level 120 or whatever it is nowadays.

Microtransactions: 
Sure, there are microtransactions available and if the only reason you bought the game for is to whine about something that doesn't affect gameplay at all, then this is indeed a big issue. Otherwise, you could just play the game without ever visiting the store page and not missing out on anything other than some useless crew skins or weapons that you could also come by via the Oikos without spending any real money. 

Performance issues:
The main reason for most of the negative comments here and there are undoubtedly issues with some pc configs. For me this game runs absolutely fine, a lot better than origins. Still, I can understand players frustrated with performance issues and hopefully this will be addressed soon.

In my opinion this is a very solid, pretty addictive game and easily the best entry in the series (unless you care about being a real assassin). Of course your impression may vary as tastes are different. I just wanted to point out that two of the major criticisms found in the reviews are objectively ridiculous unless you're 
a) lazy or spoilt by the modern 'instaboost me to max level and give me legendary loot to start with' rpg-culture
b) outraged by things that don't affect gameplay at all

100% своих денег стоит. Но могли лучше. Основная претензия у меня в том что очень мало взаимосвязи/мало раскрыто отношений между главным персонажем и окружающим его миром. Когда идешь по городу/деревне, очень хочется что бы хоть кто-то вякнул, например "вон там вот правителя убили", а вот у тех "сын сошел с ума". Так же хочется что бы была возможность пообщаться с персонажами не только по кат сценам и сюжетным/побочным линиям (особенно с Гиппократом, Варнавой, Геродотом, Маркосом и даже Фебой). Можно даже без кат сцен. Еще хотелось бы хоть какое-то продолжение романтических отношений или закрепление их. Вот выбрал ты условно пару и все, он с тобой до конца на твоей лодке, раскрытия отношений вот вообще нет, глубоких более менее взаимоотношений можно по пальцам одной руки пересчитать.

I have always been an Assassins Creed Fan and while I didn't play Rogue or Origins I still think I quite enjoy the series. On another note I'm also a big fan of RPGs so when I heard that this game was leaning towards the more RPG side of things I was quite excited and honestly I'm impressed. The game is optimized well I rarely have any framerate drops and have never crashed and the story is quite good.

I have heard some complaints about the grinding for levels later in the story (about level 25 I think), but in my opinion the side quest I find are entertaining enough that I didn't much mind it the grind; even then when I had to grind I only had to gain a level or two to continue the story. Are the side quest as engaging as Witcher 3? I would say not quite, but not far off.  

I would say that if you are a fan of RPGs and have liked the Assassins Creed series since it's debut game, you will most likely enjoy this game as well. The dialogue system which I was honestly concerned with is actually quite decent and the consequences to your selections are not as apparant until later which adds replayability. I would recommend this game at full price as even at this time I'm at about 30+ hours and I don't think I'm close to finishing the game. The Voice acting can be spotty. The male character is quite iffy at times, but I found the female protagonist is more consistent in quality. It's really up for debate.

My overall score would be a solid 8/10. It's not perfect by any means but it's worth the time sink and it gives a lot of fun and freedom to do as you wish!.

PT-BR:
Não era muito fã da franquia AC, porem, depois que mudaram a mecânica do jogo, ficou ótimo.
Prós:
- RPG, a questão das habilidades, 3 tipos de "classes" para alocar o dano.
- Itens, muitos itens, entre armas e equipamentos.
- Diversidade, jogar em montanhas, mar, deserto, árvores, noite, dia.
- Personagens, os personagens são carismáticos.
- Habilidades, muitas habilidades diferentes ajudam a deixa o jogo mais dinâmico.
Contra:
- Repetição, por mais que seja pouca, se você fizer 100% das side quests, você vai enjoar.
- Gameplay, as vezes é meia travada, você toma alguns danos que você desvia porem o jogo não contabiliza.
- Gráficos, os gráficos são ótimos, mas o jogo é pesado, requer um bom PC.
EN-US:
I was not much of a fan of the AC franchise, but after they changed the mechanics of the game, it was great.
Pros:
- RPG, the question of skills, 3 types of "classes" to allocate damage for eg..
- Itens, various types of itens, between weapons and gear.
- Diversity, Playing, Mountains, Sea, Desert, Trees, Night, Day.
- Characters, the characters are charismatic.
- Skills, many different skills help to make the game more dynamic.
Against:
- Repetition, no matter how small, if you do 100% of the side quests, you will get sick.
- Gameplay, sometimes it's half caught, you take some damage that you deflect but the game does not count.
- Graphics, graphics are great, but the game is big, requires a good PC.

사고 매일 10시간씩 한 결과 지난번 오리진 때보다 업적클리어하기가 쉽습니다. 업적만 노리신다면 처음 스타트부터 빠르면 50시간내에도 가능 할 것 같습니다.
가끔 시점이 이상해 질때가 있는데 크게 신경 쓰이진 않습니다.
수집요소가 많고 아이템이 있는 위치나 부가적 스토리를 굉장히 잘 넣어서 몰입도가 높습니다.

오리진과 달라진점
지난작품에 있던 수집적 요소(석판, 무덤파밍)은 남겨 좋았습니다.
암살적 요소를 강화했다곤 하는데 지난 작품보다 활의 비중이 떨어진다는 것뿐이지 어느정도 템이 갖춰지면 오리진때와 비슷합니다. 스킬트리를 무제한으로 찍는게 아니라  레벨 50+ 갖가지 무덤을통한 스킬포인트 등 하면 원하는 스킬칸은 꽉채우고 패시브도 찍을수 있어서 크게 모자란건 못 느꼈습니다.
실질적으로 난이도는 미미하지만 높아졌다 생각합니다.
블랙플래그에서 호평받은 해상전을 따왔는데 블랙플래그 만큼은 아니더라고 해상비중이 나름 있어서 쏠쏠한 재미가 있습니다.

총평 : 스토리 몰입도가 높고 재밌음. 최근에 있었던 패치로 왠만한 버그는 다 사라짐/ 이번작은 정말 잘 만들었습니다. 12월에 DLC도 기대되네요.
//DLC 나온후 계속 수정예정

Its not a bad game at all, but its just boreing as hell if youve played other assasins creed games or witcher games.  the storyline is probly the weakest part of the game, it really feels like theres no point in playing.  the first "bad guy" that appears in the storyline got me all pumped up for an epic chase, and i litterally found him by accident in a cave and killed him like an ordinary enemy with barely anything said about it, now i wander aimlessly following the boreing storyline for no reason at all other than boredom....  the side quests are litterally just there to grind exp and money and offer nothing else, ship combat is fun at first but gets boreing fast, ram, shoot, board, loot....  and always the loot usually sucks.  another huge piss off for me is the "assasination" button when your in position for a good kill, you most likely wont kill your target unless hes some normal low level guard and then a huge messy fight will start.  black flag was probly the peak of this series for me and was probly the only one in the series i actually wanted to finish.  one thing i do like is the spartan kick skill,  pretty fun booting guys off high places for easy kills.  and unless you want to stare at a guys crotch and underwear most of the game, you should probly pick the girl character.... just sayin......

Holy Shit... This game is literally a black stain on the name Assassin's Creed. I played 2 hours. And gave every oppurtunity possible. I tested what mechanics I could. Literally the only thing i enjoyed about this... was the ability to Spartan kick your enemies off ledges.  

First off the mechanics work more like Shadow of War than they do AC. There's no Eagle Vision (which is crucial part of AC), it's entirely free roam on a large open map (not a bad concept) but the movement of the character felt more like Witcher 3 than it did AC. They implemented this lock-on system which only works on enemies (again not bad) but it felt chunky.

No animation for skinning animals or even looting large boxes. It just happens. My character caught fire by running past a Brazier (not through it... past it)  The gear system is wierd... nothing inherently wrong with it i dont guess. just not the same.  

The whole point of Assassin's Creed is that you are a modern day person who has ancestry blood linking you to an important assassin... they only touch on the Animus concept once for like 30 seconds, and it's barely enough to call itself AC.

I DID LIKE: the dialogue options and the choice consequences. As well as the fact that you dont just fail for being seeen on a stealth mission. It actually had in game consequences... however though i enjoyed that... it's not how AC works... your character is supposed to be reliving memories.... so if you stray too far from said memory you desynchronize.... thats how the animus works..

All in All I do NOT recommend... go rebuy AC3 or 4 if you want a truely good AC gameplay.  This is not worth $60. maybe $15.

I've played all sorts of games since the 80's, have tried the most and seen it all, but Assassin's creed odyssey has completely swept my legs away under me. I have never before wanted to play an AC game, killing in more than 1000 bestial way is not for me; - but then 'Kassandra' came! As a woman i think Kassandra make the game way more appealing; - her mimic is amazing, love it. After playing for a few hours in my first AC game ever, I have to say; - never have I seen such a beautiful and polished game, with breathtaking graphics, gameplay and not least, the story, a story that's just fun and exciting. I can hardly imagine how many resources and talents it may have required to make such a game, but sure a lot. I can see that there are a small group of spoiled children who are not satisfied, because they do not think the game is "perfect" in proportion to their expectations, but I think the game deserves a place among some of the best games ever; - maybe the best. MilleDK

Ну что ж, предупреждаю сразу, в обзоре будут спойлеры и мое личное мнение.(я не истина в последней инстанции и вы можете со спокойной душой не соглашаться со мной). 

Начнем с главного, это не AC, это игра с парой-тройкой упоминаний о серии и главным героем в будующем, так же возможно первое длс еще будет именно про Ассассинов, но игра сама по себе вообще не АС. Хорошо это или плохо? Для маркетинга хорошо, ибо бренд раскручен. Для серии эта игра особо ничем не примечательна(ну разве что первое длс к ней кое что нам раскажет о создании скрытого клинка). 

Сюжет. Начнем с главного, сюжет здесь делиться на три ветви. Это поиск матери. Поиск отца, и уничтожение Культистов. Если с поиском матери все довольно банально, то вот ветка с отцом очень даже ничего, особенно концовка, я такого чесно не ожидал. Что до культостов, то тут схема Диких Земель. Семь ветвей по пять пешек, над каждой веткой свой босс, и самый главный босс которого можно раскрыть только убив остальных культистов. Про второстепенные квесты в  Истоках было хуже, в Odyssey я прошел много побочных квестов, и  встретил много запоминающихся миссий где играет роль сложный моральный выбор .Боевка. Многим она зашла, а мне нет это уже немного лишнее, и очень упрощает игру. Ибо реально это уже чистое фентезя. Так же добила прокачка. Серьезно, в Истоках она классная, ты мог сразу прокачать персонажа в трех направлениях, дальний бой, ближний бой и стелс. Можно было комбинировать прокачку. Здесь оставили немного пассивных перков и добавили активные. можно выбрать изначально по 4 для ближнего и дальнего боя, и при прокачке открыть еще четывре перка уже на свое усмотрение. И если в прошлой части ругали Баека за скорострельный лук, за тройную стрелу, то здесь все просто перешло все границы и стало фентезя. Герой не получает повреждений при прыжках с любой высоты, стрелы пролетающие сквозь любые препятствия, чит на невидимость(правда на небольшое время, но все же) и тд.
В общем прокачка и боевка мало дружат с реальностью. 
Вот что пондравилось. Наконец то вернули корабли. Мифические существа топ, жаль их мало. Несколько сюжетных поворотов которых я не ожидал. Размеры мира, они намного больше пространства Истоков (по ощущению). 
По итогу посоветую купить. Но сразу еще раз предупреждаю, это не Assassins Creed, это фентези игра пользуящаяся этим брендом. Ставлю игре 8 баллов из 10 (до 9 не дотянули из-за перков)

PLEASE CONSIDER THIS REVIEW TO BE A "YES, BUT..." KIND OF THING!

[spoiler] So, it turns out in this game that the father of the protagonist is in fact someone special. With all the knowledge from previous Parts of the AC series in combination with greek mythology and heroes, one may now assume that means the character is in fact a true heros, a demigod (or in this case half-precursor). Well, that is not the case. He/She is the child of Pythagoras, the philosopher and mathematician. While he is a significant person still today, this REALLY took me out after hoping for a true mythological background, being a big fan of ancient myths. So for everyone who is familiar with Perseus, Herakles or even percy Jackson, you are not in for a treat. And I must say, I see no particular reason for this decision, they had the mythological "precedence" and the perfect opportunity to appease the kind of myth-versed audience, but they blew it for some reason. And please don't tell me it was necessary for story-related reasons, they could EASILY have worked with the other premise. Up until the reveal I was fascinated and wanted to know the truth, now I am taken aback and will likely take a break for a few days to cope with the immense disappointment stemming from their massive buildup only to drop the ball at the end. That REALLY took me out of the whole game. 

In case you are wondering what made me think that in the first place:
1) The character's close bond with an eagle, that is even commented on in the game many times; the eagle is - next to lighting - THE symbol of Zeus (and Zeus having a theme of bonking human women, so he'd be the perfect father-candidate).
2) The supernatural combat abilities, that can not be explained in any other meaningful way.
3) The incredible buildup as if pointing towards a truly monumental reveal.
4) General familiarity with greek mythology, where most of the true heroes are demigods.
5) Having to kill many of the mythological creatures that in canon have had their asses handed to them by one or the other demigod heros (Herakles for more than one of them).[/spoiler]

That out of the way, this game is NOT an Assassin's Creed, at least not in the way the brand was set up over a decade ago (even taking into account more recent changes). Everything from the levelling and skill tree over the equipment to the map and exploration experience is more akin to a Witcher 3. On the plus side, this means there are dialogue options, so jippie to that.

The story is somewhat dull, the character not bad but also not really good, but the world is fantastic. Everything looks beautiful.

The graphic designers really gave their best in many cases (and I say that as someone with a degree in Archeology); still too many statues are white, though (only about ~40% are painted in the game). Obviously liberties have been taken, but mostly due to the necessary scaledown of the land (riding for kilometers on end would likely only appease 1% of the playerbase, so everything but certain areas needed to be reduced in size: Athens is huge, but by no means as large as a real city, whereas the Acropolis there is about 1:1 approximately). There even are a few tidbits hidden in plain sight the unschooled eye might miss, such as the Boxer at Rest statue standing (or rather sitting) in several cities in the game.

The combat includes battles for the domination over a state (either by Sparta or Athens) that you can take part in. And no, they do not fight in the Phalanx. And I get why, this would have required an entirely seperate combat system for those battles.
Speaking of combat, while the older parts of the series may have presented the protagonists as somewhat superhuman, this is WAY out of proportion in Odyssey [spoiler] further hints towards possible demigod status? NOPE[/spoiler], like being able to create flame on your weapon, raging, kicking enemies (in a funny 300 reference) so far as 30 meters, firing remote-controlled arrows and such. Interesting, but about as grounded as a balloon. It COULD have made sense, if only...no, I'm not dropping this yet.

So for people who want to play an old-style Assassin's Creed, this is not for you. For those who want to explore a representation of ancient Greece, more so, despite my personal distaste for the design choice I had to put in spoilers.

Giving you a heads up before i get into this, i am not finished with the game yet and i will tell you why in the next line.
As of this moment i have 60+ hours into one save file and around hour 20 i got a bug where my fast travel got glitched and stopped working.

Now normaly this is not a problem as most games have an easy way of getting around even without fast travel.
Unfortunalty, this is not one of them.
The horse is stupidly slow inside all cities and villages to the point that it's faster to just run.
The ship takes forever to cross the sea between the 15+ islands and there is so many pirates that "Scales" with your level, so upgrading your ship is pretty much useless.

But to get back on the point.
I diden't mind most of these things but what put the nail in the coffin for me and is causing me to not recomend this game is the shoody game mechanics and ubisofts terrible bug fixing.
The fast travel problem has been here for over 1 week and all i have gotten from Gubisoft is "We are looking into it"
Geee Thanks guys, that's very helpfull.

And to top it all of several quests like hunting the Kreatin bull is incompleteble due to it falling through the world and being unlootable.

All in all i will give this game
6,5/10 for story
3/10 gameplay
8/10 Kassandras looks
1/10 costumer support

基本上70个小时把80%以上的游戏内容玩完了。
这作的质量上是很不错的，育碧在游戏中的历史部分下了很多功夫看的出来，各种地名和人物看过希腊历史书籍的都看到了很多历史上活生生的名人在你面前，这点很棒。配合这作的画面可以说是把希腊活生生的显现在了你的面前。
缺点也是有，优化有点不尽人意。GTX1080开全最高仍不能60，不知道1080TI有没有问题。但是1060等以下的显卡体验就可能会受到影响。而且这个读盘速度也太。。。逼我把这个游戏装进了SSD里面。佣兵系统做的有一点多余，感受不到佣兵系统的乐趣。
而且这作好不容易是添加了一个比较不错的征服战新战斗玩法（类似FOR HONOR)，但是感觉被育碧做的有点烂，完全成了一个游戏里多余的系统。
而且征服打完后只是给你一个面板上面显示奖励和经验，感觉就像做了一个普通支线一样没有成就感。
如果满分十分的话我给这作8.5，比起源进步很多，但是仍可以更好。

Not a big fan of the other games. I heard good things about Origin, so when this one came out, i decided to give it a go. I am really surprised by the quality we have here compared to previous games, and i feel like Ubisoft started to actually care again.

I actually think it's well worth his full price, so go for it. It's a pretty long game, so just relax, have fun, and enjoy :)

This game is scratching my open-world itch post-Witcher 3. I have to say it's seriously impressive -- far beyond what I expected. Graphically it's by far one of the most sophisticated games I've played. 

This is my first AC game and I suppose because it's such a long-running franchise I was expecting something generic and rushed. But this is anything but. The story is actually quite good and the characters even better -- I especially like Kassandra.

The Witcher 3 is up there among my favorite games ever, and yet I can definitively say AC: Odyssey improves on its open-world formula in many ways and also feels a lot more polished. Geralt's movement feels downright antiquated compared to Kassandra's in particular.

Also, aside from cutscenes being in 16:9, this game's 21:9 ultrawide support is basically perfect. It really reminds me why I got a gaming PC.

I've played every single AC game since 1, and I can honestly say that this is up there with 2 and Origins {Which I thought was also phenominal}.  Also this game will give you an instant orgasm if you're a history buff.

И вот я наиграл в эту игру 50 часов и у меня сложилось некоторое мнение.И вот ,что я скажу эта игра хорошая,но это не тот Ассасин которого мы привыкли видеть, когда я играл в эту игру было впечатление ,что это Фэнтези вот эти способности: невидимка,замедление времени и т.п. Если бы в начале названия этой игры не было слова Ассасин то я бы даже не подумал ,что это игра про наших любимых убийц.Ну ,а теперь пройдёмся по минусам и плюсам данной игры ну во первых мне понравилось окружение солнечная и обширная Греция очень красивая и влюбляет тебя с первых минут игры этого просто не предать словами,дальше это битвы на кораблях их вернули со старых частей и как по мне это плюс мне очень нравятся морские битвы,дальше это размер карты она довольно большая и не пустая и да для меня лично на этом плюсы заканчиваются.Теперь минусы их к слову больше чем плюсов,ну сначала идёт история она не достоверна,потом баги их очень много и это на 50 часах ,а что будет на 100 или 150 это жесть то персонаж или NPC сквозь текстуру провалятся то конь то персонаж решит ,как бог ходить по воздуху и т.д,следующим у нас идёт ИИ он тупой до невозможности ,но это не значит ,что вы не будете подыхать ИИ хоть и тупой ,но у него дофига здоровья и урона и он вас будет убивать очень часто,продолжает на путь минусов, донат ну да его тут пофиксили уменьшили надобность в нём поэтому это не очень большой ,но минус,дальше паркур персонаж так не реалистично цепляется за голую поверхность ,что хочется смеяться до смерти.Вывод:ну и на этом я закончу вообщем-то я очень люблю серию Ассасина ,но я вижу ,как это франшиза скатывается и мне от этого очень грустно моя оценка этой игре 8/10.

Mudar para RPG, na minha opinião, foi bom demais, joguei o Origins e o Odyssey agora, e achei os dois maravilhosos, agora é esperar se eles vão mudar o estilo denovo, pra antigamente ou algum outro, ou continuar nessa pegada RPG. 10/10 pra esse Odyssey, conteúdo que só a porra no game.

I've been a fan of Assassin's Creed since 2013...and this is amazing!!! Though its not a typical Assassin's creed game!!... I've loved it..and this is the first game that I bought.....

Honestly just don't waste your time or money buying this game. It's a another action adventure rpg that does nothing unique. Progress is slowed down to make you want to buy in the game "time savers" and other microtransactions. Sailing in the game is one of the main means of transportation and it's bad to say the least. Ubisoft did sailing better in Black Flag where it was actually fun, in Odyssey it's just wasting time and boring. The combat system is over complicated for an Assassin's Creed game, ablities, perk trees, and damage stats don't sit well with the series where you're suppose to be this badass assassins. AC 2 introduced it in a small scale which was fine because you know armor but here it's just this person has x amount of health because levels/difficulty. Areas in game are pseudo locked behind levels which is pointless due to the fact the game scales to your level. Ubisoft has run itself into a rut of making these copy cat open world action adventure rpg that they don't want to deviate any bit from. Honestly a waste of money and time

AC: Odyssey was the first game I've played in a long time where I actually had FUN. I'm new to the AC franchise so I can't compare this to previous AC games, but as a standalone I really like it.

RE: Exp grind
There has been plenty of criticism about the exp grind and stuff. Personally, I don't find that to be the case at all. I hit max level about 65% into the main quest, and I'm not even OCD about completing every objective before moving on. If you do a couple of location objectives / sidequests alongside the main quest, you shouldn't have a problem with exp. There are also plenty of repeatable (albeit boring) 'side quests' that offer a ton of exp for something simple, like killing an NPC or delivering an item.

RE: Microtransactions
I'm someone who's quite liberal about spending on lootboxes, but I haven't felt the urge to make a single microtransaction in this game. I was worried that the game was balanced around microtransactions, but upon finishing it I can say that I haven't spent anything extra on microtransactions, and have needed nothing from the cash shop to thoroughly enjoy the game. 

RE: Resource grind
Resource cost for upgrading gear is pretty insane. If you're upgrading your gear at the blacksmith every level for some reason, then yes, you will run out of resources. However, gear upgrades drop all the time in the game. If you replace your gear with upgrades that you find (like in a regular RPG), and only upgrade your "endgame gear" when you're near/at max level, then resources aren't much of a problem.  

----

Pros:
+ Kassandra <3  
+ Overall, the 3 'main' plot lines were interesting; they kept me intrigued despite the length.
+ Really large game, huge map, good amount of content and exploration, long quest chains.
+ Beautiful graphics!
+ Plain FUN: Sparta-kicking people off cliffs, scaling every imaginable surface, chain assassinations, blowing people's heads off with arrows that hit like cannonballs, naval battles, investigating a cult, etc. 
+ Romance options are mostly hilarious. They're definitely shallow as far as RPG relationships go, but the blatant flirting and general horniness from the MC/NPCs make me laugh every time. 
+ Voice acting is pretty good overall, although there were some moments where I felt like the voices were over-dramatised.
+ Kassandra <3  

Cons:
- Illusion of choice: Unlike 'full' RPGs, only a handful of options throughout the dialogue actually has consequences.
- Some of the animations look a little clunky / repetitive
- Personally, the endings / conclusions of the main plotlines were kind of a let down for me. The journey definitely >>> the destination in my case. This was the biggest flaw for me, because I had so much fun during the 100 hours of gameplay, only to be let down at the end by a mediocre ending. YMMV though.
- Replayability: Considering that dialogue options matter so little, I wouldn't be replaying it to see different outcomes. I also haven't seen much of endgame content at the moment. 

----

Overall, compared to a 'proper' RPG, the story / choice elements are lacking a little, but overall, it's still a great game that provided me about a hundred hours of solid fun. And a new pixel wife, because Kassandra is amazing.

Assim como muitos o último contato que tive com a franquia foi no AC 3, não por não ter gostado do jogo ou algo do tipo, mas sim porque na época a franquia se tornou ao meu ver um tanto monótona, em que todo ano era lançado um novo jogo com aquele estilo "mais do mesmo", com mudanças pouco significativas no gameplay e personagens pouco carismáticos.

Acompanhei o anúncio de Odyssey na E3 e desde lá o jogo me chamou a atenção no que estava se propondo a inovar, aproximar a franquia ao gênero de RPG que tem se tornando popular ultimamente com o sucesso de the witcher 3. Resolvi dar uma chance ao jogo.

Não poderia ter feito uma compra melhor, realmente o jogo superou todas as minhas espectivas. Graças a ele e somado com minha vagabundagem, estou agora com 4 trabalhos atrasados e uma prova na semana que vem que ainda não consegui ter vontade de estudar, Odyssey realmente me FISSUROU na franquia novamente.

Enfim, a minha ideia era justamente escrever esta análise mais como um relato pessoal de como me senti jogando o jogo, do que uma análise mais técnica a respeito da qualidade do mesmo. No mais posso garantir pra vocês que o jogo TA BOM PRA KRL. Com uma história bem imersiva, me fez voltar aos tempos de pré-adolescência em que eu voltava da escola com vontade de ficar o dia inteiro jogando (e o melhor, sem culpa nenhuma).

Ubisoft queriendo hacer en 2 años lo que a Witcher 3  le tomó 4(es clara la influencia,junto con Shadow of Mordor/War)  ... En la parte de gameplay siguen fuerte, aunque extraño usar escudo,se podría tener la opcion de galopar en el caballo...en lo naval siguen muy bien, opciones mejoradas... podriamos volver un poco al esconder bien los cuerpos como en Black Flag...pocas quejas en este aspecto...se nota el cambio de identidad que esta atravesando la serie,pero, esperaba más...una historia que se arrastra a veces ,de lo pesada que es, personajes secundarios (que en este tipo de juegos,son los que de verdad dan vida al juego, acompañando al heroe en su viaje...) lisos al mismo nivel que los protagonistas, se recurre a personajes de la vida real (¡por favor, mejoren el aspecto de desarrollo de personajes!) que logran la misma profundidad de carácter que los principales,muy liviana... un mundo enorme lleno de cosas medianamente interesantes que se siente abrumador, no por el contenido, sino por la calidad de la promesa (a medias cumplida) de ser un gran juego...
Lo terminaré a ver si en lo que resta de la odisea la historia repunta... Ubisoft, por favor, dejen descansar la franquicia minimo 3 años, abarquen menos y muerdan mejor, les tengo mucha esperanza...

Lo recomiendo si te gustan los juegos de mundo abierto con una historia emotiva en muchos momentos que te permite tener grandes desiciones pero no demasiadas tampoco.
