На платиновое прохождение ушло 100 часов. 
Пройдено 986 километров и убито 5410 противников.

Игра значительно превосходит предшественницу в лице AC Origins, на платиновое прохождение которой ушло 56 часов и где было пройдено 574 километра и убито 3339 противников.

В отличие от Origins, где было обилие дополнительных заданий, а сюжет практически отсутствовал, здесь появился вменяемый и цельный вертикальный сюжет. 

Определённо могу сказать, что эта часть была для меня одной из самых уморительных. Иногда юмор в ряде дополнительных (да и сюжетных) заданий просто убойнейший, а иногда такой, что складывалось впечатление, будто авторы южного парка решили остаться, чтоб поработать над сюжетами в Одиссее. Анекдот из AC Origins: "Греки придумали оргии, а римляне придумали позвать на них женщин" раскрыт целиком и полностью. Такого градуса трэша, угара и содомии в серии я не помню.

В целом, проходить игру было приятно и из-за обилия контента можно сказать, что она стоит своих денег, но, к сожалению, прорывом она не стала.

Графика продолжает радовать глаз и за время прохождения успел наделать свыше ста снимков. Иногда огорчала дальность прорисовки, но мыло в фоторежиме прекрасно борется с уродством вдали.

Что касается оптимизации, то к ней у меня вопросов не возникло. На 1070 играл на максимальных настройках графики и FPS ниже тридцати не падал (для кого-то этого мало, но мне вполне нормально).

Тем не менее, пять проблем с технической частью мне встретились:
- Забагованное DLC: Blind King, где нельзя облутать сундук и завершить квест, если ты облутал его раньше (сделать это легко, ибо сундук чуть ли не в самом начале).
- Есть квесты, которые можно взять, но которые не появляются в списке заданий. В таком случае спасает только сохранение и загрузка (после загрузки они тут же выплывают).
- Было один раз, когда не засчитался пункт для закрытия исследования места, но спас откат к предыдущему сохранению и повторное выполнение действия.
- Иногда при загрузке сохранения во время игры (допустим, чтобы выбрать другой вариант диалога) она зависает намертво и приходится её перезапускать. Сталкивался с таким около десяти раз.
- Есть проблема с парой достижений в Steam. То, что в Uplay засчитано на 100%, в стиме почему-то не засчитано.

Продолжая говорить о проблемах (которые некоторым могут показаться плюсами), стоит упомянуть, что игра страдает чрезмерной открытостью и живым миром. Как будто в неё вселился дух S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 
Сперва я думал, что это касается только контрактов. Так, получив контракт у двух стоящих рядом людей, можно отправиться выполнять эти контракты, сделать их, а на обратном пути стать свидетелем картины, где:
На этих двоих напал дикий зверь, один дубасит зверя мечом, второй схватил метлу и дубасит его метлой, зверь убивает человека с метлой и контракт автоматически проваливается, в это время мимо проходит спартанский отряд и убивает всех вокруг, в итоге и второй контракт проваливается.
К сожалению, такое может произойти во время выполнения дополнительных заданий:
Я взял задание (не контракт) на убийство предводителя одного из островов, но выполнять его не стал, ведь на карте было столько знаков вопросов. И вот я граблю амбар на острове, который находится в километре от острова, где правит предводитель, спокойно себе поджигаю припасы армии и тут мне приходит уведомление мол задание выполнено и предводитель мёртв. То есть пока я занимался своими делами, его забил насмерть какой-нибудь отряд грубиянов, либо же он неудачно погладил рысь или льва.

Открытость порой сказывается и на основном сюжете. К сожалению, отсутствие скриптов и ограничений не всегда сулят хорошие впечатления. Так можно исследовать мир, как я, залезть в какие-нибудь кусты, чтобы справить исследовательскую нужду, и там случайно зашибить квестового врага, которого по сюжету можно понять и простить в следующих главах. В таком случае в соответствующей главе придётся лишь констатировать факт, что этого человека пришлось убить и, соответственно, пропустить кусок сюжета с ним связанный.
Хотя стоит признать, что есть моменты, где это обыграно достойно и персонаж говорит что-то в духе "А я уже всё сделал". Но иногда излишняя тяга к исследованию может кончиться тем, что катсцены во время выполнения задания просто не будет и оно автоматически будет выполнено, после чего начнётся следующее задание.

Возвращаясь к контрактам, можно сказать, что они портят впечатления об игре, ибо однотипные, скучные и, скорее всего, генерируются автоматически и бесконечно: подай, принеси, убей. В лучшем случае они засчитываются сразу после убийства. В худшем ты берёшь такой контракт на доске объявлений на западном краю острова, бежишь пешком до колосистых полей на восточном краю острова, находишь бабушку, у которой налётчики отобрали честь, бежишь в логово налётчиков на западном краю острова, отбираешь у них честь бабушки, а затем бежишь обратно на восточный край острова, чтобы вернуть бабушке её честь.

Как я уже написал выше, вертикальный сюжет, который мы наблюдаем в анимусе, хороший и история подана цельно и закончено, чего нельзя сказать о горизонтальном сюжете.

К сожалению, именно из-за этого игра и не стала прорывом (по крайне мере для меня). Ведь те смелые сюжетные повороты, которые были заложены в горизонтальном сюжете Origins, здесь реализованы не были. Более того, имеет место мейнстримная открытая концовка, которые я не люблю. Я ожидал, что на этой части серия игр получит хоть какое-то логическое завершение, но ошибся. Теперь можно говорить о том, что игра скорее получила возможность получить продолжение, но в ещё большем охвате, чем были в ней во всех предыдущих частях. А вот подробности этого уже будут спойлером, поэтому раскрывать не буду.

Буду надеяться, что в следующей игре серии горизонтальный сюжет будет на таком же уровне, что и вертикальный.

I have played this game for 17 hours and I've not even uncovered a 10th of the map. Things I have done so far include:

-Touching a god's peepee

-Kicking a bear to death and then cutting off its balls

-Sleeping with an old lady with her husband's consent

-Getting eaten by sharks

-Riding my horse off a cliff and he died (but I didn't)

-Spent like 2 hours in the menus trying to hit 60 fps somehow

-Teleporting behind guards (nothing personnel kid)

-Getting set on fire even more than in Origins

-Wearing stupid hats

Seriously this game is so much f***ing fun. That said, you need a monster rig to run it at a solid 60 fps and higher settings. On my Ryzen 1700/GTX 1080 I can get a reasonably solid 50 fps at 1512p and High settings but 60 fps is just off the table. It's a CPU problem. I think if you have a 2700X, 8700K, or Threadripper CPU you might be OK but if you're running an i5 or first-gen Ryzen (or anything older) you're likely going to have to target a lower frame rate than 60 fps if you want consistent performance.

That said, I'm enjoying the game so much I just have to recommend it.

Поиграв в это чудо , у меня сложилось двоякое мнение , вроде бы Одиссея это огромное ДЛС к Истокам , а с другой стороны это совершенно новая игра . Её ты точно не будешь рекомендовать друзьям и не будешь её критиковать . Это не ассассин , это нечто другое .
Графика +-
Абсолютно такая же графика как и в истоках , те же текстурки , но только из-за древней Греции и прекрасных закатов это графика шикарна.
Геймплей (боёвка , доп.квесты) +-
Попытка сделать франкейштейа из разных игры вышла спорной . Кастрированная версия наёмников из Теней Мордора , такая же кастрированая и топорная боёвка из Тёмных душ . Квесты которое попадаются на доске обьявлений однотипные и с повторяющимся диалогами , не берите их , а вот квесты которое мы можем найти именно в игре со сюжетом и лучше . 
Играя в Одиссею , я сразу разобрался в управлении , куда идти , что делать в крепостях и т.д. Почему эта игра так похожа на Истоки , почему опять делают конвеер? Зачем?
Сюжет + 
Ничего говорить не буду , потому что это один огромный СПОЙЛЕР , скажу лишь одно , это не месть.

Assassin's Creed Odyssey builds on the foundations of Origins, pressing deeper into the action RPG territory that Origins sought to make it's mark on. For the most part, it succeeds. There is a huge amount to see and do here, most of it well crafted with an eye for detail. The quests offer plenty of variety, in both the activity and the characters involved. The world is expansive and filled to the brim with detail. The combat is engaging, although it takes some time to get used to the finesse of it. The main story line, while not extremely thrilling, offers enough engagement to keep the player wanting for more information on the mysteries at hand. This entry in the Assassins Creed series also does away with a lot of 'real world' Abstergo vs. Assassins gameplay, so far I've only been pulled out of the Animus once and I had the choice to re-enter it immediately. PERSONALLY, this is a welcome change. I feel that myself and many fans are fine with knowing less about the modern day events in the series when it means greater engagement in the meat of the game.  

As always, there are also some negatives. The world is huge and detailed, packed full of a large number of activies, almost to an intimidating degree. It can be difficult at times to decide what should be done next and also makes the experience feel a tad directionless. The quests, while varied, are hit and miss in their levels of excitement. Some will see you gallop across the country side, fighting bandits and searching for lost treasure while others will have you walk 100m and talk to another NPC, finishing the quest. The weapon's and armour you come across, are thrown away for another piece of gear faster than you can blink sometimes. While this keeps you on the hunt for better gear, and it's not an unenjoyable hunt, it significantly cheapens finding any item of value, as it will be irrelevent in 10 minutes of playtime.

So far, I've had a great time with AC Odyssey and I plan to put in a lot more hours. Ubisoft seems to be onto a good thing. The transition from Action/Adventure to Action RPG has been relatively smooth and is a welcome change from what was arguably becoming a stale and uninteresting series. Simply put, if you liked AC Origins or are an RPG fan in general there's plenty here for you.

Right from the beginning I want to say this game is much more fun than Origins was, despite the many issues I take with this game. I will be comparing this game to Origins for various reasons, mostly as it's the most recent and familiar game that people will have experience with. I will also compare some aspects to Black Flag (which is my fav AC game by a huge amount)

Good Things: 
- Character development is much better than Origins
- Characters and the overall Story is far more engaging and likeable than Origins.
- The scenery is beautiful, very creative and detailed areas.
- The fighting mechanics are an improvement from Origins, and feel nice to use.
- A lot more Isu (precursor / 1st Civilization) content. 
- Exploring the world via your ship is completely open, unlike in Black Flag where you would dock and load an area, this world is completely open, travel as you please.

Bad Things:
- Enemies take way too many hits to kill. I don't see Ubisoft changing this as it was the same in Origins.
- Ship / Ocean experience is very boring and no where near as fun as it was in Black Flag.
- I see absolutely no difference in difficulty other than slight changes to enemy health and damage output they do to you. Higher difficulty does nothing to make this more of a challenge, it only makes it more of an endurance fight. For me, it's a waste of time, and isn't a skill-based difficulty increasement. To make a game like this more difficult I would change the time to react to things, and the widow in which you can react to them.
- Slightly grindy, you have to level up to continue the story quests, forcing you to do side-quests a bit more than I personally would like to.

The Worst Thing: 
- Performance issues. This game is not optimized properly. It is clear that they are using the same engine used to create origins, there is no graphical improvements, the overall usage and mechanics within the game are near identical. I can play Origins on maximum settings and not drop bellow 60fps, however this game on settings between High and Very High, a lot of the time the FPS will vary between 40 and 60. Ubisoft has stated that they aimed for High settings on the recommended hardware to only reach 30 FPS, which is an enormous disappointment considering that this isn't even a Console port, there was a separate development team just for the PC version, and this is what we get. Hopefully an update or perhaps a driver update can help improve this.

Why I recommend it?: 
Despite those bad things, the game is great entertainment and fun to play. That's about it gg.

[h1]Imádom.[/h1]
Szeretem az AC sorozatot, régen is sokat játszottam velük, illetve a könyveket is olvastam. Vártam az Origins-t is, mivel az utolsó "régi" AC részekkel már nem igazán volt kedvem játszani, úgy gondoltam ráférne már egy vérfrissítés. Sajnos az előző rész nem hozta azt, amit vártam(Ba(l)yek, a helyszín, illetve a páncélok se tetszettek.), így félve vettem meg az Odysseyt.  Nem csalódtam, eszméletlenül szép a táj, öröm felfedezni. Rajongója vagyok a görög kultúrának, rengeteg szép történelmi épület található meg a játékban.

[b]Küldetések[/b]
Sokkal átláthatóbb lett a küldetés rendszer véleményem szerint, emellett rengeteg véletlenszerű feladattal is találkozhattok a játék során. Végre nem csak annyi a dolgod, hogy menj el ide, öld meg azt, hallgasd ki. Van a karaktereknek értékrendjük és aszerint cselekszenek, megismerheted közben őket. Érdemes side questeket csinálni, mivel idővel nélkülük nehéz lesz haladni a storyban.

[b]AI[/b]
Sajnos itt vérzik legjobban ez a rész(ahogy az elődjei is), egyszerűen buta az AI, érdemes a legnehezebb fokozaton játszani normális játékélményért. Szerencsére a harcrendszer nehézsége kárpótol valamennyire.

[b]Grafika és rendszerigény[/b]
Videókat érdemes nézni, sokat nem tudok mondani, szép a grafikája. Egyenlőre sokat kér, viszont lehet csalni a köd kikapcsolásával, illetve a DOF minimalizálásával.

[b]Karakterek[/b]
Szerethető karaktereket kaptunk, Alexios mimikája kissé el van túlozva, de nekem jobban bejött a stílusa. Sajnos a választás nem folyásolja be a történetet, örültem volna, ha 1-1 külön storyt kaptunk volna.

[b]Harc- és skillrendszer[/b]
Tetszik az RPG-s vonal, szerintem jót tett a szériának. A hunter szálat kissé gyengének érzem, sokkal élvezetesebb a másik kettővel érvényesülni. Saját magad döntheted el, hogy hogyan akarsz boldogulni a játékban.(Bár a csatákban sajna csak a közelharcnak veszed hasznát kb.)

Összességében ajánlom, a Season Pass tartalmait is várom, elég érdekes kontentet ki lehet a görögök mitológiájából hozni, remélem sikerül majd az ubinak.

[b]Esetleges negatívumok[/b]
[list]
    [*]Jelenleg még optimalizátlan kissé.
    [*]Mikrotranzakciók(Engem nem zavarnak, nem köteleznek rájuk.)
    [*]Idétlen viselkedésű AI-k.
    [*]Néhány textúrabug, amit javítani fognak gondolom. Összesen 3al találkoztam a 30 óra alatt.
[/list]

어쌔신크리드 오디세이(10월 5일부터 플레이) 41시간(탐색모드) 리뷰

먼저 이 게임은 정보를 직접 찾아서 퀘스트를 해야 하는 탐색모드와 정보를 제공해주는 일반모드가 있다. 제작진의 의도와 맞는 플레이를 원한다면 탐색모드 하라는 말에 탐색모드로 플레이

퀘스트목표를 찾아야 하는 수고 때문에 완료하는 데에 오래 걸리지만 그만큼의 재미를 줌.


스킬) 암살자, 무쌍 둘 다 가능하게 구성한 스킬트리. 38레벨 찍고 웬만한 스킬 다 찍었지만 웬만하면 암살 위주로 플레이 중.  다양한 스킬을 통한 개성있는 암살, 전투 가능. 초반에는 암살자 위주로 스킬트리를 올렸는데, 무조건 전투를 해야 하는 씬이 발생하면 꽤나 고생함 ★★★★

파밍, 아이템) 파밍 템이 잘 뜨는 편. 하지만 아이템 강화하는 데에 템이 너무 많이 소비 됨. 22렙템을 37렙으로 강화하려면 약 1천 500개의 재료가 필요. 그래서 고렙으로 올라갈수록 스킬 때문에 쉬워지는 것이 아닌 아이템 차이로 난이도 상승.
전설 템 구하기 힘듦. 이전 시리즈 '오리진'에서는 파피루스 문서로 전설템 파밍이 가능했지만 '오디세이'에서는 교단의 인물을 암살해야 얻을 수 있음. '탐색 모드' 때문인지 교단 인물 찾기도 힘들 뿐더러 렙차 때문에 못 잡는 게 대부분. ★★★

퀘스트 ) 페르시아전쟁-스파르타(영화 300), 펠로폰네소스 전쟁 배경의 현재 스토리. + 그리스로마신화 : 역사적 배경으로 재밌는 스토리 구성 
다양한 선택지의 퀘스트. 각 서브퀘마다 스토리가 있어서 좋은 데다가 내용도 흥미진진함. 그런데 한 퀘스트에 달성해야 할 목표가 많아서 진도가 빠르게 안 나감. 여기에는 방대한 맵 크기도 한 몫함. ★★★★

해상전 ) 함선 레벨은 크게 중요하지 않음. 컨트롤만 좋으면 함선의 질이 낮아도 고레벨 적함대 격파 가능 ★★★★★


위쳐3, 미들 오브 어스, 기존 어쌔신크리드 장점을 섞어 갓겜으로 거듭남. 



보통 이런 선택지 게임은 위쳐처럼 기본적으로 3회차 정도 플레이 해야 하는데, 41시간을 해도 1회차를 못 끝냈다. ㄹㅇ... 강의 끝나고 과제 끝내고 하는 일이 이거밖에 없어서 요즘 사람이랑 대화 많이 안 함ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ

Great game so far, adding choices into AC really makes it shine.

However, they still seem opposed to lending those choices historic meaning.
So don't think you can change the outcome of the Peloponesian war with those battles - they do nothing but add exp.

Many great historical games, such as Paradox or TW titles, is build on history as a base with the posibility to change the outcome as key part of the experience (like rebuilding the Roman Empire... again). This could have been great to see in this game - the ability to change history to lend depth and weigth to your ingame choices (it sure wouldn't work with AC lore or the hardcore fans of that, but man, what an amazing rpg it would be - especially for us history nerds that prefer to skip the AC lore and just enjoy the historical setting).

Anyway, this title is still my favorite for other reasons: massive world, interesting quests, fair characters, and overall just content that has both breadth and depth. I'm just thankful this title hit me while I had some time off.

Very much recommened if you have the specs - but be very sure to check this.

Gameplay:
#Hauptquest sehr interessant mit guten Stimmen vertont.
#Eroberungen/Verteidiegen von Gebieten mit Schlachtgemetzel/Massenschlachten ist neu und macht Spass
#Unterhaltsame Seekämpfe auf Schiffen vergleichtbar mit Black Flag mit Einschränkungen (wenig verschiedene Schiffe, Kanonen machen mir persönlich einfach mehr Spass auf Schiffen als Brandpfeile/Speere)
#Extrem viele Nebenquests.
#Spielzeit inkl Nebenquests locker über 50 Stunden

Gibt ein paar Dinge die mich bei Nebenquests stören, würde aber zu sehr ins Detail gehen. Hier ein Beispiel:
Viele Nebenquests im Grunde repetitiv unauthentisch- Man spricht wildfremde Leute an, die rumstehen wie nicht abgeholt und fragt sie ob man ihnen irgendwie helfen kann- Wer macht das nicht den ganzen Tag?!  *g* , Anwort: Klar.. bring Person(en) Variable: X1 um weil Grund Variable:AZ . Natürlich !! *g*  . Die Gründe sind dabei teilweise grenzwertig. Einmal musste ich jemand umbringen nur weil er ner Frau Gedichte geschrieben hat und Sie aber kein Bock auf ihn hatte ohne weitere Begründung.

Grafik:
Sehr gut, vergleichbar mit Witcher 3 oder Origins.

Performance:
#Nach 35h Spielzeit kein einziger Absturz oder technisches Problem.
#GEFORCEEXPERIENCE empfiehlt mir 2560x1440 (2k) mit niedrigen/mittleren Einstellungen.
#Mit 4k auf 3840x2160 mit niedrig flüssig spielbar allerdings um die 21 fps.
#Mit 2560x1440 auf Hoch um die 26 fps.  (aktuell spiele ich so)
#Wie bei Witcher3 kann trotz offensichtlich relativ niedriger fps das Spiel flüssig und mit relativ guter Qualität gespielt werden. Bei Andromeda war das z.B. nicht der Fall. Woran das liegt kann ich nicht sagen, wenns jmd. weiß würde mich interessieren ;) . Mit meinem etwa 4 Jahre alten Laptop kann ich mich nicht beschweren was Performance angeht, im Gegenteil.

Hardware:
Predator G9-791
I7-6700HQ 2.60Ghz
16GB DDR4
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980M

Прощаемся с каноничным ассасином , и всем что с ним связано. Юбики сделали новую отличную рпг, но заголовок Assassin's Creed нужно было бы убрать. 
Что понравилось :
1) Круто прописанные сайд квесты, разрабы явно вдохновились CD Project.
2) Кат сцены, с диалогами. Я в обзоре на Origins писал, что мне не хватило хороших кат сцен в сайд квестах. Исправились!
3) Человеку который был 3 раз в Греции , а именно в Афинах , на острове Крит, Миконос, Санторини было интересно увидеть визуальную состовляющую этих поселений в древние времена! Респект Ubisoft за воссоздание эпох, городов! В этом они лучшие!
4) Я насчитал 6 различных климатических регионов, интересно просто бродить иследовать локации! Имеются различные фракции!
5) Морские сражения как неплохое дополнение. Но в Black Flag реализация лучше, морские сражения чувствуются и играются динамичнее!
6) По традиции серии имеются исторические личности, пока встретил Геродота и Сократа.
7) Понравились руины древних цивилизаций. на каждую найдется свой квэст.
8) Мифические существа они в игре есть, но пока до них не дошел по сюжету.
9) Колоритное музыкальное сопровождение, все гармонично и приятное слуху.
Теперь минусы:
1) Мне не нравится стелс механика и устранение главных злодеев. Для меня идельно реализованная механика была в Syndicate ,с веткой вариантов убийств злодеев!
2) Почему анимацию персонажа и боев так порезали? Идеальная была в Unity! Это большой вопрос для меня!
3) Боевка играется лучше, чем в Origins,но все равно нужно допиливать!
4) Нет толковой обнаженки и расчлененки как в The Wither 3. Зато можно романсить и включать текстуры крови в опциях!
5) Большущий минус это сранная магия!!!

Ps.Вообщем итог такой, в этой игре мне просто с кайфом приятно путешестовать бродить,проходить интересные сайды, Главный сюжет мне устраивает. Контента в игре много, прохождение займет думаю часов 80-100. Ubisoft прошу выпустить Вас Ultra Hd пак текстур. Буду признателен!

这代什么都好，但就是氪金系统太恶心了，先不提这个死妈内购，光是黄金版不包含豪华包这个就已经很恶心了，400块的版本竟然只有本体加一个现在等于是啥都没有的季票，如果买了黄金版还想要前期有用的豪华包，就必须花70来买只要60的豪华包，花得越多被宰的越狠，那我花这400块是为了啥？现在和普通版玩家一个待遇，甚至还不如那些少花了一百块的豪华版玩家，我除了育碧你妈死了说不出别的话了。
     再说说内购，起源那种内购是一个愿打一个愿挨，愿意花钱的就氪金买装备，不愿意花钱的就肝，或者直接ce一波。毕竟这是个rpg，在这种地方不愿意肝，开ce也没什么可耻的。毕竟上一代育碧还在大战维旺迪，这内购虽然看着恶心人，但也在可以忍受的范围内。而这一代育碧脱离了危机，反而在内购上变得变本加厉了起来。这代也有和上一代一样的开箱系统，但是这作的的开箱货币（奥利哈钢）是全程联网的，想要好装备？那就请充钱。稍微横向对比一下彩六这个网游，两作都玩过的应该懂奥德赛的氪金有多恶心了。
     还有个细节，起源里会送一些helix点数，送的刚好可以去开一种收集品的地图，也让你少一些麻烦。但这作送的helix点数真的是给你看看的，顺便暗示你再充几百点，任何有用的东西都买不了，那你送你妈呢？
     所以玩这作的时候请一定要有颗平常心，什么皮肤极品装备全都要当不存在，回归最最硬核的RPG本身，这可能就是育碧做出这么傻逼的氪金系统想要表达的意思吧，所以还是谢谢育碧给我们带来的游戏以及在现代快节奏生活中难得的回归本源的思想

Eins vorweg,
ich war nie ein großer Fan solcher Games und ich konnte mit Assasins Creed nie wirklich was anfangen.
Als ich mir das Spiel gekauft hatte, was mein erster Gedanke noch bevor ich es Installiert hatte:" Wenn es mir nicht gefällt geb ich es gleich wieder zurück!"

ABER!!!!

So wie ich es gestartet hatte war ich praktisch sofort fasziniert,
Die Einführung in das Spiel, das Gameplay, die Atmosphäre,
all das hat mich sofort in den Bann gezogen.
Dieses Spiel ist das ERSTE Spiel seit Jahren, das mich dazu gebracht hat den PC mit voller Vorfreude wieder einzuschalten.

Der Umfang des Spieles ist Traumhaft, mir wurde bisher noch kein einziges mal langweilig.
Die Hauptstory bisher einfach nur packend.
In diesem Spiel gibt es immer was zu tun und du stehst nie im Leerlauf.

Für mich eine Absolute Empfehlung für alle Rollenspiel Fans.

Mit diesem Spiel hat die Reihe für die Zukunft nun meine Aufmerksamkeit gewonnen und sollten die Entwickler dieser Linie treu bleiben, haben sie in mir einen Neuen Stammkunden Gewonnen.
Des heures de plaisir!

Ach Ubisoft... [Enthält Hinweise für Besitzer der RTX 20er Serie - Mögliche Crash-Lösung]

[POSITIV]

Da ist er nun also, der zweite Teil der "neuen" Generation. Ich persönlich habe Origins (abgesehen von den technischen Problemen) geliebt und war auch dieses mal wieder als Vorbesteller dabei. Rein Spieltechnisch wurde ich erneut begeistert. An der Stelle weiß Ubisoft wirklich, wie man Spiele baut - Wunderbare Grafik, eine (meiner Meinung nach) tolle Story und eine wirklich wirklich schöne, riesige Welt. Wirklich toll! Die "neue" AC reihe ist nach wie vor die einzige, bei der ich freiwillig ein RPG zu 100% durchgespielt habe (mit allen Nebenquests, versteckten Orten,...).
Hier also wirklich ein großes Lob an Ubisoft, zumal der Release (für Mich) dieses Jahr ohne technische Probleme lief.

[NEGATIV]

Dennoch gibt es ein paar (hauptsächlich technische) Kritikpunkte, die für mich nach wie vor lächerlich erscheinen, weil sie für ein so großes Studio, wie Ubisoft es ist, eigentlich keine Hürde darstellen sollten.
Zum einen wäre da die Optimierung des Spiels. Alles in allem gar nicht schlecht, auf den oberen Grafiksettings jedoch zunehmend unnötig Leistung-fressend. Da AC Odyssey zu großen Teilen aus Assets von AC Origins besteht, ist ein vergleich naheliegend. Während ich nun also in Origins auf maximalen Settings über 140 fps habe, komme ich in Odyssey auf 70-80 (RTX 2080ti). Generell ja eigentlich jammern auf hohem Nivau - aber bei der Karte (besonders im Vergleich mit anderen Spielen) kommt mir die Ausbeute ein bisschen mau vor. (Das könnte aber natürlich auch an der fehlenden Optimierung für die 20er Reihe liegen und kein globales problem darstellen)

[RTX20..]

Weiterhin treten mit den neuen Karten merkwürdige Fehler auf. So kann ich z.B. meinen Spielstand erst ohne Gamecrash laden, wenn ich vorher den Benchmarktest habe laufen lassen - ich frage jetzt mal nicht was das für einen Sinn ergibt :D .
Besonders diese Erkenntnis sollte andere Menschen mit einer 20er Karte jedoch sehr erfreuen, da sie auch mir zum Aufatmen verhalf. :D

[FAZIT]

Alles in Allem: Besser! - Letztes Jahr um diese Zeit konnte ich Origins noch nicht mal Spielen, weil mir vom Sound die Ohren wegflogen. Jetzt läuft alles einiger Maßen und das ist die Hauptsache, denn Spieltechnisch ist, meiner Meinung nach, die Antwort auf die Frage, ob sich der Kauf gelohnt hat schon nach 3 Sekunden ingame geklärt (Oder sagen wir 30...die Cutscene war nämlich auf 32fps gecapt - WTF? :D ).
Dieses Spiel ist wirklich gut. Wenn die technischen wehwehchen dann nächstes Jahr völlig verschwunden sind, könnte man schon sagen, es wäre grandios.
Danke Ubisoft, diesmal wirklich :D

The map is so vast it kind of hides the repetitiveness of the game. It does make you travel great lengths to do even simple side missions. Optional objectives are also nice, and the choices you make (similar to Witcher 3) certainly improves the game experience.

It's been almost 27 hours, and I finally got to (with side missions done) the "mother." What an odyssey so far though! :P

They should however focus on optimizing the game to run more smoothly. I had Origins running High/Very High Graphics at around 45 FPS on a notebook GPU and this game doesn't have any noticeable graphic changes for me to see a 38-42 FPS drop.

[u][h1]Assassin's Creed: Odyssey II Test[/h1][/u]

Die Serie Assassin's Creed geht nach Origins in die nächste Runde. Dieses mal führt uns die Serie ins antike Griechenland. Angesiedelt ist die Story im antiken Griechenland und spielt weit vor den Ereignissen in Origin. 

Worum geht es?
In Assassin's Creed: Odyssey gehen wir entweder als Alexios oder Kassandra auf unsere Heldenreise. Man spielt das Spiel also mit einen dieser beiden Charaktere, die ein schlimmes Schicksal hinter sich haben. Dabei ist das Schicksal diesmal weniger tragisch wie noch in den anderen Teilen von Assassin's Creed. Im Grunde ist man ein Söldner der natürlich Geld verdienen möchte. Nachdem unser erster großer Auftrag erfüllt ist, wird es dann persönlicher und das Abenteuer beginnt dann wirklich. Hier möchte ich nicht näher darauf eingehen, denn sonst würde ich zu viel verraten.
Zu Verraten sei es aber, das man in keinem Zeitpunkt des Spiels die Assassinen trifft, was mit der Zeitlinie zu tun hat wann die Assassinen gegründet worden sind. Lediglich die Vorläufer-Artefakte und ein Kult, die sich dieser Artefakte bemächtigt zeigt noch, dass es sich hier um ein Assassin's Creed handelt. 
Wie dem auch sei, nachdem wir die Startinsel hinter uns haben machen wir uns auf den Weg auf das offene Meer. Hier zeigen sich wieder sehr große Stärken der Vorgängerteile, denn es ist wieder alles drin. Auf offenem Meer bei Sturm riesige Wellen, versunkene Schiffe, die man durch Tauchen ihrer Schätze bemächtigen kann und weitläufige Landschaften. 
Wenn man sich Zeit lässt kommt man erst nach knapp 5-7 Stunden von der Startinsel herunter.


[b] Die Ubi-Formel [/b]
Wie üblich in den Assassin's Creed- Spielen hat sich mittlerweile die UbiSoft Formel bewährt. Überall auf der Map findet man Orte zu erkunden. Hierbei bereist man unter anderem verfallene Ruinen, unterirdische Höhlen, Inseln, Festungen und zu erobernde Orte. Neu dazu gekommen sind die Schlachten. Da die Story im pelleponischen Krieg spielt ist der Konflikt Athen gegen Sparta allgegenwärtig. Dabei ist man als Söldner nicht gerade wählerisch, kann beide Seite schwächen und auch für beide Seiten in Schlachten kämpfen. Eine Schlacht startet bei einem Questgeber auf der Weltkarte, bei einem Standartensymbol. Man landet dann instant in der Schlacht und muss mit der eigenen Fraktion die gegnerische ausschalten. Dabei winkt dann ordentliche Ausrüstung. Die Schlachten schaltet man allerdings erst frei, wenn man die regierende Fraktion soweit geschwächt hat, dass sie angreifbar ist. Dies ist möglich indem man die Befehlshaber ausschaltet. 
Truhen, Kriegsvorräte verbrennen, Befehlshaber und Oberbefehlshaber ausschalten. Dies sind die Dinge die man in Assassin's Creed: Odyssey macht um die Zeit zu vertreiben. Spannend ist dies allemal. 
In "Origins" haben sich Rätsel etabliert. Texte die Hinweise auf einen Ort geben. In Odyssee haben sie dies bei behalten, so soll man zum Beispiel "auf der Spitze eines Berges nach Süden schauen und dann 2 Inseln sehen, auf einer der Inseln bin ich neben einem Esel" - so einfach sind natürlich nicht alle Rätsel dieser Art - aber sie sind echt interessant. 

[b] Grafisch Bemerkenswert [/b]
Die Landschaften sind voller Details, jedes Objekt wirft Schatten und auch das Wetter und die Animationen sind echt gut gelungen. Die Gebiete sehen so aus, wie man sich das alte Griechenland vorstellen würde. Dabei ist das Panorama und die Aufmachung der Städte echt bemerkenswert. Man könnte glatt das Gefühl haben selbst dort zu sein. Häufiger bin ich einfach mal stehen geblieben um mich in der Landschaft einfach mal umzusehen, obwohl nichts in der Nähe war was Questziel oder sonst war. Einfach nur zum Sightseeing. 

[b]Das Gameplay und die Arten das Spiel zu spielen[/b]
Neu und einzigartig ist ein Modus wo dir keinerlei Hilfe angeboten wird. Diese Hilfe bekommst du dann höchstens aus den Questtexten. 
"Das Ziel befindet sich irgendwo im ...tal"
"Das Ziel ist südlich des Tempels von..."
Dies ist eine neue Gameplaymethode, aber man kann auch die klassische auswählen. 
Die Gebiete sind in Level unterteilt. Es gibt Hochstufige Gebiete und Niedrigstufige Gebiete. Es ist also Ratsam noch nicht sofort alles auf erkundung zu setzen, außer du setzt auf Erkundung und kannst gut Rennen und klettern ;-)
Genrell läuft die Steuerung super. Ich selbst kann leider nur zu der Controllersteuerung was sagen. Gespielt habe ich das Spiel mit einem XBoxOne-Controller. 


[b]Die Odyssee[/b]
Die Heldenreise generell ist sehr spannend inszeniert. Man trifft Charaktere die man noch aus dem Geschichtsunterricht kennt. Hippokrates oder Sokrates sind zwei solcher prominenten Beispiele. Ab einen gewissen Punkt der Hauptquest wird es dann besonders interessant, denn dann hat man die Qual der Wahl. Da dich deine Suche an verschiedene Orten führt kannst du in dem Fall entscheiden wo du zuerst hingehen willst und anfangen willst, da auch wiederum die Questreihe unterbrechen und einfach dann die andere Questreihe weiter machen um die Odyssee zum Erfolg zu führen. Außerdem gilt es besonders herauszufinden wer der Kult ist und wer die Personen sind, da der Kult sich meistens unter unheimlichen Masken versteckt. Das Aufdecken passiert entweder während der Hauptquestreihe, oder wenn man mal ein Lager der Kultisten ausnimmt und Informationen sammelt. Hat man genug gesammelt, kann man den Kultisten aufdecken, bedeutet man erfährt wer sich hinter der Maske verbirgt. Hat man dies heraus gefunden sollte man noch den Standort, wo er sich gerade befindet. Diese Kultistenfunktion ist allerdings nicht von Anfang an verfügbar - Storytechnisch halt.

Die Nebenquests erzählen meistens auch sehr schöne Geschichten. Die Gespräche sind echt super gelungen. 
Hin und wieder gibt es ein paar Quests wo man Dinge abfarmen muss, aber da man sowas in der Art schon bei den Orten hat hält sich dies in Grenzen. Und mal 3 spartanische oder athenische Schiffe zu versenken sind nicht so schlimm.  


[b]Talentbäume und Werte[/b]
Im Spiel gibt es 3 Talentbäume: Jäger, Krieger, Schurke. 
Hierbei kann bei Einsetzen von Fertigkeitspunkten, die es nach jedem Level gibt und zur Belohnung mancher Dinge im Spiel sich frei entscheiden, wo man investiert. Dabei ist auch eine Übergreifende Investierung möglich, MIschungen aus verschiedenen Skills. Aktive Talente setzt man dann auf Tasten und kann diese dann während des Kampfes einsetzen. Passive Talente, wie die Erhöhung des Schadens oder Stärkere Rüstung gibt es ebenfalls. 
Auch die Ausrüstung hat Werte. So findet man überall auf der Welt Waffen und Rüstungen, die man anziehen kann. Gefällt einem die Rüstung sogar, kann man diese sogar bei Schmieden Aufwerten und mit Gravuren (dies sind nochmal Spezialwerte) versehen. Diese Gravuren findet man als Questbelohnungen und Belohnungen auf der ganzen Welt. 


[b]Gespräche, Sex, Wein und Philosophen[/b]
Das beste an dem Spiel sind allerdings zweifelsfrei die Gespräche. Bei vielen Gelegenheiten im Spiel hat man Entscheidungsfreiheit wie man handelt. Lässt man zum Beispiel jemanden am Leben, wird er später wieder auf dich treffen. Aber auch härtere Entscheidungen sind im Spiel mit drin, so kann man durch Unachtsamkeit schon mal eine ganze Insel krank machen. Die Gespräche und Sequenzen sind richtig gut inzeniert, die Charaktere wirkten dabei auf mich nie wirklich steif, und bringen sich in die Sequenzen echt gut rein. Besonders gut sind manchmal die Gespräche wenn 2 Philosophen Diskutieren, einfach nur wunderbar. 
Auch hat man die Möglichkeit selbst mit manchen Charakteren zu flirten und mit ihnen dann sogar in die Kiste steigen. Dies wird allerdings nie gezeigt, sondern endet immer vor der Zimmertür. 

Fazit: Fantastisches Spiel was ich uneingeschränkt jedem Empfehlen würde.
Ein größerer Test kommt auch noch, nur nicht hier da hier offenbar nicht viel mehr rein passt :-(

很多人说这个其实就是起源的dlc，但其实我并不这样认为。游戏是好游戏，但是不推荐买传奇版，买最普通的版本就行了，装备那些打出来的其实还是很良心的。虽然我只玩了8小时，但我也忍不住写测评了。一开始的序章确实和起源没什么区别，但序章过后，你可以自己驾驶船只，船只的升级那些跟黑旗差不多，但多了一个副手系统。海战跟起源差不多。然后多了征服战，跟真三差不多吧。总体来讲我还是很满意的，特别是他的剧情，如果有仔细看的话其实很吸引人。支线任务也会有自己的剧情，基本上不会重复，但内容的话估计会是差不多的。最有趣的就是加入了剧情线路，这个确实是有影响。主角见父亲的那个任务，我没有选择杀死他，但是我想玩完这一轮之后我会再试一次，去看看会是怎样的结果。挺有带入感的。

You should definetly buy this game. The World is amazing, you can`t predict what will be your next Quest. Honestly one of the best games I`ve ever played. I bought a season pass and I cant stop playing the game, it`s been already 5 and I`ve spend my evening without even going to bathroom lol.

Někdo tvrdí, že se jedná o kopii Origins, jen s jiným zasazení doby, někdo zase vyčítá společnosti Ubisoft, že tvrdil po roční pauze v případě Origins, že si máme zvykat, protože už tak často nové díly vycházet nebudou. Uběhl přesně rok od vydání Origins a máme tu zase nový díl této nekonečné série.Pro lidi, co už nad touto sérií hlomily hůl, je to další důvod proč si nový AC již nekupovat, někdo si ho zase koupí kvůli zasazení RPG prvků ve hře, kterým hra už prakticky je. Faktem ale je, že na Odyssey se začalo pracovat už v roce 2015 a pokud se jednalo o pravdivé informace, tak tomu bylo krátce předtím, než šel Assassin’s Creed Syndycate na prodejní pulty. 


Každopádně, hra nabízí nádherný obrovský herní svět Starověkého Antického Řecka, jenž je zabalen v překrásné paletě nádherných barev, která byla použita v tomto dílu. Doslova vám tato kombinace spojená s krásným grafickým zpracováním vezme dech, a to obzvláště při západu slunce s výhledem na pevninu pod vámi a mořem v dáli před vámi.Ve hře přibylo spousty nových věcí, spousty jich zůstalo, a některé zmizely.U Origins se mě líbilo to, že pokud jste potřebovali vylepšit zbroj, která byla pevně ve hře daná, tak jste potřebovali například kůže z laně, lva, krokodýla, geparda, hyeny a jiné...V tomto dílu, už je použit systém zbrojení obměnou lepší zbroje, kterou můžete zakoupit u kováře, najít různě ve světě, nebo získat z vedlejšího questu či si ji vydobít od žoldáka, nebo bosse.Vylepšením zbroje na které potřebujete určitý druh a počet surovin z nichž jednou je právě zmíněná kůže,  je už jedno ze kterého zvířete ji na vylepšení daného předmětu použijete.Takže už je na vás, zda se pustíte do souboje s medvědy, vlky nebo třeba s divočáky, nebo se jim zkrátka vyhnete a raději střelíte jelena jedním šípem do zad. Ve hře je už také plnohodnotná moře plavba, ale to na mě působí zvláštním dojmem, jako by tomu něco chybělo a nebylo to zkrátka ono jako tomu bylo u Assassin’s Creed Black Flag. Velice vítaným zpestřením hry pro mě byly žoldáci, kteří cestují po celém širém světě. Postupně si je v žebříčku žoldáků odkrýváte tím jak je na cestách potkávate a postupným zabíjením žoldáků a plněním kontraktů od zadavatelů se dostáváte na špičku nejlepších žoldáků v celé Řecku.Je také potřeba počítat stím, že vypsaná odměna může být i na vaši hlavu.No, mohl bych se tu rozepisovat ještě dál, ale to by bylo opravdu na dlouho, protože obsah hry je vážně obřích rozměrů. 

Každopádně pro mě to je jeden z mála Assassin’s Creed dílů, který má velice napínavý příběh a také po dlouhé době díl u kterého si po půlnoci říkám, ještě jednu misi a půjdu spát. 

Plusy

+ herní doba
+ hratelnost 
+ systém žoldáků
+ postavy 
+ sound track 
+ příběh 
+ obrovský herní svět 
+ grafika 
+ oběvytelský režim 
+ zasazení doby 
+ česká lokalizace 
+ důraz na volby hráče 
+ 9 konců hry

Mínusy

- micro transakce
- místy optimalizace 
- pomalejší rozjezd 

Hodnocení  8.5/10

这款游戏可以让你同时体验刺客信条，巫师3，塞尔达传说荒野之息等系列的优点，然后又有着让你爆肝刷素材的装备升级系统，绝美的游戏场景让你在家就可以畅游古希腊的各个角落。游戏刚上手挺新鲜，首先是延续了刺客信条特有的刺杀系统，其次加入了塞尔达传说荒野之息类似的子弹时间机制，再一看路上各处景色和小任务的设计又似乎借鉴了巫师3的一些玩法，最后便是直截了当的刺客信条、战士信条和猎人信条三种技能书的无缝衔接。很多人说这一作这样乱搞强行让刺客信条变成了不伦不类的RPG，但是说句实在的，这样的改变肯定是有人喜欢有人不喜欢的，起码对我来说，更开放的世界和玩法起码可以给我带来50+小时的新鲜感和畅玩体验，那我就觉得很值了。更别说随处可截图当壁纸的绝美场景了，光是跑图开同步点就让我觉得对得起价格了！
抛开以前的刺客信条系列，这是一款全新的RPG游戏，游戏开发商对起源和奥德赛大胆的采用全新的游戏方式来面对玩家，给人的感觉更像是一部大作。
很棒的大作！已经很完美了！很美的风景，令人迷醉！

····我没砸死人啊····！！！我冤枉啊···· 不要这样啊 我是友军····

58小时，主线剧情通关，神教徒全灭
平心而论 这作刺客信条已经不再局限于刺客而是局限于信条，非常喜欢多结局这种设定。巫师3玩了很多周目，希望奥德赛后期更新可以添加覆盖多周目选项
优点；完全意义上的突破，剧情不再流水线化，莽夫信条这作不现实，潜入被发现群殴被围住两下就死了 传奇套装也只能抗住几下而已，战斗系统浴火重生，没有起源那种立即蓄力的变态属性 取消了盾牌，技能搭配的好可以实现爽快连击
缺点：1这作的武器给人一种塑料玩具的感觉、打击感远不如起源
          2奥德赛的优化目前版本是真的差，国内，国外的测试视频看了不少 2080ti 玩4K画质只有11帧 
本人配置中下 i5 4460 ＋970冰骑士＋16G内存条
全屏幕游戏帧数基本全程30-50之内 偶尔上个60
          3游戏战斗判定有多个bug 不同平面的敌人释放技能攻击后百分之百会击飞，而不是触发后续连招
           还有就是你TMLGB平民莫名其妙给老子腰上来一刀
           刺杀迷之卡屏之后伤害判定失效＋被发现=GG
推荐购买理由：推荐购买带机票版本，会赠送AC3重置版，辣个蓝人的AC还是要买的、机票现在没出 育碧会采用跟行尸走肉工作组一样的分期更新，这样也能保证DLC的质量
不推荐购买理由：优化真尼玛烂，同样双重D加密看看起源再看看奥德赛 我已经不想说什么了 这游戏有不少人用原生分辨率出现黑边问题，应该要等后续更新
          总之持推荐购买态度 可以仔细观看此篇 评测 考虑购买 THX~

I played origins but have not played any other AC game. That said, this game feels a lot like origins but is still fresh enough that it justifies the purchase. You dont need three bows like in origins, instead its the hunter bow and you can skill into the others. The graphics are beautiful, more so than origins. The combat is greatly improved with the addition of shields and the reworked adrenaline system. In Origins combat would get stale because you only needed to spam dodge and poke to kill everything. Odyssey requires you to think about light and heavy attacks while looking for parry opportunities, which makes the combat a lot more engaging.

I have encountered some bugs:
clothes dont appear wet (ubisoft knows about this)
You can get stuck falling between certain rocks (this only happpened once so far)
You can avoid fall damage if you're riding your horse. If you fall off a cliff while riding, you can dismount midair and you will be left standing. I have been able to replicate this twice so far.

The bugs aren't enough to say the game is bad, but they are a little distracting.

Overall if you enjoyed Origins you're gonna enjoy Odyssey, though it will feel very similar

This is the end of the IGN review for Assassin’s Creed Odyssey if anyone would like to read it.

‘Assassin’s Creed Odyssey is a resounding achievement in world building, environment, and engaging gameplay with occasional problems throughout. Its incredible recreation of ancient Greece is something I’ll want to go back to long after I’ve finished its main story, and its excellent systems mesh together in a way that’s hard to beat. While there are definite rough edges, Odyssey sets a new bar for Assassin’s Creed games and holds its own in the eternal debate over the best open-world roleplaying games ever.’

Review Score: 9.2/10
Assassin's Creed Odyssey's open-world adventure through ancient Greece is a gorgeous thrill, and the best the series has ever been.

Best Assassins Creed so far. Storyline/character development for main and side quests are 10/10. Strong similarites to Witcher 3 in regards to soundtrack, RPG mechanics, romance and as more mercenary than assassin. Highly recommended for Witcher fans. In terms of an AC game of the series, it has made combat very different with the skill tree abilities. Leaves plenty of room for each playstyle and customization. Only thing I wish it had was cosmetic and stat equipment seperation like MMOs. (this armour looks way better but is 15 levels out of date...*equips it anyway*)
This is turning out to be a great game. Best in the series. If you are put off by microtransactions then welcome to gaming in 2018. What they have the store has no hinderence on the game at all.

This game is a more refined version of AC Origins, with improvements on everything and a clear leap into RPG territory. Like many said and its true, this isn't the assassin's creed we knew, back there it was cool and yet it had a big flaw, it had little room to expand and ended being stale and dull due to their own story/concept. with Origins this broke the shackles and with odyssey it is completely free to grow bigger and better and a much more enjoyable and rich game overall. 

However this game really borrowed things from other popular games, by which shouldn't be seen as bad, copy is always good when its done right and improved upon, they borrowed from witcher 3, far cry, shadow of mordor and more. 

Imo i reccomend his game to be playedon High settings, even if your hardware in theory should support higher, This setting offers great fidellity at very little compromises and yet a nice nice performance. If you got very high or ultra your will gain minor fains in fidelity and an attrocious drop on performance, You've been warned, those two settings are badly optimized and misleading even if you've a high end pc. But they might became tolerable IF ubisoft optimizes the game and drop their 3rd party drm's by which are cpu hogs.... Don't whine if you try to chew more than what you should take ^^ 

As for buy? YES. But FFS go with standard edition, season pass is a joke..... true content is far fromthe price point and they think bundling the weakest lame game on the franchise makes it worth the purchase.AC3 remastered.... oh boy, If only was Ac2 or Black Flag but nope.........

起源已经非常出乎我的意料了，但是奥德赛更让我感到惊艳，它不仅仅是起源的加强版，更在全方位提升了游戏的体验，虽然还是有着育碧式开放世界的样子，但是在内容的丰富性和故事性上已经大大超越了FAYCRY、荒野和看门狗，这作无疑是育碧式开放世界的巅峰。缺点是等级控制过于严重，敌人是骷髅的话玩家的伤害会被削弱到令人发指的地步，我觉得这根本没有必要，育碧应该给玩家选择的余地。此外，本作的画面咋看起来比起源好，其实很多细节比如水面的漂浮物、天空的鸟类（分辨率和帧率都爆低的贴图！！差评！！）都有删减，如果是为了优化也就罢了，事实上本作比起源的并没有好上多少。
总体上来说还是非常优秀的作品，让被FAYCRY5恶心到地点的我对育碧又挽回了点信心。

50小时体验，我个人给奥德赛打9.5分
优点
①、优秀的主线剧情下有着细腻的支线
主线不剧透了，一周目通关的玩家相信都对这作的主线剧情十分满意，并且这作支线的进化尤为明显，支线演出借鉴了巫师3，每个支线都有独立的小剧情，完成过程很有趣。
②、全面向成熟的RPG游戏迈进
装备属性不再鸡肋，噩梦难度下合理的搭配才能使得战斗更加流畅，完全随机的装备等级与装备数值也一定程度上降低了清理问号的无趣，谁知道一个小营地的队长会不会爆一个极品紫呢？
③、爽快的战斗系统
三系天赋特色鲜明，主角不再像八爷一样暗杀硬肛样样精通，当你选择做一个战士的时候，就要面对暗杀无法一击致死的窘境，而选择做一个刺客的时候，正面战斗就注定吃亏，严苛的等级压制与动态等级系统也使得战斗难度较之起源大大提高，再也不是一把立即蓄力走天下了，所以本作的装备再也不是哪一件等级高就穿哪一件，合理的取舍才更有助于战斗，技能系统的加入也增加了战斗的动作性，敌人学会了各种各样的技能，这使得杀敌的过程充满了变数，非常的有感觉。
④、似曾相识的海战
相信黑旗的海战都给玩过的玩家留下了深刻的印象，奥德赛此次的海战也非常的优秀，射箭，投矛，撞击或登船，配合本作新加入的火力系统，要求玩家要合理进行输出，而不是CD好了就无脑射箭投矛。
⑤、优秀的画面与音乐
“青山绿水，万紫千红”走出了古埃及的荒漠，奥德赛的画面不在灰暗，亮丽的古希腊风光真的令我眼前一亮，细腻纯白的大理石雕塑，丰富多彩的野外生态，高低起伏的山峦地貌，浪涛阵阵的蔚蓝大海，配合上时而低沉吟诵时而高亢激昂的BGM，使得古希腊的风光十分令人沉醉，戴上耳机，仿佛真的置身于那个时代，代入感爆棚。
缺点
①、亟待解决的优化问题
8400+1066在1080p下可以稳住高特效60左右，但帧数还是偏低，相信其他的显卡体验并不是那么好，这点需要等待后续的补丁解决。
②、公式化的问号
虽说这作的战斗进化的非常多，景色也很漂亮，但是跑路清问号的过程难免还是会显得无趣，不过神教人员的加入也为清问号带来了一点期待，
奥德赛是刺客信条的全面进化之作，我个人看来，说是刺客信条目前的巅峰毫不为过，真的别再说奥德赛是起源的换皮这种可笑的言论了，不管你玩过起源与否，甚至玩过系列作品与否，奥德赛都是一款值得入手的佳作。

For those of you who gave a "thumbs down" to the game simply because of the micro-transactions, you're an idiot. Ubisoft has been doing this for how long now? ...several years. You paid $60 for a game you already knew was going to have micro-transactions, and then you say you like the game, but give it a "thumbs down" due to micro-transactions. I just don't understand that rationale. Ubisoft is obviously making products you like, or you wouldn't continue to buy their products. 

Now, to my basic review. With only about 7 hours in, I have barely scratched the surface of this in-depth game. This is by far my favorite Assassin's Creed game since Black Flag. It may even end up being better than Black Flag. I can tell you that it's much more entertaining than Origins. I've had no issues running the game on Ultra settings with my GTX 980 Ti, i7-5820k, 32GB RAM. The graphics are amazing, and the gameplay is more functional than Origins. 

I would definitely recommend this game!

Ein absolutes Meisterwerk ! 
Ein Mix aus Mythologie und Geschichte des antiken Griechenlands.

Der thematische Rahmen des Spiels ist eine alternative Version des Peloponnesischen Krieges. Der Spieler beginnt das Spiel als Söldner und Nachfahre des spartanischen Königs Leonidas I. Er erbt dessen gebrochenen Speer, der zu einer Waffe geschmiedet wird, die dem Spieler besondere Fähigkeiten im Kampf verleiht. Als Söldner kämpft er entweder für Athen bzw. den Attischen Seebund oder für Sparta bzw. den Peloponnesischen Bund. 

Als spartanischer Söldner ist der Stil deiner Kampffähigkeiten sehr dynamisch und anpassbar. Es gibt mehr als 30 Fähigkeiten, die verbessert, kombiniert und deinem aktiven Kampf zugeordnet werden können.
Gekämpft wird nicht nur zu Land, auch die Seeschlachten aus Assassin's Creed: Black Flag sind zurück. Die Auseinandersetzungen sind zwar nicht ganz so ausgefeilt wie in der Piratenausgabe, aber eine gelungene Abwechslung zu Landkämpfen.

Odyssey schafft es, eine Geschichte um die Nachfahren des spartanischen Königs Leonidas zu spinnen und wechselt zwischen Historie und Fiktion.

Fun game with more than enough things to do.
While a lot of the content is your traditional open world gathering and clearing, the combat is interesting enough to make this bearable and even fun. 
The armor variety is a nice change of pace from other games where you could choose robe A or B, if you want to be a shiny golden warrior, or a sneaky cloth wearing assassin that choice is achievable under the looting and quest reward system. 
And with how the upgrade system works, if you like the way something looks you can level it up to your current level with just some money and the common materials you will find playing. Armor/weapons scale to your level and attack/defense values will rise to meet the average of said level (huge props for this system.)


My only issues so far are nitpicks and minor ones at that.
-Staggering FPS: This is most likely because of my outdated CPU, I'd blame Denuvo but I don't know enough about it to do so, if you have a modern rig you'll run this game fine.
-Weird mouse bug: Infrequently the game will lose your mouse. What I mean by this is it almost mimics an alt + tab but keeps the game ontop, so you are left without character control but the action continues, this has gotten me a few times.

Otherwise Ive experienced little crashing with this game (with the exception of a few times the aforementioned problem arose.)
 If you're a fan of Assassin's Creed or a new visitor to the series I'd recommend this title. Like many people I lost hope for this series many games ago, but if this is the direction they are taking it I will be pleased to see it make a comeback.

Voy a intentar ser breve y solo enfocarme en los pro y contras del juego, ya que, solo llevo una partida de 10hs de juego. Resumo que si te gustó AC Origins, este te gustará aún mas. AC, es una franquicia que ha cambiado mucho, ya no es el juego que era en sus primeras entregas, y de hecho, estaría bueno que no se llamara AC, pero la empresa desarrolladora lo quiso llamar así y buen, habrá que jugarlo con ese nombre jaa.

PROS:
Sistema de progreso: Es el apartado que más me ha agradado en todo el juego, en Origins, se podía ver como los territorios se dividían en rangos de lvl, es decir: Memphis de 20 a 23, Fayum de 24 a 29, etc. Cada territorio tenía enemigos con ese rango de lvl. En Odyssey, también están marcados, pero si superas el lvl de ese rango, el territorio automáticamente lo supera para estar a nivel. Eso da la oportunidad de pasar la historia completa, sin preocuparte de no haber hecho algo, para luego poder hacerlo. AC Odyssey es un juego con una gran cantidad de contenido (mas que Origins), lo cual a veces por completar todo, se pierde un poco el hilo de la historia, y es por eso, que remarco esto, ya que se puede terminar la historia, sin ir sobrado de lvl a otros territorios donde nos han quedado cosas colgadas. 

Conversaciones: Queda excelente el poder elegir la opcion que responder, tanto para informarte mas de lo que ocurre, como  para tomar una decision que tenga consecuencias mas adelante, creí que iba a ser un simple relleno sin sentido, pero me sorprendió. Muy bien logrado.

Skills: Se añadieron dos cajas de skills, cazador y asesino/combate, muy bueno que hayan agregado esto, ya que al convertirse en un juego puramente de RPG, le sienta muy bien. El arbol de habilidades añade nuevas skills y mejora las que ya teníamos. 

Territorios: Los territorios en el mapa están dividos entre 2 facciones. Atenienses y Espartanos. Para disminuir el liderazgo de la faccion dominante, se puede lograr haciendo misiones y matando líderes, soldados, o incluso al lider de la región, entre otras cosas mas. Luego se resuelve en una batalla entre las 2 facciones. Excelente implementación.

Mapa: Me agrada mucho que haya sido Grecia, si bien, Egipto me encanta, es cierto que a nivel visual, se disfruta muchísimo mas de un mapa como el de Grecia, islas, mares, barcos, un territorio mucho mas colorido y mas vivo. Muy bien logrado.

Mercenarios: Son los ex Phylakes de AC Origins, pero se los han tomado mas en cuenta y se los introdujeron de una mejor manera. Hasta el punto de estar enlazado con la historia principal. 

Dificultad: Otra gran punto para esta entrega, se ha mejorado muchisimo mas la dificultad, obligando al usuario a recurrir a una estrategia de combate para poder salir victorioso de una pelea.  Ni hablar de que enfrentarte a 3 o 4 enemigos es cosa muy dificil, y casi imposible si ese enemigo te lleva 1 o 2 lvl de ventaja. Era algo muy necesario en el juego.

Barcos: No estuve mucho con ellos, pero lo que se muestra al principio, se nota una mejora en comparacion a las otras entregas (Despues editaré)

CONTRAS

IA: Creo que es un apartado que Ubisoft tiene que seguir trabajando mas. Todos los juegos tienen errores o fallos en la IA, pero Ubisoft tiene una de las peores.
He visto muy poquitos bugs, y he tenido algun que otro crasheo, espero lo solucionen y que no ocurra mas.

Estoy en contra de los micropagos y bajo ningun punto de vista los apruebo, ni siquiera los utilizo, pero en ningun momento interfieren en la jugabilidad. Son simplemente cosmeticos y aceleradores, nada fundamental, las consumen los que pueden y los que quieren. No me gustan, pero nada que preocuparse. 

El valor del juego es de 60 dolares y ofrece mas de 100hs de juego. El season pass es opcional, como dije con los micropagos, lo consumen los que quieren y los que pueden, si te quedas con ganas de mas, lo compras, si no, con el juego base queda perfecto, nadie esta obligado a consumirlo, no te piedes de nada. Mas alla de la calidad, el season pass existe en juegos como The witcher 3 o Montoto game.

El juego esta bien, pero hay cosas que son ridiculamente llamativas, como por ejemplo EL PUTO Y EXCESIVO USO DE LOS PUTOS MICROPAGOS... Para que mierda algun estupido pagaria para terminar mas rapido un juego? algun estupido que no le gustan los mismos no?... Otra cosa, bugs? si alguno que otro tuve, pero mas asco da la optimizacion, tengo un I7 6700k y una EVGA GTX Titan X SC y hay zonas donde de casualidad anda a 35 fps y en la zona de atica anda para el real culo... Otra cosa que me causa mucha gracia, es en serio... No tenian ni ganas de hacer rostros no?, veo al pelotudo de 300 en todos los putos npc, le cambian el pelo y aveces ni siquiera eso, solo le cambian el color y ya... En serio si van a tomarnos el pelo, algo mas de pilas por favor, ya demasiado que hay que pagar por el juego para que encima, despues aparte tengas que pagar el puto pase de temporada, y en un single player poner micro pagos? como se nota que al cliente se lo pasan por los huevos. El juego esta bueno, si, no lo termine, pero la historia es meh... La verdad, si le pusieran algo mas de pilas, el juego estaria mucho mejor, y teniendo en cuenta que hasta febrero no paran de salir buenos juegos, le diria a la gente que no tiene para elegir, que espera a febrero y vea y si tenes consola, esta poronga no la compres, anda por el RDR 2. Lo unico positivo es que Steam, en mi pais lo vende a 35 dolares y no 60, por que yo 60 dolares por esta poronga no pago...

I'll start off short and sweet: I recommend this game. Whether for open world RPG fans, or returning players of the AC series. I've played almost every single game in the franchise, and this one is by far my favorite. In hopes this review may benefit those interested, I'll try and break up my thoughts and experiences thus far. 

Story:
I feel I've barely grazed the surface, even after 35 hours in game. The storyline has me very intruiged and excited to dive further. It's been a long time since I've cared this much about the main character and how their adventure is transpiring. Having player choice not only in simple dialogue conversations, but larger, more impactful, decisions is a huge win for me and my preferred style of video games. 

Characters:
I absolutely adore Kassandra. She is so well done in her motions, facial expressions, and voice acting. Let's be honest - she's every lesbians wet dream. Also a first for me as far back as I can remember in the AC world, I actually LIKE the side characters who accompany you for parts of the game. Even the ones that I interact with for a short time in side missions leave me with an unforgettable impression. Several times I've found myself laughing at particular personalities while heavily weighing if I should trust others. The diversity here makes the world thrive. Romance, while completely optional, is just another bonus and so far these particular encounters have been developed pretty darn well. 

Combat:
The skill tree and overall combat is simple but very enjoyable. I am playing on Hard difficulty, and it truly is a challenge. I'm encouraged to watch patrol patterns, learn my skills, master my weapons, and approach battles with a bit more strategy. Finishing even the smallest of encounters feels extremely rewarding. Bounty hunters, wildlife, and elite soldiers are not to be taken lightly. I'm already pondering how I will build my character in a second playthrough. Naval combat is back and just as glorious as it was in Black Flag. 

Gear:
Wowsa there is a lot of gear you are constantly getting in this game. The armor and weapons are very distinctive, offer their own wide variety of benefits and can change how you approach combat encounters. I am enjoying trying everything on (gotta be fashionable) and upgrading or engraving my favorites. 

World:
Holy cow is this game world beautiful and gigantic. When I visit sync spots, arrive in ports, or just find random hidden gems I find myself pausing and just going, "wow." I've never used any kind of photography mode in other games before, but you bet your pretty behind I am in Oddysey. Cities feel lively, are clear in their poverty or prosperity, the wilds are lush with vegetation and beautiful mountain ranges, and overall everything is a joy to look at. The map is huge - I've visited around 8 regions (each having a minimum of 1 sync spot and 5ish points of interest) and I feel like that's only 30% of the map. 

Side Missions:
Some of these made me laugh my rear off - they really took me off guard. I grab quests while in the world iteslf. Whether it be proper side missions with their own story, or favors from npcs. This way is very enjoyable for me instead of a straight grind from a mission board and I am genuinely excited when I find a side quest as most are very well done. Not all of them will be memorable, but I still felt they were executed well. 

Progression/Leveling Up:
When visiting new regions, I'll typically be there a while to explore all the points of interest before moving on. It's very possible to stop in via a quest then jet off to the next mission marker, but as I am not playing that way I can't speak to how much grind is necessary before hitting any level limitations. Just by me exploring locations and completing any objectives associated with it, I am leveling very steadily and above any requirements that the story may demand. 

Microtransactions:
Piggy backing off of the previous leveling discussion, this game does have microtransactions. They are marketed on the main title screen and offer not only cosmetics, but experience boosters, crafting materials, and weapons/armor. With my playstyle I have never been inclined what so ever to make any purchases, but this may not be the same for everyone. 

Performance and Bugs:
I'm running a GTX 1070ti and quad core intel processor. Beautiful graphics with steady frame rate. Only once has it dropped for a short time in a city to be noticeable. No crashes and no bugs that I've encountered. I've seen some odd enemy movement on rare occassion, but that's it so far. 

That about sums up my playtime thus far. I'm sure I'll return with a bit more once I get farther into the world and story. Thanks!

Before I start I'll mention I have played a vast majority of the Asssassins Creed games over the years. Two was my favourite for a long time, before being overtaken by Origins. I would consider myself an avid gamer, though not competative. 

The first thing you'll notice when you start playing AC:OD is it's not really an AC game. I would say it feels like a mix of Skyrim, the Witcher 3, and AC:Origins. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but if you'e looking for the authentic AC experience, you might be a little disaapointed. That being said, the game is great. There are some issues, but overall the game is a joy to play.

Pros:

- Graphics are good, maybe worse than AC:Or but very similar. Certainly more colourful.
- Story seems good so far, to me it seems they have made an effort to still put in a decent story.
- World is huge, 6 x bigger than Origins, however a lot of that is ocean. It may actually be smaller than origins, it's hard to tell.
- Gameplay is reletively fluid. Certainly better than most rpg's.
- New rpg elements are great, these include actual abilities (replacing overpowere from AC:Origins).
- Tons of side quests, locations to explore. 
- Still has forts, bandit camps, caves etc.
- Plenty of options for weapons, combat styles (ranged, melee etc).
- Gender Equality (Sarcasm).
- Race Equaility (Sarcasm).
- Voice acting is good enough, maybe not as good as AC:Origins.

Cons:

- It's a ubisoft game, which means bugs, crashes and poor performance / optimization for a decent percentage of players.
- Feels more grindy than AC:Origins. This does not effect me, I love the grind. People who have less time to play may find this offputting.
- MICROTRANSACTIONS AND UBISOFT GREED.*

* This is the big one. If you thought AC:Origins had too much of this, then you're going to be frustrated with the amount Ubisoft is pushing them in this one. It feels like everything, i.e XP gain, Gold Gain, Crafting Materials, Shop Prices etc has been deliberately put very low to encourage (Cough) *Manipulate* (cough) people into buying from the store.

You can buy permanent XP boosts, permanent gold gain boosts etc. The greed from Ubisoft here is disgusting. This single handedly takes the game down a notch. While it does not bother me, I can completely understand how annoying this would be for some people. The game already costs money, these micro transanctions should be much cheaper or not there at all. I like the option to purchase cool gear, and horses etc. I dislike Ubisoft trying to force me to do that in order to not feel like I'm struggling for resources and XP.

This is typical of Ubisoft, and the greed in Odyssey is the highest I have seen from Ubisoftso far.

The game overall is good. If you enjoyed AC:Origins, like RPG's, and historical settings, then I would recommend this game.

Final Rating:

*If it didn't have greedy microtranactions* : 8.5/10
*With Ubibroke Greed* : 6/10

Still worth getting, but be prepared for some grinding, and being stapped for cash if you want to keep your gear updated.

Note: I have not finished the game, so I cannot vouch for how things are at higher levels. I've played enough to get a sense of the game, but if you only trust reviews from people who've completed the game, this isn't one of them.

Have a lovely day

这算是我有史以来见过的最有意思的一个游戏，玩家可以先帮助雅典人把斯巴达人打个底朝天，之后雅典人就掌握了一个地方的政权，之后玩家可以再帮助斯巴达人打爆雅典人，之后雅典人又再一次掌握了政权，以此类推形成了无限循环，无限装备，无限的支线任务.......(此时此刻不知道说些什么），奥德赛算是刺客信条系列里面最让人惊喜的一部作品，我还很少见过一个走剧情的游戏可以打超过3天的（从来不玩偶尔玩的玩家自动忽略这句话），但是这个游戏就是每天不吃饭不睡觉估计也能打好几个月（天天当各个国家的盟友和叛徒就可以了），能把一个剧情游戏做的如此让人废寝忘食的育碧也确实是不枉自己的威名。优点什么的就不多说了，自己去体验了自然就明白了，至于缺点的话，我只能说玩这个游戏你就没别的事可干了，基本上不出一个月你就能跟女朋友分手，不出两个月你就可以家破人亡妻离子散了。所以有这个美好愿望的朋友请赶快入手这款游戏，幸福美满的家庭请一定谨慎入手。（滑稽脸）相比较于让人期待已久的古墓丽影暗影，这个游戏显然不知道是厉害了多少百倍，剧情刺激玩法多样同时又方便操作，而且价格还相对便宜，性价比简直完爆古墓丽影，再看古墓丽影的那个破剧情，圣三一还没怎么打呢就灭亡了。（当然古墓丽影系列的游戏体验无可置疑，只是调侃剧情而已）。我曾经一直以为怪物猎人世界才是神作中的神作，现在看来简直是道高一尺魔高一丈啊。因此想要入手的朋友请尽快入手，千万不要吝啬钱包，这个游戏绝对是物所超值的，但是再次提醒家庭幸福美满的人谨慎入手，否则到时候跪了搓衣板可别来怨我哟，哟吼吼吼吼吼吼吼吼吼吼吼吼。

They really put alot of thought into fleshing out the AC series. I honestly thought this was going to be a copy-paste of AC Origins but this title really holds up as its own thing. Compared to this game, AC Origins is really simple.

There are SO many meaningful things to do in this game:
+Naval contracts, exploration and general debauchery.
+Fight the war as a mercenary for either the Spartans or the Athenians. You have land to conquer and forts to capture.
+Assassinate members of the higher-up society. There are way more people to kill than in Origins (which had about 13 people). This one has about 2.5x more 'templars' to kill.
+Huge amounts of side quests, some with unique stories to tell, others just general MMO fetch quests.
+Secret dungeons to delve into and explore.
+Upgrade your character and spend skill points on interesting skills.
+Upgrade your ship as you see fit.
+Take out mercenaries (similar to how Lord of the Rings: Shadow of War did it).
+Explore underwater environments (that you generally won't come across through the story mode).

There are a few more that escape me but trust me, this game has a lot more content than past Assassin's Creeds. Gone are the meaningless "collect random feathers around the city". There are no distractions in this game. Everything you do works towards developing your character & the story.

I'm no fan of Ancient Greece (I think it to be one of the most boring places in the ancient world, to be honest) but this game has given me a deeper understanding of their culture. You can notice a lot of differences in comparison to the Romans.

They also said they'd be working on the game for years to come. I'm assuming they're going to be adding in more dynamic mechanics (such as multiplayer contracts) but I wouldn't hold my breath for anything multiplayer.

I give this game a 9/10. They really are making an effort to breathe new life into Assassin's Creed and while this game is nothing like the game I fell in love with in 2007, I can respect the fact that they're at least trying to keep things fresh.

By far the best Assassin's Creed game ever made. It went full RPG, and it was totally worth it. Greece is beautiful and full of many interesting things to do (though the side quests aren't as varied as they were with Origins), and exploring the sea is, and yes I will say it, just as fun if not more than it was in Black Flag. The story is the best in the series since AC2, and is much more personal than any other entry (though it does introduce us to the origin of the Templars and more of the Isu (precursor) artifacts. Gameplay-wise, it's like Origins 2.0, with the same mechanics but more variety. 

Overall, this game feels like the dream combo between Black Flag and Origins, being the apex of what both could have been. While it has ACIVs naval experience, it has the rich narrative that it lacked, and while it has the exploration and feel of Origins, it gives it the RPG elements that allow you to truly immerse yourself. 

Definitely get this, it's worth every cent.

I have nothing left to say but the game is beautiful! I have nt beaten it yet but the story so far just amazes me and so do the side quests becuase there are so many memorable ones I cant even tell you. This hs become my favorite AC besides brother hood! The graphics, gameplay, and the open world is everything and more and you will never have nothing to do. If I had to complain it would be that the game is pretty taxing on systems and I have an 8700 with a 1070. I get between 60 and 70 percent core usages and 100 percent on usage on my 1070 but then again I play with almost all my settings maxed out besides 2 different ones I toned down to give me a stable 60 fps. Another downer would probably b that it is a grind to get material to upgrade but as long as you complete quests and sidequests you will pretty much run into wht you need and get it. The one exception was when you have legendary gear which is great becuase its the highest tier gear you can get but when it takes almost half or 3/4 of you supplies to upgrade it then its a little crazy. Other than that I love this game and I reccomemd that people buy the game. Give it a chance guys becuase it is really fun. People may judge me for saying I like it alot but it is so refreshing having a improved open world and a actually pretty cool girl character who has emotion and has bad ass armor lol. I skipped out on the last few assassins creed games after the disaster of AC Unity. Coming back in AC Odyssey, It is clear that the series has evolved. It seems like this RPG light style is what Assassins Creed is meant to be. The series is finally reaching its final form, and it seems all of the awkward growing pains for the franchise are coming to an end. 

The game is absolutely terrific. That's all that I can really say. It's one of the best games i've purchased in the last 5 years. I'd reccoment it to anyone who was a fan of previous AC games, or anyone who wants a light MMO to run around in for 90 hours or so, or people who are just dorks about ancient Greece. My hat is off to Ubisoft. Great job on this one.

I know there are a lot of bad reviews but honestly I'd read all the good ones first. If your a big fan of RPGs upgrading your gear leveling your character funny through a fine and richly detailed world where everything is a challenge with a great story then this is for you. Best Assassins creed to date.

Story is beautiful, graphics is great, Sparta & Athens' war is really nice and meeting your historical characters is a lot of fun (yeah, from Pericles to Anaxagoras and Sofocles, the games mixes them in the best way with the actual storyline). I like it, it takes the best from the Withcher 3 and Tomb Raider's reboots: the resulting open world mechanics works really fine for me.

The only thing they should tune is the the progression speed: I can't keep my gear up to my character's levelling and I'm almost always with out-of-date equipment and weapons!

The game never crashed or had blocking issues: a couple of times the cutscens slow down when there a lot of NPCs in the background. 

Vote: 9.5/10 and higly recommended!

Set in ancient greek ERA and the player can't use a shield... fk outta here with that BS.. we players that love the shield combat are forced to a thumbdown of a dodge and roll and perry as if none of that shit could be done with a shield... where TF is ashraf ismael when you need em..

I have never really played an Assassin's Creed game. I am very glad I jumped in, I don't regret paying full price at all. The game surprises you at every turn. Just as you think something might get repetitive, the game throws something new at you, especially as the AI seems pretty intelligent. (A blacksmith randomly screeming, turns out he fell into a fire, 10/10. You assassinate someone, a guard throws the dead body in a pit, 10/10) 
The graphics are amazing too, and so far the story has been really good. There is too much to discuss. Most of the negative reviews have been from people without a decent PC, so maybe be warned. The microtransactions are a little dirty, but you can easily forget that they are there. The game doesn't rerquire you to grind, it just requires you to explore and take on side quests, so I don't get the negative reviews about grinding. Give this game a go, but be warned, you might be blown away by your first few moments.

English is m second languige, therefore, I apologize if I sound like Yoda.

Good: After playing 16 hours I can say its not a bad game (first Assassin's Creed that I enjoyed in a long time). Good characters, RPG elements. 

Bad: But after my 8th hour in the game, I forced myself to play it. The reason being is simple - level scaling (game world is very unbalanced). 

I was able to turn level scaling off in AC: Origins, however, in this is not an option, trust me I tried. I contacted UBI and they lied to me that this feature can be toggled on and off in the gameplay settings. I searched yet was not able to find it. I searched UBI forums there were people like me. Then UBISOFT tried downplaying it by diverting attention to the difficulty setting however it still does not change level scaling. I wish I could return this game but its way too late for that. From hour 8 till 16 I forced myself to play this game hoping I get used to level scaling, however, I cannot do that anymore (I want to enjoy games I play).

Example: When I left Tutorial island Phokos was capped at 8-9 or 10. Now I'm level 24 and Phokos is at level 22, same as the tutorial island. I personally hate it. I know that there are people who like level scaling but I am not one of them. 

Solution: Make level scaling optional like in AC: Origins

Verdict: For me, level scaling takes away the feeling of accomplishment if you like me don't waste your money.

Игра очень клёвая. Я не знаю, правда, что у неё общего с серией Assassin's Creed, но она клёвая.

Начну с плохого. Юбики насрали на все основные каноны  серии. НЕТ СТКРЫТЫХ КЛИНКОВ, КАПЮШОНОВ (я фанат и считаю, что это - минус). Боевка получше стала, но всё равно унылая, враги однообразные, тупые, их передвижение очень легко угадывается, сложность лишь в огромном количестве урона, которое враги наносят. Тем более, где комбинации? Движок мне не понравился еще в Истоках, движения дерганные, иногда проблемы с хитбоксами. Враги оооочень тупые, приведу пример: Я забрался на крышу казармы в Спартанском аванпосте. Приманил к себе врагов, они меня увидели. ОНи забираются, я их сбрасываю, А ОНИ ВСЕ РАВНО ЛЕЗУТ. Это еще не всё, я сбросил двух, они не не сдохли, отхожу с края крыши, они меня не видят, и, ОНИ СТАЛИ ЗАНОВО МЕНЯ ИСКАТЬ. Оооочень долбанутая система сохранений. Просто криво работает.

А теперь хорошее. Огроменейший мир, тут ВСЯ Греция. Локации красивые, хорошая визуалка, цветовая гамма. Интересный сюжет. Морские бои, крутая система взаимодействия с фракциями. Хорошая система наёмников (Средиземье Тени Войны). Много кастомизации. Очень крутой режим Исследователь. Крутые и полезные навыки.
Короче, 7 Пинков Спартанца из 10. Очень советую.

Absolutely loving this game. If you played Origins and enjoyed it you will enjoy this. It improves greatly on the changes that Origins brought along. The game is quite reminiscent of The Witcher 3 (minus the signs and potions). The new skill tree is much better than Origins. Bows have been changed so they are all one type and your special bow attacks are their own abilities rather than being tied to different bows.

I've put in just under 24 hours so far (split between myself and my partner) and neither of us can put this game down.

Looking at my hours, I am obviously still in the beginning stages of the storyline. I pre-ordered the game after one of my favorite reviewers (Karak with ACG, check him out if you haven't) gave it a great review. Today I randomly went to the Store Page and noticed it has a bunch of negative reviews. I was surprised to say the least. I have been thoroughly enjoying this game, from the combat mechanics to the storyline/plot itself. I decided to post a review given some of the negative ones I saw. 

The graphics are spectacular, and I have a gaming rig that I built a few years ago, but updated with a new Nvidia card last year. I haven't had any hiccups that some of the other folks have been noticing. The gameplay itself is fun, and I really enjoy the main quests and side quests. The quests do not appear to be cookie cutter to me at all. There is also a mercenary system in the game (ala Nemesis system from Middle Earth games) that is intuitive and fun. The ship gameplay and combat is also a blast. I feel like I can really sink a decent number of hours into this game and it won't feel repetative. The world is vibrant and I think the voice acting overall is good, except for a few instances when I noticed a particular character being so over dramatic that I thought they were being sarcastic - but alas they weren't. Besides that though, no other issues so far. The map itself looks huge. I can tell it's going to take me a long time to traverse through all the territories, completing quests, etc. 

Verdict: Amazing game! A definite recommendation from me.

9.5/10

The only downside this game has (aside from normal post-launch bugs) is an overabundance of gear you collect. It seems like you get a new piece before you can settle down and get used to the current setup you have. This really isn't a big problem, though.

After putting a couple hours into AC:Od, I feel I can give an early review of my experience to help others decide if this game is worth a buy.

PROS:
-The combat is smooth, polished, and feels good. Many unique abilities to play around with AND you can freely respec your ability points at any time. Fighting multiple enemies at once is as difficult as you'd expect in real life, for parrying one person's attack doesn't prevent a second person from attacking you. Timing, spacing, and using your environment are key to keeping the advantage in battle.
-The world. sound track, and background audio are great.
-The animations are actually good without horrifying glitches, though facial animations will not always convey the emotions of the character.
-The voice actors did a good job, and I haven't felt disconnected from the scenes due to poor voice acting, only poor facial animations.
-Exploration mode allows you to be far more immersed in the world, but can be freely turned on or off. I personally recommend exploration mode if you enjoy figuring things out and exploring.
-Missions have been enjoyable so far. I've legitimately laughed a few times, and have almost cared about a few minor characters.
-Stealth is and is not possible. You CAN assassinate an entire fort of enemies and never get seen, which is very fun, but if an enemy is a level above you he won't die from being stabbed in the throat. So. That's a thing.
-Wanted level system is pretty fun.

CONS:
-Obvious microtransaction cash grab. I haven't hit the "grind wall" yet, but you can buy a one time permanent EXP boost for an absurd amount of money. 
-The only load time or game crash issue I had was after dying; the game couldn't figure out how to load and I had to force quit the game. Any other time loading was fast and I had no issues.
-Not historically accurate, if you care. Is the war a real thing? Yes. Is the Sparta myth based on historical accuracy? No. Would a female have been treated even remotely the same as a male during these times? Definitely not; sexism was common. Can you throw a spear and teleport to it? You get the point. 
-THE MODERN TIMELINE. For fans of the series, Desmund's death was probably the major turning point in the modern timeline and for our enjoyment of the story. There are immediate and obvious plot holes and terrible writing, which really ruin an otherwise decent game.
-The story can feel jarring when your dialogue choices don't reflect your expectations. FO4 had a similar issue.

NEUTRAL:
-I don't consider it a pro for a game to run properly, as I believe it is an expectation. Yes, AC:Od runs smoothly without frame rate drops on my 980Ti, i5-4690, and 16GB DDR3 RAM. 
-Cannot confirm any of the major issues other users have had so far. Likely, I haven't run into these game breaking issues due to patches (exception being the game crashing after death). Your experience may differ, and I'm usually very lucky about not experiencing major bugs and issues.
-Naval combat makes a return, but it isn't anything innovative or exciting. If you enjoyed AC:BF or AC:R you'll either enjoy the naval combat or get bored by it fast like me.
-Consequences for your actions feel shallow. You can switch sides in the war at any point for no reason because "mercenary", though there are some good moments where your previous actions are brought to light in future missions.

VERDICT:
-If you are an AC fan, this game is definitely for you, especially if you enjoyed AC:Or. 
-If you are just getting into the series, are looking for an open-world exploration game, or just like stealthily killing people, wait for a sale.

If you liked Origins, you will LOVE this. I've got about 56 hours at the time I'm writing this and I've barely explored like 35% of the game map... Crazy value for the money if you ask me, even if you get the Ultimate Edition like I did!

Everything AC Origins had, but better. One of the biggest things that I noticed was that every creature/quest scales just like you. In Origins something that bugged me was that all of the little sidequests that I had left undone were too easy/not worth the time after I had completed the main story. Not the case in Odyssey, everything will be leveled up to (at least) your level!

One other thing to mention is the actual game difficulty. One of the things that I always thought the AC series could improve on, ever since AC2, was that combat always felt a little too easy. In Odyssey, though, you can set the difficulty to "Nightmare" and enjoy as 1-2 wolves take you down in a matter of seconds.

10/10 would buy again, and again, and again.
