去年，蛰伏两年的《刺客信条》系列通过出色的素质与ARPG化很好地扭转了系列岌岌可危的口碑，成为了新一代刺客变革的转折点。然而这部《刺客信条：起源》并不完美，不过其打下的游戏框架足够扎实，续作仅需要对其深入打磨，在原有框架的基础上丰厚其血肉，便能带来超越前作的体验。

而育碧也正是这么做的。因此一年后的E3上，高调亮相的《刺客信条：奥德赛》各方面都与前辈《起源》颇为相似，自然也免不了被玩家吐槽“换皮”。然而相似并不代表相同，《奥德赛》强化后的战斗体验、细致化的人物养成、一路战个不停的佣兵系统、极富冒险感的海战，以及跳出“刺客”小格局的故事都为我带来远超以往的乐趣。所以请不要带着有色眼镜去误会它，《刺客信条：奥德赛》绝对是一款值得一玩的好游戏。

[h1]这就是斯巴达！[/h1]

在《起源》里感受过古埃及的满目黄沙后，《奥德赛》把故事的主场搬到同样是地中海风情，但风光景致要靓丽得多的古希腊。说到希腊文化，一般人更多的会想到斯巴达这个战士的国度。一部《斯巴达300勇士》给多少人留下了不可磨灭的精神冲击。而我们这次的主角便是流淌着斯巴达血脉的佣兵战士，可想而知本作的战斗系统会侧重硬碰硬的正面作战。

《奥德赛》在前作以格挡、轻攻击、重攻击为主的战斗系统之上，经过了更为细致的打磨，加入了多样化的主动技能。通过在技能树中投入技能点升级解锁，玩家可以获得远程、近战、暗杀三系中各自不同的主动技能，既有荼毒带火的BUFF系技能，也有震地冲击波伤害系技能。例如E3演示上经典的“斯巴达踢”便是近战系主动技能之一。虽与前作一样是三系技能，但不同的选择能玩出不同的味道

虽说这样的主动技能在ARPG中并不少见，不过相较于前作比较粗糙的战斗系统，本作三系不同侧重的主动技能足以为原本简单战斗框架增添大量新鲜感。此外，《奥德赛》也针对原本的格挡与闪避系统做了强化。不仅提升了两者的视觉效果，还赋予了它们更强大的功能：成功格挡后既能让敌人产生硬直，也能增加肾上腺素能量条；完美闪避敌人攻击可以触发一段子弹时间，方便追击。

这些新要素辅以新的肾上腺素系统，《奥德赛》的战斗不再是前作那样无脑蓄力、放大招，而是通过普通攻击、格挡闪避、技能三者形成了合理的循环，乐趣自然也就有了大幅度的升级。

当然，并不是所本作所有的战斗都是正面作战，玩家依然可以选择刺客式的潜入作战。不过稍显遗憾的是，在沙盒这个大框架下，本作的潜行刺杀仍然无法重现系列巅峰的精巧设计，依旧保持着《起源》的粗糙。AI低下，玩法简单粗暴，难度过低等等毛病让游戏的刺杀体验远不及硬碰硬那般精彩。

[h1]战个痛快的佣兵国战[/h1]

《奥德赛》的战斗乐趣并不止于此。本作加入的佣兵与国战系统足以满足你随时随地战个痛快的愿望。

本作的主角身为四海漂泊的佣兵，并没有阵营立场，也没有法律顾忌，因此可以随意的在雅典人或是斯巴达人的领土上为所欲为。不过，不管是当众偷窃还是当街杀人，都会积累玩家的通缉条，一旦积累到一定程度便会有同为佣兵的强大敌人前来追捕。

玩家可以选择直接应战杀死对方，也可选择躲开避风头等待悬赏过期，亦可以主动支付罚金来保一时平安。不管玩家如何应对，佣兵都是如影随形的一道阻碍，这在一方面促使玩家多潜行刺杀避免悬赏值上升，另一方面也给玩家留足了自虐的空间。毕竟每一位佣兵都是强大的存在，做恶过度时，往往会有两三名佣兵同时追捕玩家，想要正面应战几乎是对玩家操作的究极考验。

当然，身为佣兵，除了被同僚追得满街跑，也能参与国战按功论赏。与《枭雄》里的帮派战争相似，本作同样可以在各地区做任务、搞破坏来削减当前地区的国力值，从而引发国战。不过不同于《枭雄》的帮派战争，玩家在国战中可以随意选择效力的阵营，不管是是斯巴达还是雅典，一切只看钱。而进攻方与防守方在作战难度上又有所不同，是选择高难度高报酬还是选择低难度低报酬，都看玩家自己。

[h1]刺客信条宝可梦[/h1]

与遍地沙漠的埃及不同，古希腊的地图区域内包含大量的海岛，因此驾船远航自然是不可少的内容，随之而来的海战系统自然也在意料之中。不过，海战对于《刺客信条》系列而言并不是什么新鲜玩意了，毕竟《黑旗》里我们玩的已经足够多，甚至在《起源》中也能重温一会。所以本作延续自《黑旗》的海战系统自然新鲜感寥寥。

然而！本作的船只升级要素中有一项副手让本作的海战有了别样的乐趣。玩家可以通过完成支线任务来获取各种副手NPC，并将他们委派至战舰上参与战斗。倘若只是跑跑腿做做支线，那自然是无聊，作为出身斯巴达的佣兵做事自然要干脆点，直接打服敌人将其招募。

游戏中只要通过非致命手段将敌人打倒，便可以将对方招入麾下担当船员打手。而这个敌人并不局限于小兵，任何你看得上的佣兵，甚至是当前区域的领主国王都能一脚踹服，抓上船。而且往往佣兵与领主都是传说品质的强力副手，一刀砍死甚是可惜。这就给予了玩家更多的动力，是直接打死对手完成任务呢，还是周旋一番，一脚踹倒，掳走当小弟？

不得不说，这套强行抓人的系统有了几分《宝可梦》、《合金装备：幻痛》的味道，足以让人沉迷抓人无心开船。不过比较遗憾的是，《奥德赛》的船只系统只是《黑旗》的翻版，因此做的比较浅，区区四格副手位置难以承载玩家“抓人”的欲望。最后往往是列表里一片冷板凳船员，能用的只有四个。

[h1]漫游希腊，追寻上古[/h1]

虽说《奥德赛》发售时间晚于《起源》，但讲述的却是刺客信条起源之前的故事。没有了刺客这个概念的束缚，《奥德赛》把视角放到更加久远的先行者身上，而着眼点的不同，也让游戏的体验不同。

主角作为流淌着斯巴达血脉的孤儿，从小过着颠沛流离的生活，因缘际会下走出了隐居的小岛，深入希腊腹地追寻自己的亲人与血脉。并在随之而来的巨大阴谋中，一步步揭开自己与上古先行者之间的秘密，继而拯救世界于水火。

单纯来看，这个故事框架非常老套俗气，然而这背后牵扯的先行者是刺客系列一直以来最神秘的世界观设定。过去犹抱琵琶半遮面的神秘面纱再度被揭开，赋予了故事更多的深度。正因为有了先行者这条主脉，本作的剧情才能在俗套的发展中也能一步步的吸引人深入其中。

当然，在先行者这个噱头之外，《奥德赛》还在故事剧情中做了一些其他尝试，例如时下流行的对话选项系统。玩家可以通过选择来改变部分故事的走向。或是直接开打，或是展开一夜风流，或是直接影响结局，多样的选择也为本作的故事增添了一些新意。

新要素固然好，不过育碧一贯以来的剧本编排水平还是难堪大任，因而很多时候选项之间没有彼此联系。除却几个关键节点的选择影响结果，其他的选择都可有可无。这点虽无伤大雅但却让玩家的选择失去了重量，不得不说是个遗憾。

不得不提的一点是，本作的故事极其冗长，单单是中期寻亲这段故事便有足足十数小时之长，实在让人汗颜。毕竟现代人最缺的就是时间，如果只为了看一段故事，哪怕只过主线，也要耗费近30小时的时间，实在是缺乏性价比。

[h1]总评：纵有珠玉在前，仍能绽放其华[/h1]

在前作成功重拾口碑，将系列重新带回你我视线后，大家都很期待育碧能在续作中带给我们什么惊喜。然而基于前作打造的《刺客信条：奥德赛》，不免让人有了一些担忧。但事实证明，《刺客信条：奥德赛》是在《起源》基础上的又一次超越。更具乐趣的战斗、更加丰富的玩法、更加触及世界观核心的故事， 通过玩法上的扩展和剧情上的补完，使得《刺客信条：奥德赛》真正成为了一款体验圆满的游戏。

当然，它与前辈一样依然不完美，但起码育碧做出了许多尝试，努力在追寻让系列发展的新方向。就冲这点，就值得为之点赞，更何况这里还有一个风光秀丽，源于真实的希腊等待你去探索，有什么什么理由不买一份，远征奥德赛呢？

Кредо Спарты: улучшенная версия оригинса.

Одна из ЛУЧШИХ (серьезно, а в плане геймплея возможно и лучшая) игра из франшизы.
Короче, сразу всем кто: не атсасин больше и такого рода - соси, просто соси. Пора принять факт, что история про абстерго и однокнопчная боевка уже изжили себя.

Игра отличная, сюжет очень интересный, побочки на уровне оригинса (чуть хуже местами, но их больше).
Бои на кораблях уровня черного флага, система немезиды из лотра (правда по хуже, но всеравно).
В игре ОЧЕНЬ красивый мир, отлично проработан.
Отличная боевка с интересной прокачкой и умениями.

В общем если оригинс понравился - этот 100% зайдет, ибо после одиссеи когда играешь в оригинс - оригинс кажется беткой. Прям НУ ОЧЕНЬ ХОРОШО, хотя если честно по началу относился к данной игре скептически.

Годная игра, 11 пись на статуях из 10.
本代又名海战信条：人贩子。可以把人打晕了再招作副手的抓汉子系统太骚了，从此我就走上了人物收集的不归路，感觉自己不是古希腊人倒像是跑到非洲大陆抓老黑奴的。

Kiedy uruchomimy po raz pierwszy Assassin's Creed Odyssey, na usta cisną się słowa: "Ja już tutaj byłem". I rzeczywiście, każdy kto grał w Assassin's Creed Origins, od razu zobaczy znajome klimaty. Wszystko jest tutaj niemal identyczne, nawet mamy ponownie własnego ptaka. I nie piszę tu bynajmniej o tym, co się nam buja między nogami, a o najprawdziwszym orle czy innym sokole (nigdy nie byłem mocny w ornitologii), który jest naszym radarem, czujką, szpiegiem... Whatever. Czy takie powielanie schematów jest dobrze widziane? Z jednej strony fajnie, bo każdy kto zaliczył Origins poczuje się jak ryba w wodzie, (prawdziwa ryba a nie ślimak, jak nas uczy Unia Europejska). Nie będzie problemów z ogarnięciem tego wszystkiego, w końcu jesteśmy weteranami poprzedniej części, damy sobie radę. Z drugiej jednak strony niby wszystko wygląda niby tak samo, ale po wgłębieniu w niuanse mamy sporo zmian.

Tym razem przenosimy się z Egiptu do starożytnej Grecji, a konkretnie w okres wojen peloponeskich. Akcja cirka "ebaut" 400 lat wstecz względem wydarzeń z Origins. Do wyboru mamy dwie postacie, standardowo faceta o imieniu Alexios lub babka Kassandra. Czy są jakieś różnice między postaciami w umiejętnościach, tego nie wiem. Zagrałem laską, ponieważ niedawno zaliczyłem najnowszego Tomb Raidera, więc przywykłem do oglądania damskiego tyłeczka. Wydaje mi się jednak, że różnice są czysto kosmetyczne, albowiem Kassandra musi równie dobrze strzelać z łuku jak i wymachiwać mieczem, podobnie jak zwykły żołdak. Zwykle kobiety strzelają z łuków, a od machania są faceci, taki już nas los. Tu jednak jest pełne uprawnienie. Co do samej akcji, to zaczyna się podobnie jak w części poprzedniej. Zaczynamy w jakiejś zapyziałej wioszczynie, na wysepce zapomnianej przez Boga, uppps, bogów. W trakcie zaliczania fabuły poznajemy otaczający nas świat, awansujemy w hierarchii społecznej i ze zwykłego hycla odganiającego bezpańskie psy zmieniamy się w wojownika pełną piersią. Do wyboru mamy dwie frakcje, które możemy wspomagać - Ateńczyków i Spartan. Nie to jest jednak najciekawsze. Otrzymaliśmy opcje dialogowe, dzięki którym sami możemy decydować o rozwoju fabuły. Teraz Assassin's Creed został pełnoprawnym RPG-iem. 

O grafice nie będę piał peanów. To wprawdzie nadal ten sam silnik, ale nieco tam zmodyfikowany. Jest w każdym razie ładnie i kolorowo, chociaż ze smutkiem przyznam, że jakoś świat z Origins bardziej mi się podobał. Tam były piramidy, palmy, piękne oazy a tu są zwykłe krzaki i drzewka oliwne, które z natury są brzydkie, jakby je przykrył trzydniowy kurz. W każdym razie mamy mniej pustyń, a więcej zieleni, oraz gór, pagórków i wyżyn, na których będziemy wytrząsać swoje grzeszne cielsko. No cóż, Grecja jest dla nas, Europejczyków mniej egzotyczna niż Egipt, więc z tym musimy się liczyć. Niestety oprócz krajobrazów ludność także jest jakaś szara i ponura. W Origins było gwarno i kolorowo, ludzie mieli barwne stroje, wszędzie biegały gromady rozkrzyczanych dzieciaków, wszystko tętniło życiem. Tutaj mamy snujących się ludzi-zombie. Na dokładkę postacie są nieciekawe, bez życia, za stroje mają zwykłe i powtarzalne worki od ziemniaków. Nie oszukujmy się, kolorowe stroje w Origins były ładniejsze, moja postać też nie wygląda ciekawie w tych ponurych zbrojach. No, ale może w miastach ludzie będą modniej ubrani.

Dalej na szczęście jest lepiej. Lepiej, ale i także nieco się zawiodłem.  A konkretnie mam na myśli rozwój postaci. Drzewko rozwoju jest wprawdzie skromne, ale za to dostajemy po cztery umiejętności specjalne na broń biała i łuk. Coś na wzór tych z Guild Wars 2. Oczywiście sami możemy wybrać, które ze skilli specjalnych chcemy używać, oraz na jakie sloty je zbindować. I wierzcie mi, są one bardzo potrzebne, albowiem nasi przeciwnicy są tym razem bardzo wyrafinowani. Gra jest o wiele trudniejsza od Origins i wymaga w czasie walki pewnej taktyki. Uniki to już nie odskakiwanie na dziesięć metrów, wszystko jest bardziej naturalne. Ponadto wrogowie skrzykują się jak banda Turków w Berlinie i nawet, jeśli napadniemy na samotnego wojaka, po wyskoczeniu z nim na solo mamy po chwili na karku cała chmarę jego wkurzonych kolesi. Otwarta walka z nimi zwykle kończy się napisem "desynchronizacja", zatem musimy nauczyć się ucieczki i walki podjazdowej. A wierzcie mi, wróg łatwo nie odpuszcza i potrafi was gonić przez połowę Grecji. Miodzio. 

Usprawnianie ekwipunku także mamy zmienione. Nie ma już ulepszania kołczanu o liczbę strzał, bo i po co. Teraz mamy grawerunki, dzięki którym dowolnie zwiększamy wybrane przez nas moce broni. Samych strzał otrzymujemy kilka rodzajów, oprócz zwykłych są ogłuszające, zapalające, zatruwające, eksplodujące, mniam. Aby jednak je posiadać, potrzebujemy zbierać surowce takie jak, żelazo, skóra, drewno itd. Doszedł także specjalny rzadki minerał, za który kupujemy luksusowy ekwipunek u objazdowego kramarza i wydrwigrosza. Ale to, co zasługuje na specjalną uwagę to fakt, że mamy teraz na stanie swój statek. I nie jakąś byle krypę do połowu śledzi, a dalekomorską jednostkę z własną załogą i przybocznymi, których własnoręcznie rekrutujemy. W przeciwieństwie bowiem do Origins, tutaj położono większy nacisk na walki morskie, mamy nawet zadania poboczne z nimi związane. Statek naturalnie ulepszamy, możemy zmieniać skiny, załogę, zwiększać siłę ognia i wytrzymałość. Tak więc eksplorować teren jak najbardziej trzeba, bo jest na co wydawać surowce. 

Zwiększono liczbę zadań pobocznych. I uwierzcie mi, ale zwiększono ich kilkakrotnie. Ponadto na wzór Wiedźmina 3, są one podzielone na rodzaje. Kontrakty, zlecenia, zadania długoterminowe, gdzie wykonywanie jednego może zając cała grę. Część zadań zbieramy z tablic w wioskach i miasteczkach, część wychodzi sama z siebie. A jak już zaliczymy lokację na 100% okazuje się, że właśnie doszły na niej nowe wyzwania. Na dokładkę część z nich mają opcję czasową, więc nie możemy ich zostawić na później. Także nagrodę możemy dobrać do własnych preferencji. Albo godzimy się na nią, albo proponujemy funkcję przybocznego na naszej łajbie. Mało tego, często możemy zaprosić zleceniodawcę do łóżka na upojną noc. Trochę to dziwnie wygląda, kiedy Kassandra idzie w tango z drugą panienką, ale może i lepiej. Nie wiem jak to bowiem wygląda z drugiej strony i nie wiem, czy zdzierżyłbym widok, jak Alexios wali w ślinę z jakimś szczerbatym fagasem z tawerny. Zresztą już motto Origins brzmiało, że Grecy wymyślili sex, ale dopiero Rzymianie dorzucili do niego kobiety. 

Na koniec nie sposób nie wspomnieć o walkach batalistycznych. Kiedy już obniżymy morale na jakimś terenie, a obniżamy wpływy lokalnego władyki poprzez eliminowanie pobliskich obozów wojennych i twierdz, otrzymujemy możliwość udziału w walce o podbój całego obszaru. Co ciekawe, stajemy do niej jako najemnik, zatem sami możemy zdecydować, czy wspomożemy Spartiatów czy Ateńczyków. A sama walka na polu bitwy, wokół dziesiątki NPC-ków, my zaś naparzamy się z nimi jak zwykły żołnierz, stajemy do walki z wodzami. Takie coś można było dotychczas uświadczyć chyba tylko w serii Battlefront. Ale to jeszcze nie koniec. Pomagamy zdobyć teren, ale nic nie stoi na przeszkodzie, aby obniżyć morale danego terenu i podbić go raz jeszcze, tym razem dla strony przeciwnej. Pamiętajmy, jesteśmy najemnikiem. Z nikim ślubu nie braliśmy. Możemy równie dobrze pomagać Grekom, aby w połowie gry zmienić front i zdezerterować dla Sparty. Nie ma to większego znaczenia, bo kto by danym terenem nie władał, zawsze przywita nas zbrojnym orężem, kiedy wejdziemy do jego twierdzy. Taki widać już los najemnika.

Pisać mógłbym długo. Gra naprawdę ma potencjał. Gram trzy dni, a dopiero liznąłem dwie malutkie wysepki. A co będzie dalej? Jak dotrę do wielkich miast? Już drżę na myśl, co mnie czeka. A potem dodatki. Oj będzie się działo, będzie. Assassin's Creed Odyssey to wspaniała gra, rozwinięcie pomysłów z Origins. Twórcy obiecali więcej wszystkiego i nie zawiodłem się. Kupować w ciemno.

Поиграв не так много времени,могу сказать что данная часть игры выглядит интересно. Смешав Истоки и Черный флаг вместе. Получился отличный коктейль который приятно попробовать. Конечно с оптимизацией туго,но все равно играется приятно. Надеюсь разработчики поправят это с обновлениями. Для любителей серии Ассасина рекомендую данную игру

I have to start by saying that this is one of my favorite games of this year, and probably one of my favorite Assassin’s Creed games I have played. I love that you get to choose and mold your character how you want and it seems like they toke all the best parts of many different Assassins Creed and ubisoft games which makes for a fun and very interesting title for me, I highly recommend this game, the game as far as I can tell doesn’t strongly connect with the Assassins vs Templars we have come to know in past games, but I still think this is a very welcome title to the franchise, and the map is absolutely gorgeous and gigantic, and the larger battles are a welcome feature through conquest battles, it feels like you never could run out of something to do in this game, and you can sparta kick people off of basically anything so thats a plus, I will say sometimes the narrative and script can leave you scratching your head, but I can overlook that, now I gotta get back to sinking ships and sparta kicking everybody!
gud

首先，选择差评的理由是差评内容大于好评内容。

优点：风景依旧优美；剧情可选好评；海战+船歌好评；探索模式好评；AI变聪明了，知道多打一了等

缺点：
1、我建议这游戏改为《斯巴达之魂：奥德赛》比较好。AC这一作确实强调了刺客，鼓励玩家更多去刺杀，而不是玩家口中的“狂战士信条”；但是，加强了刺客伤害却大幅度削减战士和猎人的伤害，在“新手岛”上同级的杂鱼可以去刺杀秒了，但是队长头领级别的人物不可以（刺杀伤害不够，需要升级装备，提升伤害数值）。一旦潜入被发现，正面刚的话，伤害低的要命（初始时战士和猎人的伤害数值只是刺客的一个零头）打一个杂鱼都要打半天，更何况是头领级别的人呢（噩梦难度下）；而且要说像黑魂那样二人转还好，由于AI变聪明了，喜欢多打一，所以就变成了多人转（我在噩梦难度下，打两下要不断的闪避招架，只要被任何敌人挨到两三下我就是死）。

2、比ACO更加成熟，游戏基本靠堆数值。育碧鼓励玩家去刺杀却又把战士的伤害数值调那么低，关键是还有一大堆因剧情需要！而强行正面打斗的环节！噩梦难度下真的令人崩溃（低伤害值，高死亡率）。那么，如何才能让自己不像之前所述的那么难受呢？要么氪金（其实更多的是强行逼你氪金氪材料）要么肝材料和金钱升级装备，提升数值。

3、相比ACO，至少探索地图，问号还能有个金色和普通之分，以区别主要和次要。到了这一作，所有问号都是一样的，强行增加游戏时长。

4、佣兵机制更加恶心。我在“新手岛”，那佣兵基本上是我到哪他在我附近，而且我隐蔽起来，佣兵就在附近晃悠不走；我在洞穴里探索支线任务，佣兵在洞口来回走动；甚至我有一次快速旅行到鸟瞰点，佣兵瞬移到我脚下（以为不下去，他打不到？不存在的。近战远程武器他都会用）。以上才只是新手岛的佣兵，后期高等级的佣兵，在噩梦难度下，范围攻击或者破防重击挨一下就没了。注意：如果你的等级超过你所在区域佣兵的等级，那么此佣兵的等级会提升至和你同级！

5、bug问题（有待证实）。在新手岛附近去 奥休斯宫殿（记不清了），出现了bug，宫殿里的宝箱、石板、陶片之类的都不能开和拿，此外触发“小奥德赛”的支线任务的关键NPC不会跟你走去特定的地方。重新读档之后依旧是这个问题（以为坏档了）。把需要从宫殿里把袍子取回后交还给NPC后方正常了（不知道是本身设定就是这样的，还是bug）。

最后建议所有想入奥德赛的刺客们，如果你有矿，当我没说；否则你只能肝，肝材料和金钱，做支线升级等级以此来获取一定的良好游戏体验（为什么说一定？这一作设定是，不管你到多少级，都有敌人是和你平起平坐的）。还有，不建议选择噩梦难度，低伤害值+高死亡率会让你崩溃的。

（推荐大家选择  探索模式  的游玩机制）

（回复一下下面评论的人，你不菜为啥要选困难难度？）

Think of this game as upgraded/improved AC: Origins, that is better in every aspect. 
I mean seriously AC: Origins personally for me was 'meh' - yeah it was something fresh and new from last AC games but still Origins felt so rushed for me. 

And now Odyssey - such a fun to play game. Yes it has it's flaws - especially microtransactions - complete BS and this should be thrown away ASAP, in all games, but let's talk about pros for a start. 

PROS: 

Start of the game is great - you get to choose your character (male or female) and map exploration type - guided (if you want all map, quests and other markers placed as usual, as it was in Origins or exploration type - RPGish type, where you have to find quests, landmarks and other stuff before it's pinned to your map, even quest directions sometimes not shown, so you have to listen carefully all dialogues. 

Story plays well so far, I mostly did main quests so far and it's really good, characters are finally seem memorable and interesting. 

Dialogues options - now you can choose what to say to characters during cutscenes - some dialogues will have consequences later. 

Graphics are amazing - it's basically same as Origins just tweaked in some ways, but open world looks outstanding - foliage and greenery looks great, sea waves very realistically. 

Sound is good, about open world - wind, rain, ocean etc really well done, although some weapons could sound a bit more realistic. 

Lots of activities in the game, tons of quests, discovering landmarks, many different armor sets, weapons and bows, upgradable character, upgradable ship, skill tree is very well done for three different playstyles - hunter, assassin and warrior - or a hybrid. 

Combat is amazing - so much better than Origins or any other AC game. You have usable skills now - kicks, HP restoration, also bow skills and of course counter attacks. 

Bounty hunt system - some of your actions have consequences, you can't steal, randomly kill guards or attack civilians, otherwise bounty hunters will start looking for you and it requires good gear to be able to fight them. 

CONS: 

Side quests are still pretty lame - done about 15 of them already and they are pretty much the same as it was in Origins - go to camp, kill some bandits, loot some stuff, comeback to NPC for reward, that's it. 

It's still grindy game, you are forced to constantly loot materials, to do monotonous side quests to raise the level and to get better gear, otherwise you will be back and easily killable, and you just won't be able to proceed main story. 

Microtransactions - obtainable high end gear and so called "time savers" with reall money... 

In overall, this is really great and fun to play Assassin's Creed game with lots of actions and activities with great combat system, interesting story, lots of different weapons and gear, different playstyle skill trees and fun ship battles. Some aspects of the game are being stolen from others game (bounty hunters system pretty much the same as nemesis system in Middle-Earth, dialogue choices feels similar to Witcher game and yes, MTX ruining this game as any other, and if you refuse to get in-game content with real money you will have to grind a lot. But so far I think it's still worth the money because for it's price this game has a lot of content to offer in main game, plus season pass with DLCs and community challanges later.

오리진에서 사이드 퀘스트가 다채로워진 편인데 이번 오디세이는 여기에 선택지를 통한 분기까지 생겼다. 또한 뭘 선택하는 기분 더러운 선택지인 경우도 있어 위쳐 3과 더 비슷해진 느낌. 

전투 역시 많이 괜찮아졌다. 활, 암살, 근접 전투의 총 3가지 분야를 무조건 올라운더로 키우는 게 아닌 한 가지에만 집중해서 파는 게 가능해졌고 전작의 웃음만 나오던 해전은 충각, 투창 등으로 인해 훨씬 현실적으로 느껴진다. 하지만 대규모 정복전의 경우 홍보한 것에 비하면 적 장수만 때려잡으면 끝인 구성이라 실망. 

비사실적이라도 유저가 플레이하기 편한 요소를 넣어주는 등 많이 발전한 작품. 다만 날 추격하는 현상금 사냥꾼이나 랜덤 인카운터 퀘스트 등 무한 반복적인 요소는 매우 성의없다고 느껴졌다.
==================================================
스토리 및 진행
어크 시리즈에서는 선택지가 있어봤자 대화문만 바뀌는 정도였지만 여기선 거짓말을 할지, 누굴 죽일지 살릴지 같은 것을 결정할 수 있게 되었으며 이 선택이 뒤의 스토리에도 영향을 끼친다.

오리진 때도 위쳐 3 비슷하게 되어 간다는 느낌을 받았지만 여기선 이 선택지를 통한 결과와 책임을 통해 더 비슷해졌다. 유부남이었던 오리진과 달리 솔로여서 그런지 로맨스가 추가된 점도 주목할만하다. 물론 그냥 키스하고 시간 지나가는 것만 보여주고 끝이다. 

단점으로는 단순 반복 퀘스트를 자꾸 팝업으로 보여줘서 억지로 하도록 유도하는데 이 반복 퀘스트는 더럽게 재미없다 -_-  또한 전작의 현상금 헌터는 이번 작에서 용병이란 이름이 되었는데 무한 스폰이라 잡는 맛이 없다. 그나마 개성 부여하겠다고 약점이나 강점이 존재하는데 이걸 보여주는 창의 모습은 흡사 섀도우 오브 모르도르. 
=====================================
전투
무조건 올라운더 형식으로 키워야 했던 오리진과 다르게 활, 암살, 근접 중 한 가지에 집중해서 키우는 것이 가능해졌다. 거기다 기존 오리진에는 액티브 스킬이 하나밖에 없었지만 여기서는 수많은 액티브 스킬들이 추가됐으며 화살에 있는 4개 슬롯, 근접+암살에 있는 4개의 슬롯에 원하는 스킬을 등록하고 싸우게 된다. 단, 이 때문에 아이템 사용은 거의 사라지다시피 했으며 활은 모두 한 종류로 통일되었다.

특히 암살의 경우 정해진 피해량이 있어서 적의 체력이 정해진 피해량을 넘어가서 한 방에 못 죽이는 적의 경우 무조건 근접전으로 마무리 해야 하는 게 어크였지만 여기선 강하게 암살하기가 생겨  한 방에 죽일 수 있는 급을 나눴으며 들키더라도 은신에 돌입하는 스킬을 쓰던가 멀리서 강하게 쏘기로 한 방에 죽이는 등 스킬을 통해 싸우는 방식의 차별화가 생긴 점이 훌륭하다.  

해전의 경우 전작 오리진은 그냥 이벤트 성이라 대포를 화살 스킨 씌운 것 같은 처참한 수준이었지만 여기선 충각 돌진이 큰 역할을 하고 배 업그레이드가 생겼으며 부관이라는 갑판에서 싸우기도 하고 육상에서 호출도 가능하고 버프도 주는 캐릭이 하나 생겨 커스터마이징도 다채로워졌다. 

하지만 스파르타 VS 아테네 전투에 끼여드는 정복전은 노잼. 진형도 안 갖추고 싸우는 난전에 끼어들어서 팝업으로 등장하는 적 장군 몇 번 죽이면 끝이다. 신디케이트에서 깡패 적진 정복하는 거보다 못한 수준.  
=======================================
최적화
버그 자체는 없지만 1080ti로 2560*1440 지포스 권장사양을 쓰는데 전투할 경우 45프레임 정도? 버그는 딱히 못 느꼈다.
====================================
번역
대사 내용이 달라지는 수준으로 의역이 엄청 들어간다.
한국어 자막이 이상한 곳에서 줄바꾸기 되는 경우가 엄청 많다. 
======================================
편의사항
현실성은 떨어지겠지만 낙사 없앤 것, 수중에서 창 휘두를 수 있게 된 것 굳. 
훔치기 버튼이 e인데 이 e로 온갖 일을 다하기 때문에 훔치기 싫어도 훔치는 경우가 엄청 나온다.
아이템 필터 후 일괄분해나 일괄판매 없는 거 엄청 맘에 안 든다. 보관함도 있으면 좋을듯

[h1] Assassin's Creed Odyssey [/h1]   [b] A journey longer than that of Odysseus [/b]  

[h1] 📋 Premise [/h1]  
It's been a little less than a year since Assassin's Creed Origins was released and we already have a brand new game in our hands. After Origins revolutionized the way we approach the franchise's games, Ubisoft is surfing the success wave with their brand new Assassin's Creed Odyssey, adding fire to their open-world series. From an all too flat desert scenery, we move on to a flourishing, stunning and vibrant world. 
Greece welcomes you with sun-drenched, lushy breathtaking lands and seas. Just one warning before you go: beware of the snakes in the grass.

[h1] ✅ Pros: [/h1]   
• An immersive story with an excellent narrative and dozens of plot twist to keep you on edge
• Extensive world with countless locations to explore and regions to conquer
• A protagonist can be either female or male
• The choices you make will have a longlasting impact on the world that surrounds you and in the quests you undertake
• Sailing returns in all its splendor and it feels better than ever
• Enjoyable companions and side characters
• A very clean user interface as well as neatly organized menus

[h1] ❎ Cons: [/h1]   
• The hyped "romance system" is nothing more than a series of one night stands: the options feel forced and add nothing to the story
• Weird facial expressions
• Dialogue choices can feel inconsistent

[h1] 🎮 Gameplay: in depth [/h1]   
[u][b] General information [/b][/u]  
Assassin's Creed Odyssey follows Origins in its footsteps, retracing its template and borrowing from the best open-world designs to craft an enrapturing experience. Every region and island in Greece has been recreated on a grand scale with a startling attention to details. The new exploration feature, Explorer Mode, minimizes the game's suggestions by removing waypoints and replacing them with three clues, leaving more room for the players to find out where to go. 

It's the very first Assassin's Creed installment in which we are asked whether we want to play as a male or female character: Alexios or Kassandra. No matter our choice here, the follow up will remain the same and the brothers will merely be exchanging places in the narration.

Speaking of choices, we can now pick from multiple answers during dialogues: asking for further information, accepting or declining a job, or very binary choices of good and evil in which we must decide whereas to kill an enemy or to show mercy. All this will eventually shape our character towards one of the many endings that Odyssey has to offer. However, the system might feel underwhelming at times.

Odyssey also makes a first attempt in engaging in romantic relationships, regardless of your gender. However, it fails terribly to deliver a proper experience and gives more room to a light-hearted series of one night stands. If the romantic aspect is awkward enough when it's offered as a reward, it's even more so when it's presented to us through dialogue choices, often breaking the seriousness of the moment and the flow of the conversation itself.

We can roam the regions cleaning enemy outposts, weakening the two factions or involving ourselves in large-scale battles to conquer regions for Sparta or Athens - we're mercenaries, after all. It's thanks to these last two features that the experience Odyssey offers is way more substantial.

[u][b] Story [/b][/u]  
For my first playthrough, I decided to take on the role of Kassandra: although the narrative stays the same no matter whom we play as Kassandra seems to be the most charismatic and charming of the two siblings.

We begin our story in Kephallonia, in the Korinthian Gulf, as a Spartan outcast that has been raised on the island ever since we were but a kid. The past hasn't forgotten about our character, and it will suddenly come hunting us, forcing us to leave the safe shores of Kephallonia to embark on a journey, unsuspecting of the web of lies that we will be uncovering. The story branches in many different directions and the choices we make will lead us to one of the different endings.

The enemy in Odyssey goes by the name of Cult of Kosmos, which is none other than the Templars as we know them. Discovering the Cult will open up a new menu through which we'll be able to take a look at the whole Cult's chain of command. Even though most of the cultists are untrackable at first, gathering more information by killing cult members will allow us to reveal their identities and track them down.

[u][b] Combat [/b][/u]
Combat is divided in three specializations: Hunter, Warrior, Assassin. Each of these has many different sets of skills that can be mixed between themselves and used to create various combinations allowing different approaches. We have 4 skills slots shared between Warrior and Assassin skills and another 4 slots that are for Hunter skills only.

Kicking people down from a cliff just like Leonidas in 300? We can do that. 
In every combat I engaged in I was able to experiment with a huge spectrum of unique approaches allowing me to lure enemies to their own death, or engage in a battle head on. The animations are smooth and the dodging and parrying mechanics, feeling a bit odd at first, will just come naturally after getting the hang of them. 

Most encounters won't feel particularly hard nor daunting unless you purposefully seek stronger enemies to fight or take part in Conquest Battles - which will become available relatively soon in the early game section.

[u][b] Content [/b][/u]   
Assassin's Creed Odyssey, much like Origins before, offers hundreds of hours of content divided between main quests (branched in 3 storylines), side quests, exploring and upgrading your gear. There are countless locations that are worthy to be visited and even more mysteries to be uncovered hidden in Greece.
Odyssey can easily take from 100 hours to 200 hours to enjoy its full potential.

[h1] 🔬 Technical Analysis [/h1]   
[u][b] Graphics [/b][/u]   
Stunning enough to leave you with your mouth agape. The world is green, vibrant, with incredible lighting effects (absolutely breathtaking when exploring a forest during sunset) and studded with flourishing locations. The wreckages and sunken temples that we can find under the sea are equally beautiful, sided with a handful of sea creatures.

[u][b] Music [/b][/u]   
Especially worth mentioning here is Odyssey's ambient music. In many occasions, whilst exploring, it felt like being thrown back in Skyrim. It's nice, relaxing, pleasing to the ears but it also perfectly transitions to battle themes, picking up its pace.

[u][b] Performance [/b][/u]   
The game runs particularly well and I haven't noticed any huge stutters. However, after running the game for some hours with no breaks, a few freezes started happening.

[u][b] HUD [/b][/u]   
The HUD is clean with a very similar layout to what we had in Origins. Only the essentials are consistently shown on screen (such as HP, Adrenaline, Skills...) and everything else can be accessed through the menu.

[u][b] Bugs Encountered [/b][/u]   
No game-breaking bugs have happened so far, nor did I have problems during quests.
Got stuck a few times while climbing, but letting go (pressing C) usually fixed the problem.

[h1] Wrapping up [/h1]   
Ubisoft is taking baby steps in shaping open-world games. Odyssey is the perfect example of this: they're taking many ideas and throwing them at a sticky wall to see what will last on it, in the long run. There are many aspects of Odyssey that overall feel unpolished or unnecessary, however, it's a game that still manages to hit the mark and will still offer the right amount of enjoyment and content for the money it's asking for.


[h1] RATING: 8.5/10 [/h1]   

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/23741321/]Follow our curator page,[b] Alexander's Club Curations[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

Ведьмак 3 от мира Assassin's Creed!

     По хорошему Ubisoft выпустила действительно огромную и проработанную игру серии за годы. В действительности на данный момент это ЛУЧШИЙ Assassin's Creed. Одиссея избавилась от всех недостатков прошлых частей серии, в Assassin's Creed теперь не скучно играть! Каждая предыдущая часть была по своему хороша, я проходил ВСЕ основные игры серии, даже парочку ответвлений в виде "изгоя" и "освобождения". Но бедой каждой игры серии всегда было наличие контента, вот недотягивали они всегда где-то, всегда в основном это был однотипный гринд или собирательство, и о да, наконец-то теперь контента столько, сколько НИКОГДА еще не было в серии! Теперь появилось столько разнообразных активностей, что прохождение займет минимум сотню часов. 

Если коротко о плюсах: 

- огромный открытый мир интересный для изучения

- интересные персонажи (для серии уж точно)

- достаточно интересный сюжет за которым теперь интересно наблюдать

- отличное звуковое сопровождение

- куча активностей

- теперь это РПГ (или очень на нее похоже)

- боевая система теперь напоминает слешер 

Минусы:

- не впечатляющая графика, даже "Истоки" выглядели лучше

- гринд никуда не делся (просто теперь он стал более разнообразным)

- оптимизация, можно было на много лучше (1070ti не всегда стабильные 60 fps)

Совет, проходить игру стоит минимум на высоком уровне сложности и в режиме исследования.
和起源同期制作？多制作了一年可玩性精细程度和起源比起来体验完全不一样。谁在说是起源大型DLC我就踢翻他的狗碗。顺便说一句。真香。
当踏入古希腊的土地，我们将都是斯巴达战士。

AC Odyssey is massive. There really isn't a better way to describe it. It feels as if Far Cry 5 and AC Origins had a baby that only inherited the better parts of each, with a little bit of their cousin, Shadow of Mordor, thrown in for good measure.

Pros:
+ It's beautiful, vibrant, and huge.
+ All of the RPG Elements from Progression to Gear
+ Likeable Characters (NPCs and Kassandra/Alexios)
+ Branching Story/Choices
+ Character Customization
+ Breathtaking and Immersive locations 
+ The Peloponnesian War
+ Endless Amount of Stuff to do
+ Engaging Combat
+ CONQUESTS
+ Photo Mode
+ Historical Locations
+ Very Free and Open World
+ Not as Buggy as Previous titles at Release
+ Large Variety of Weapons/Cosmetics
+ Runs Relatively Well considering its scope
+ Ship Combat is similar to Black Flag's
+ Tons of ways to play (Guided/Exploration Mode with Multiple Difficulties, Character Choice)

Cons:
- Some Bugs, but nothing gamebreaking for me quite yet
- Frame drops when near fire/level streaming kicks in (FPS drops is a listed issue on their site, so hopefully
it won't be around forever).
- Needs Optimization

My Rig:
Ryzen 5 1600 (3.2 GHz)
ASUS Strix Turbo 1060 6GB Edition
Corsair LPX 16GB 3000MHz

一句话概括:巫师3别名昆特3，刺客信条奥德赛别名巫师信条

真香

而且我一直认为游戏代入感是个很玄学的东西，反正我就谈谈个人意见，我感觉代入感强烈的游戏：巫师3，大嫖客，而个人玩起来全无代入感的游戏就是gta5,老滚5，辐射4，这三个游戏也不知道为什么就是玩着无感，经常就是主线做着就去干别的了，然后主线也忘记了，再玩一阵游戏也太监了。。而本作奥德赛给了我不错的游戏代入感，很赞
其实刺客信条我是根本没有接触过，库里的2也是那会听说补了中文凑热闹买的，之前听说这一次rpg要素很多，基本可以算是开放世界rpg，才预购的。一玩下来果然如此，本来看贴吧里很多人说是起源换皮游戏，随便了，反正起源我没玩过
玩了两天的感觉游戏我是给9.5分的，剧情音乐画面都属上乘，虽然支线重复性太高，而且我想吐槽一下这尼玛所有洞窟入口都一个样么，这也太省事了。。。让我不由得想到全境封锁的下水道也都是一个样，希腊和纽约的异曲同工之妙
优化又多少人吐槽也就不差少我一个了。大家都懂，但是这个游戏目前遇到两种严重bug:
第一就是游戏崩溃，我建议大家如果全屏崩溃就开无边框，无边框崩溃就换全屏，确实能解决问题。
第二就是游戏中读档有一定几率会黑屏卡死，这个暂时无解，只能尽量少死了。
似乎信条bug也是常态了，虽然没玩过旧作，我记得当年在游戏杂志上看见有哪一作还会中途坏档，那这么来说这一作的bug已经相当给面子了。
讲真从当年预购全境掉线以来就没有入过育碧的新游戏，我是感觉本作各种内购项目吃相略微难看，因为这两年的新作都没玩，也不晓得是不是近期都这样，如果一贯吃相如此大家已经习惯。。请忽略这个吃相问题
。。。对了 新游戏我好像买过一次。。尬舞啊！
emmmmm
游戏我给9.5分，吃相减1分，个人心目8.5分，相当值得一玩的大作，严重推荐
For me, best assassin! :D

스포일러 없는 후기 및 팁 

어쌔신크리드 시리즈 최초로 여캐 남캐 선택이 추가되었습니다. 
여캐 남캐의 스토리는 완전히 동일합니다.

다양한 엑티브 스킬이 추가되었습니다
발차기를 사용해 상대방을 날려버린다거나!
상대방의 방패를 없애버린다거나 무기에 불속성을 부여하는등
다양한 스킬의 추가로 전투 진행 속도가 빨라졌습니다.

오디세이에서는 별도의 방어구 아이템들이 추가되어 
방어구를 갈아입을때마다 외형이 바뀌고 
방어구 효과에 따라 암살/활/근접무기 대미지가 바뀌기에 
방어구에도 신경을 써줘야 원활한 플레이가 가능해졌습니다.

어쌔신크리드 시리즈 최초로 대화에 선택지가 추가되어 
퀘스트 진행중 엔피시를 죽이거나 살리는등의 선택이 가능해졌고 
자신의 선택에 따라 약간씩 달라지는 것들이 있습니다.

블랙플래그의 해상전이 돌아왔기에 전체적인 느낌은
오리진과 블랙플래그를 합쳐놓은듯한 느낌이 들기도 합니다 
하지만 해상전이 메인인 게임은 아니기에
메인 스토리 진행중에는 배를 탈 일이 거이 없습니다.
(새로운 지역으로 가기위해 사용하는 정도)
해상전을 원하시는 유저라면 해상전을 즐기시면 되고
그렇지 않은 유저분이라면 육지에서만 뛰어다니셔도 충분합니다.
메인퀘스트 진행중에만 딱히 배 탈 일이 없을뿐이지
해상 서브퀘스트,영웅배 컨텐츠도 여전히 존재합니다
====
게임 팁 - (주관적) 

1.방패 파괴 스킬을 배우면 방패든 적과의 전투가 수월해집니다.

2.전투중 생존이 힘들경우 원기회복 스킬에 1포인트를 넣어주시면
쉽게 안죽고 오래오래 버텨가며 싸움을 이어나갈수 있습니다.

3.암살자 스킬의 영웅의 일격은 전투중에도 사용이 가능하기에 
전투를 주로하시는 유저분들도 유용하게 사용할수 있는 스킬입니다.

4.암살 플레이시 치명적인 암살 스킬과 잠행의 달인 스킬을 찍어줍시다
잠행의 달인 3단계시 밤 시간에 암살 대미지 증가 효과가 있습니다.

5.길가에 있는 닭 무시하지 말것

6.레벨스케일링이 강제로 적용되어 있는 게임입니다.

7.스킬 퀵슬롯 갯수는 메인스토리 진행중 8개로 늘어납니다.
====

암살 플레이를 주로 하시는 유저분들을 위한 주관적인 글 

이번작 암살 플레이가 많이 까다로워졌습니다.
전작 오리진의 경우 암살검만 주구장창 업그레이드를 해놓으면
그나마 할만한 수준이였고 이중암살도 굉장히 편했으나 
오디세이 부터는 암살 대미지 업그레이드 같은건 사라졌고
암살 대미지를 높이기 위해 방어구까지 신경을 써줘야하며
잠행의 달인 3레벨 찍은뒤에는 밤 시간대 플레이가 강제 됩니다. 
이중암살은 엑티브 스킬로 빠졌으나(돌진암살)대미지가 높지않아
약한애들 아닌이상 써먹기 애매한 기술이 되었습니다. 

암살 플레이를 하더라도 결국은 근접전투를 해야만 하는 게임인지라 
전투 스킬에 하나도 투자를 안하겠다는 생각은 버리셔야할겁니다.

I'll keep this short and sweet, The grind is unacceptable. The Story is fun and the moments it tries to pull off work 95% of the time. The world of Ancient Greece is fun to explore and run around in. The naval stuff is.... fine, but its part of the unacceptable level of grinding.

This is the same engine that ran Origins, and I just wanna say, the FRAMES oh my GAWD. I am surprised, truly. I have a 1800X on a pro carbon 370 with a Vega64 for 4k and honestly Origins kind of ran like crap some times. Odyssey though? Nah not even, it runs like butter!

Also I think I'll make a seperate little section for the game's soundtrack. It. Is. SO GOOD. Its EASILY one of the best AC soundtracks in the series.

Overall its an Ubisoft assassin's creed game. The RPG elements are fine but ubisoft got confused and thought RPG meant Meat Grinder for loot (which most of the equipment and weapons you get are pretty awesome) and exp and mats which is annoying. But I AM still enjoying the game so, Thumbs up. Hot tip btw, Do all the things, side quests, conquests, whatever it is you'll get a shit ton of Exp and some mats and money. That was my mistake, not doing those thing, and it cost me a bit and I had to grind hard in the mid game.

Игра классная я уже играю 3 дня и половину сюжета не прошел наслаждаюсь миром и красотами рекмендую всем игра затягивает и оптимизирована)

The combat is basically the same as in origins only a bit harder (and you really need to get used to the parrying). You can still get overwhelmed so be careful (for example I boarded a ship of my level and they killed my crew instantly and then attacked me as a group).The mappable abilities are also very useful and the spartan kick is soooooo satisfying. I’d say the naval is a bit more fast paced than in black flag (but that could just be me) and I think that boarding is really fun. I like that there are still “shanties” cause otherwise my voyages would be eerily silent. The soundtrack overall is pretty great (as with all ac games). The photo mode has been tweaked a bit and is still very fun to use (especially because the game is beautiful). The only nitpicky thing I have a problem with is the slightly zoomed out camera angle but I could get used to that. The game is overall really fun and I would definetly recommend it to any RPG fan.

我在一个雅典人控制的小岛城市中心见到了一个斯巴达装束的猛男，然后这个猛男在一群雅典卫兵眼皮子底下大声的让我为斯巴达而战，帮他宰了这个小岛的雅典领导人，看在经验的面子上我毫不犹豫的答应了。半个小时候我终于宰了雅典领导人过来交任务，结果这个斯巴达猛男翻脸不认人的追了我两条街一定要砍死我，因为我当着他的面偷了一个雅典人的德拉马克。


我感觉我的智商受到了育碧的侮辱。


中规中矩的育碧流水游戏，你感觉不到哪里不好玩，但也说不出哪里吸引人。作为育碧粉还是第一时间入手了。顺便催一下隔壁《碧海黑帆》

苏格拉底：伯主席，你觉得买刺客信条奥德赛的季票好不好呀？ 

伯里克利：吼啊！ 

苏格拉底：雅典也支持吗？

伯里克利：当然啦！ 

苏格拉底：那为什么这么早就说要买季票，会不会给人感觉是你们内定、钦点刺客信条？

伯里克利：任何事，也要按照公民大会，按照选举来进行。刚才你问我，我可以回答一句「无可奉告」，但是你们也不高兴，我怎么办？我讲的意思不是我要钦定。你问我支持不支持，我说支持。我就明确的告诉你这一点。我感觉你们哲学界还需要学习，你们毕竟还是 too young ，你明白这意思吧？我告诉你们我是身经百战了，见得多了，希腊哪一个城邦我没有去过？你们要知道，斯巴达的卡珊德拉，比你们不知道要高到哪里去了，我跟他谈笑风生。所以说你们哲学界还是要提高自己的知识水平，识得唔识得啊？我为你们感到拙计呀……你们有一个好，全世界跑到什么地方，你们比秩序神教跑得还快，但是问来问去的问题呀，都 too simple ， sometimes naive ！懂了没有？

苏格拉底：可是能不能说一下为什么支持刺客信条奥德赛？

伯里克利：我很抱歉，我今天是作为一个国家领袖跟你们讲，我不是一个哲学工作者，但是我见得太多了。我有这个必要告诉你们一些人生的经验……希腊有一句话叫「闷声大发财」，我就什么话也不说，这是坠吼的。但是我想我见到你们这样热情，一句话不说也不好。在宣传上将来如果你们报道上有偏差，你们要负责任。我没有说要你们内定、钦点刺客信条，没有任何这个意思，但你们一定要问我对刺客信条奥德赛支持不支持，他现在是历代坠佳，我们怎么能不支持历代坠佳？

苏格拉底：但是如果说买季票呢？

伯里克利：买季票也得按照基本法，对不对？当然我们的决定权也是很重要的。到那时候我们会表态的。明白这意思吗？你们不要想喜欢弄个大新闻，说现在已经钦定了，把我批判一番，你们啊，naive！ I'm angry！你们这样子是不行的！我今天算是得罪了你们一下。

Judging whether or not you’ll want to play this game is most easily done by comparing it to its direct predecessor, Assassin’s Creed Origins, with which Odyssey shares a lot of its DNA.

I played nearly 100 hours of Origins but was surprised it received nearly universal praise. Origins is more polished than a typical AC game due to its extra year of development time, and the setting of Ancient Egypt is wonderful, but [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/greatjon_umber/recommended/582160/]I found there to be severe flaws in the foundation of what that game does regarding stealth, combat, and story.[/url] Typically with an Assassin’s Creed game I expect a great core experience that often lacks polish in terms of stability due to the grueling yearly release schedule from Ubisoft that doesn’t allow adequate QA time to fix such things. With Origins, it was the opposite—The core experience was lesser than Syndicate’s, but the game was very polished. It ran well and looked gorgeous.

The universal praise Origins received was only skin-deep, full of people raving about its wonderful setting and graphics while neglecting the deeper issues the game had at its core. Odyssey, then, reminds me a lot of what Syndicate was to Unity; an improvement of the core mechanics and the smoothing out of the previous game's rough edges.

[b]IF YOU'RE IN A RUSH:[/b] If you liked Origins and want more of something similar, then you’ll probably love Odyssey. It’s just Origins with deeper and more rewarding roleplaying, far better combat, a much better story, more practical skill trees, and some key new features to provide enough new territory that it doesn’t simply feel like Origins in a new setting.

For more detail, feel free to read on.

The most hyped aspect of the game is its expanded RPG elements. Since Unity, which introduced customizable gear, there have been growing light RPG elements to the Assassin’s Creed series, including the introduction of skill trees in Syndicate. Continuing this trend, Odyssey has become a full-blown action RPG rather than just an open world game with some RPG elements. It’s clear the team was playing a lot of Witcher 3 during development, as more effort is put into Odyssey’s main story and side quests, and the addition of dialogue options is a welcome breath of fresh air to the series. This was hampered, though, by some puzzlingly bad voice acting by the main character, Alexios’, voice actor (I didn’t play as Kassandra so I can’t comment on her performance). The story features deeper, more interesting characters than Origins and had me genuinely caring about what happened for the first time since Assassin’s Creed II. Bravo to Ubisoft for realizing that good writing is irreplaceable.

Combat in Origins was one of my chief complaints. The animations felt stilted and artificial, and the combat itself was difficult to judge due to the unrealistic speed at which animations played. The game felt like it was aping Dark Souls without understanding what makes its combat great. Combat in Odyssey, however, has several more layers of polish. Animations seem more natural, dodging takes place over a judgeable distance, easy countering is back. Adding depth are Adrenal Skills, which basically act the way the single Overpower skill did in Origins. There are a number of different Adrenaline skills to unlock within the skill tree, with each providing a different facet than the other.

The skill tree is greatly improved from Origins, which had few useful skills and a lot of what felt like unexciting padding that didn’t change gameplay greatly. Many of the abilities that were locked to gear in Origins have been instead relocated to the skill tree (different bow styles from Origins are now tied to skill unlocks), which gives you far greater freedom in customizing the way your character looks via gear. It’s a very good decision as the skill tree from Origins felt like something that was tacked-on because somebody on the team decided “we should have skill trees in this game”. The skill tree in Odyssey feels more natural and has a huge impact on gameplay.

A lot of the new abilities feel inspired by WB’s Shadow of Mordor series. Chiefly among this inspiration, though, is a fantastic port of what was obviously inspired by Shadow of Mordor’s Nemesis system. Odyssey takes place during the Peloponnesian War in 431 BC, and this war has a number of the different city states of Greece going at one-another; chiefly Athens and Sparta. Odyssey’s modified version of the Nemesis system depicts what feels like a living, breathing war going on around you. Athens and Sparta change territory through the story and your actions, with each city’s forces being easily identifiable, and each occupying different fortresses as they move. They have leaders, cities you can disrupt, money and materiel you can steal and destroy. There are various war leaders and mercenaries that function as the actual Nemeses from the Shadow games, and somehow the team has made this system feel more natural in an Assassin’s Creed game than the Lord of the Rings games which inspired it. It’s the main draw of Odyssey, and it’s a huge one. It all works smoothly, indicative of significant polish, and the game is worth playing just to experience it even if you were burnt out on Origins.

There are a number of more minor new features which fixed complaints I had about Origins. Number one of which is a dedicated (though limited to the open world) Quicksave feature for the first time in the Assassin’s Creed series. As a hardcore stealth fan I despise any game that features stealth without quicksaving and makes me rely on checkpoints. It’s too easy to experience a bug (especially in AC games) and have your entire stealth run of a fort become ruined. This alleviates it, and it’s a fantastic quality-of-life addition. There are also now non-lethal takedowns and enemy recruiting, deepening stealth gameplay.

History blurbs are also back! This eliminates one of my chief personal complaints about Origins: Ripping out these history blurbs and putting them in a separate gameplay mode from the main game. As a fan of historical fiction I want to learn about these settings as I play, and Origins taking that away really damaged the experience for me. They are now back as a map feature, allowing you to hover over map markers for a brief paragraph of background.

I do have some complaints, though. The balance of the game is off, requiring a bit too much grinding if you’re not clearing every map marker like I am. The leveling system is also far too rigid, turning enemies one level higher than you into health sponges. This should be addressed in a future balance patch. It didn’t affect me much because I’m always overleveled, but I could see how someone focused only on the main story would become frustrated.

The game also removed shields from combat, which is puzzling in a game about Greek combat—A style of combat based almost wholly on the use of a heavy bronze shield. I loved the shields in Origins and am puzzled and disappointed to see them go.

The game also runs questionably—my 1080 couldn’t hold 60 fps on ultra settings at 1080p. It needs a performance patch.

In the end, much of Odyssey looks the same as Origins: The menus are nearly identical. You have a pet bird to scout with. The running and climbing animations are the same. The buildings look similar. The graphics are of the same quality. But these similarities--like the critical praise for Origins--are only surface-deep.

Odyssey fixes Origins’ faults and adds wonderful new features. If you liked Origins or you’re a fan of the series then you’ll love Odyssey. It's the culmination of what the past 3-4 Assassin’s Creed games have been introducing, and it’s become one of my favorites in the series.

You can find more reviews like this by following [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32979487/]my Curator page![/url]

提前了3天试玩，剧情打了三分之二，总的来说这次奥德赛的剧情比起源的剧情要好很多，很有代入感，游戏的任务也十分的繁多，支线一大堆主线也是一大堆，要真想完全打通剧情的确是要花40小时，反正我是通宵了2个晚上都没打完剧情。

但是对于奥德赛我不得不吐槽第一点就是奥德赛可以看作是起源的一大DLC，玩法和起源几乎无区别，除了加入的海战系统可以看作是起源的一个完善，可以选择男女主角，奥德赛就是一个以起源为基础的升级和衍生，昨天通宵玩了10多给小时给我的体验是风景看着比起源舒服一点，海战确实给人的感觉很刺激

第二，我发现育婊是缺钱用了还是脑子抽了，把以前的黄金版拆分成现在的黄金版和豪华版，现在的终极版就等同于以前的黄金版，价格却提高了100多，难不成现在人民币贬值如此之厉害？？？育婊真当粉丝的钱是大风刮来的啊，这么玩岂不是自掘坟墓。

第三，这游戏优化是真的差，1080显卡也不能满足1080P下全特效稳定60，有时候才四十多帧，像这样优化差，画质和起源差不多，玩法也类似，到底凭什么要比以前多卖那100多软妹币

总的来说奥德赛风景漂亮，游戏里包含的历史也十分丰富，你不仅能见到伯里克利，参与陶片放逐法，还能见到苏格拉底，如果你是一名古希腊历史爱好者，这款游戏非常适合你，如果你是一个画面党休闲党，奥德赛也能满足你，没事放下屠刀，看看风景，拍拍照啥的，如果你是战斗党，此作奥德赛狂战士的战斗风格也十分的符合你。
I5-8400也玩不了，就一张启动图和一个无响应的空白窗口。起源也有同样的问题，被我退款了，没想到奥德赛也是。

Excellent jeu, on prend un véritable plaisir dans la Grèce antique.

Certes, j'aurais aimé plus d'optimisation car j'ai quelques chutes de framerate dans les villes. Pourtant, comparé à Origins, on est bien au-dessus dans ce domaine. Je n'ai pratiquement pas eu de bugs et aucun crash. 

Si les mécaniques RPG d'Origins sont ici reprises, elles sont appronfondies et plus nombreuses. Odyssey reprend peu ou prou les bonnes idées d'autres jeux tels que Witcher 3 (bien que le scénario ne soit pas aussi qualitatif), un peu aussi de l'Ombre de la Guerre pour les mercenaires (même si pas aussi poussé).
S'il ne révolutionne rien, il perfectionne et réunit pleins de bonnes idées déjà vues ailleurs. 

Au niveau du scenario, je le trouve pour l'instant meilleur que celui d'Origins. Les personnages sont plus attachants et la finalité de l'histoire moins prévisible. 

Les graphismes sont beaux mais pas beaucoup mieux que ceux d'Origins. Personnellement, je préfère cet univers de la Grèce antique mais c'est davantage car la période m'intéresse. On pourrait reprocher le manque de couleurs dans certains endroits (après ca se justifie dans le contexte).  Ce qui m'a gêné un peu plus c'est la répétition de certaines frises, fresques dans les temples, cela peut paraître bête mais ça casse un rien l'immerssion. 

Donc pour résumer, je prends vraiment du plaisir sur ce jeu  qui ne se limite pas à un calque d'Origins et va plus loin dans le gameplay et le scenario. Le contexte de la guerre de Péloponnèse rajoute un enrobage qui finit de rendre le jeu jouissif !

先留下第一印象，日后增补。
这一作的画面非常好，优化可圈可点（首版会突然掉帧，应该是bug），人物景物建模刻画精致，细节丰富。而对性能的要求并不比起源高太多。从画面上可以明确好评。战斗……战斗力太强了，普通难度的战斗难度等于起源的简单，可能和斯巴达设定有关。操作逻辑清晰，除了键位和起源相差较大，觉得是糅合了黑旗和起源，但是加入了新的分段技能系统，需要学习。配音饱满情感丰富，好评，但是口音奇葩，没字幕听不懂。
这部作品是一部完全RPG化的作品，而官方也在难度选择时强调了本作是RPG的情况。作为一部RPG，奥德赛很让我满意，刺杀系统还待日后体验。[b] 奥德赛并不是起源的大型dlc。虽然画面完全是一个模子做的，内核是完全不一样的。 [/b]

这个差评我是真的纠结了很久的，如果steam像淘宝一样有中评我更倾向于给出中评
  首先说一下干货吧，这个游戏不推荐刺客信条老玩家入手，因为这已经不是刺客信条了，我觉得名字应该是这样的：《起源：奥德赛》，说白了就是一个RPG刷刷刷的游戏，很适合那种闲来无事的欧美佬。
  然后我要说一个事，这个游戏在前段时间看某B站UP主受邀试玩育碧几款新游戏，就包括这个奥德赛，当时我记得非常清楚，他说了一句话，这个绝对不是起源的大型资料片，说的那个叫一个认真啊、绝对啊，我当时就比较怀疑这个观点，结果一进游戏打了这半天，我就想说帮阿育说话可不可以有点底线？自己坐拥几十万粉丝就这么信口开河？还绝对不是起源的大型资料片，有点东西的啊兄弟。
  我跟大家讲一句实话，这TM就是起源：奥德赛，照搬到什么程度？连特么骑马的姿势都是一个吊样，都不说什么老鹰啊UI什么的了，阿育你糊弄谁呢？就是把起源的地图整到希腊，把剧情换了，人物换了，打斗姿势多加几个，好了完事，上架steam，舒服啦。阿育你是被维旺迪收购啥了吧？当年维旺迪要收购你的时候，我一口气买了你七八个游戏，整了这么半天就是不希望你把自家游戏的招牌砸了，安安心心做几个良心游戏，尤其是这个有大票粉丝群体的IP刺客信条。我看那个时候好心真的当驴肝肺，试问你现在和被维旺迪收购有什么区别？
  我也算是刺客信条七八年老玩家了，从初一二代入坑到现在大二奥德赛，每一部我都玩过，每一部都买了。我可以说是亲眼看着这个系列从顶峰到衰败，我真心希望你们阿育，别再无脑圈钱了好不好？认认真真踏踏实实的做一个刺客信条，朴素的、接地气的刺客信条哪去了？我们玩家要求真的不多，阿育，真的……
买就行了，看这么多有啥用。嗯，真香。

Edit:

   I gave this a bad review on its launch day as I was unable to play it. I preordered it just to find out that my computer cant run it. The developers did not mention AVX (Advanced Vector Extension) requirement for this game. AVX was not supported by old CPUs.

Thanks to complaints from me and many others with the same issue the developers removed AVX. 

Now to give my honest opinion.

I dont have a high end PC. I have only the minimum requirements. But still the game looks beautiful.

Pros.
*Huge open world
*Endless Side Quests
*Beautiful Graphics
*Romance option ( my favourite feature)
*Choices matter ( not that much but enough to create new experience each time).
*GREEK MYTHOLOGY

Cons. 
*Leveling up is tiresome. 
*FPS drops are very common,
*Combat system is still not perfected.


I have only just begun so based on what I have seen so far, I love it

Rating : 9/10

I have played Assassin's Creed before, but this game is far the best. Anyone who says its a rip off from Origins, yeah the mechanics and mostly everything has been remade and rethought in this game. For example no 5 kinds of leather, no clothier and blacksmith, just the latter one etc.
The atmosphere of the game is 10/10, this is the most historically accurate AC (for a game) I played before, and as a former Classical Philology student I have to say I love the accents, I love the greek, love everything about the game. Sailing the sea is hella fun too.
Anyone who loved Origins will love this game as well, this is a step up from the previous installment.

On the negative side, the animations could be better, but it isnt tragic, nothing Ubisoft cannot fix in a future patch.
The performance of the game is pretty awesome, considering Origins wasnt running so smooth for me (i7 3rd gen, 12gb ram, gtx 1070 g1) and I had to put some settings to medium to have stable 60fps and no stuttering, this game runs better; only turned the fog to medium and ambient occulsion to one back from the highest setting, and i have stable 60fps sometimes that can drop, still nothing Ubi cannot fix in an upcoming patch.
The game is maaaaaybe a little more grindy, you need to explore a lot to gather xp for lvling up, I would fix this a little.
Last negative point from me, why are the shields gone? :( spartans were famous for their shield work on the battlefield, it would have been cool to have the phalanx formation at some point in conquest battles,

TL;DR
- Performance is good, patches to improve it can make it even better
- Beautiful Ancient Greek world, atmosphere 10/10
- Game is immense in size, lot of content.
- A tiny bit grindy -> you need to explore to gather xp instead of hopping from quest to quest
- Great story

心情复杂，既想推荐又不想推荐，就说说推荐和不推荐的理由吧。
推荐：
1.主线任务和一些支线任务有点巫师3的影子了，没以前的重复度那么高了，可选择对话，但是许多选择你怎么选其实结果都一样233
2.战斗系统相比起源，高了不知道多少档次，技能和附属性攻击打起来非常舒服，战斗系统还行，就是索敌有点蛋疼，手柄操作换技能栏也蛋疼，美中不足吧
3.希腊旅游模拟器嘛，后期多多优化下，真的是步行模拟器了
4.黑旗的海战回归了，可以梦回当年大洋上驰骋天下的感觉了
5.个人觉得剧情虽然逻辑上混乱不堪，许多小细节让人啼笑皆非，但总体来讲还是挺有吸引力的，得益于对话可选择还是能吸引人推下去

不推荐：
1.育碧式支线任务仍然大量存在，布告板上的各种限时任务和雇佣任务重复度贼高，很育碧，做几个就会完全丧失兴趣
2.许多地点设计重复度也很高，强盗啦，女猎人啦，兵营啦，洞穴啊，丧心病狂，玩到想吐
3.征服战太鸡肋了

还想说一句，奥德赛用了大量的谜题收集，猎杀秩序神教成员，佣兵系统，触发征服战，奥尔哈钢任务驱使你去玩那些很重复 的内容，以传奇装备等来奖励你，这一点相比以前只有收集的少量装备的前作好很多，然而，拨开这些外衣，哎，重复度还是挺高的，不过这作确实能看到AC的进步，所以还是推荐吧。

As you can tell from my nickname, I'm a fan of the Legion from Fallout: New Vegas and also everything related to ancient Rome/Greece. Which is why I enjoyed games such as Ryse: Son of Rome etc.

As for this game, to give some background, I stopped at Assassin's Creed 2. Got Revelations and Brotherhood but couldn't play more than 3-5hours before I got bored. The unchallenging combat being around literally 2 keys was a snoozefest.

Odyssey gives a really great setting, and if you look carefully there aren't many good games about ancient Greece. It's pretty rare. So this game is a really great addition.

Soundtrack is great and immersive, 10/10 on that. 

Gameplay-wise they literally copy/pasted The Witcher 3 gameplay, in terms of dialogue trees the way the scene goes when you select a reply and how it goes back to the selection of dialogue. Even the core of the combat, which is centered around dodging and timed parries.

Is it a bad thing ? NO. Simply because that formula works and CDRed knows it, Ubisoft did great going that route. Despite some fanboys crying about the old stale combat, it was simply needed because the old combat was cheesy and easy. By making combat more engaging, it makes the game more interesting in the long run. Hence why I couldn't play more Brotherhood or Revelation. Same old formula, same mistakes. Adding RPG elements may not be liked by some, but it's popular and it works.

Story-wise, I can't tell much since I started yesterday, but cutscenes are pretty good, and the pacing of the story makes sense so far. With some flashbacks to give the background of your character bits by bits (I'm also glad I took the male character, because seeing a Spartan training his boy is more believable, also beards win).

There are a few bugs and weird stuff but not so many to kill the gameplay and immersion. Most funny are citizens getting burned alive by simply standing nearby braziers or fire sources. OP AoE. Oh and a random dog I saw lying dead in the streets of the village for unknown reasons.

This is an early review, but I'd give this game a solid 8.5 out of 10. Might even go beyond if the story DLCs are good.

If you liked Witcher 3, you'll like this game.

Catastrophique. Ce jeu est une honte à la série assassins creed !

Visuellement largement en dessous d'AC origin. Clairement le jeu est laid ! Et je joue en ultra avec une RTX2080.

La gameplay a changé et ils ont clairement essaye de refaire un Witcher3.

Je ne sais pas pourquoi un tel downgrad graphique, le desert d'égypte était tellement bien foutu que je réalise qu'UBI ne sais pas modéliser de la végétation correctement. Dans ce jeu, il n'y a que des rocher et de la végétation (contrairement à l'égypte) et clairement UBI ne sais pas faire de la végétation dynamique avec des branchent qui se tordent naturellement lors de notre passage, la végétation de ce jeu est moche comme jamais je n'avais vus ca dans un jeu. Et la modélisation des rochers n'en parlons meme pas !

Le doublage FR est complètement raté !!

Le seul truc à peu pret beau du jeu ce sont les cinématiques lors des dialogues.

Sinon tout est à jeter, et si je peux donner un conseil, n'achetez pas ce jeu! Ca leur apprendra et ils arreteront de nous prendre pour des pigeons, car 60€ pour une telle horreur digne de ce qu'on avait en 2007 c'est non merci !!

AC Odyssey controls and feels much the same as AC Origins, which is not a bad thing. The combat feels a bit more involved than the traditional counter-move based of older titles. 

So far I haven't really found much to link it to the AC universe other than a short outside of the Animus section, which again, is not a bad thing since it hasn't taken away from the game in any way and lets you start exploring the world almost straight away. 

Looks beautiful and has run smoothly for me, like handling, graphics are similar in quality to AC Origins, although a little more varied colour palette given the location for the setting. 

I very much like the ancient Greece setting and how the game presents itself so far, overall positive experience thusfar!

Говоря о Assassin's Creed Одисия.
+Система управления осталась прежней только с небольшими изменениями.
+Выбор персонажей.
+Новые способности и умения.
+Теперь наш персонаж сам участвует в разговоре и нам дается выбор как поступить, так можно выбирать как положительное так и отрицательные действия.
+Интересная кампания и побочные миссии.
+Новый режим игры "Исследование".
+Отличная графика и детализация.
+Красивые пейзажи.
+Наемники теперь настоящие охотники. ( идут по пятам).
+Хорошие морские сражения напоминает Assassin's Creed Черный Флаг.

- +Бои за области однообразны и толку от них как такового нет, но можно неплохо прокачаться и получить хорошую экипировку и ресурсы.

-Сохранения порой не загружаются.
-На улучшение экипировки нужно просто огромное количество ресурсов, корабль и то проще улучшить.
-Блок сделан по дурацки, чтобы блокировать надо нажимать две кнопки, не всегда успеваешь сделать,на сложном уровне это особо проблемно .( в Assassin's Creed Истоки было лучше ).
-Мало точек быстрого перемещения. ( только точки обзора ).
-Почти все навыки активные и требуют адреналина для использования.

Подводя итог хочу сказать что в целом игра хорошая но вней много различных багов и недоработок и потребуется не одно обновление чтобы устранить их.

I used to hate Assassin's Creed. Ever since #3, it just seemed like Ubi was pulling a new one out of their @ss every year. Black Flag was okay, but it wasn't anything to write home about. Unity and Syndicate had cool settings, but couldn't keep my attention past the intro sequences. Once the abortion that was the movie came out in 2016, I gave up hope. 

But then Origin rolled around, and I had a great time. If you like Origin, you'll love Odyssey. It's similar, without being a copy-and-paste. It improves on a lot of things, and it was worth a day-one buy.

Pros:
-The dialogue is much more interesting now. You feel a bit more in control. Even if the voice acting and script is the same nonsense that AC has always had, I felt like I was actually involved in the story, and could change it with my decisions. And there was a surprising amount of nuance. They keep it simple, but you get the option to lie, persuade, intimidate, and ask for more information. Sometimes it had some pretty cool consequences, as well. There was one awkward but still enjoyable scene where Alexios can either woo a woman into bed with him, add her to his crew, or say goodbye to her forever. In summary, I actually care about dialogue now, and it does seem to actually change the story, even if the change is not drastic. 
-The story is a lot more compelling that previous titles. It's not amazing, and it comes with its fair share of problems. But it's a step in the right direction. 
-Sea Battles are AMAZING. They are a tad bit buggy, and the rowers have an embarrassingly limited endurance. You can have them row for 4 seconds at first, before they peter out. I believe this can be upgraded. Anyway, I thorougly enjoyed the sea battles. Ramming was very satisfying, as well as boarding. It could be annoying because sometimes only a handful of your men come onboard the enemy ship, and when they die you're on your own. Some people have said it gets boring, but so far I love it.
-Like I said, Odyssey is quite similar to Origins, mostly so in the graphics. Similar building designs, similar rock formations, similar fort and bandit hideout arrangements. However, there was a noticeable graphical update, especially in regards to the character models and the lighting. I took screenshots of some of the characters during cutscenes because they looked DAMN good. Where Origins did a wonderful job showing how beautiful the desert can be, Odyssey shows how beautiful blue ocean, beaches, and bright green forests can be. There are some absolutely breathtaking moments throughout the game. This is definitely the most beautiful Assassin's Creed game so far, and probably one of the most beautiful open world games I have seen to date (as far as nature and the ancient world/fantasy goes).
-Something Origin lacked was big battles. Now, with the focus of Odyssey being weakening the Greek state controlling an area, there's the opportunity for a huge battle once you finish all the main quests for that area. 
-Combat has improved. It feels a bit more streamlined and less frustrating. The main character is more responsive. The skill tree has been altered slightly, so now you have abilties that can be activated for a short time, such as poison, shieldbreaking, and so on. They even added a few cool little bits, such as your character giving a final stab to a victim when confirming a kill.
-On top of that, you know have non-lethal stealth options. You can choke someone out, rather than kill them. This gives you the option of recruiting them to your ship's crew.
-The game ran pretty damn well from day one. The settings didn't automatically adjust for my hardware, but with a few changes I had this thing running on Ultra-high at 1080p on my 1080, with a consistent 50-60 fps. 
-A small thing I noticed is that the AI will actually duck away from arrows and hide over cover. This is a nice little detail, and even if it's the only improvement, I like it.
-It really feels like a war-torn world. You can  feel the negative effects of the war. Certain areas belong to certain factions, and there are frequent quests involving food shortages, refugee crisis, bandit robbery, etc. With the dialogue options, you can now choose if you will do what you can to spare the innocent, or you can choose to take advantage everywhere you go. 

Cons: 
-Even though the dialogue interaction has changed, the dialogue is still mostly garbage. Sad, considering many of these new character models look wonderful.
-Same bugs as before with the horse, running into everything and being an absolute retard when I call for him. Now there's a new bug (perhaps it's not, someone feel free to clarify) where the horse slows down to a canter anytime he's within 25 meters of a town or stronghold. This is annoying as hell. I want to get to my destination faster, or I want to run away from a bounty hunter, and I can't.
-The AI are the same for the most part, but now they have super-vision. This may be a bug that will be fixed after the first patch, I hope. Several times it seems like they saw me through walls, and there were quite a few bugs where I couldn't do a leap assassination or a stealth attack. 
-On top of idiot AI, they cannot tell when you are with them or against them. Once, a group of Athenians attacked a Spartan camp. I came in to help, took a few swings at Athenians, and in the process accidentally hit a Spartan. WHen they finished with the Athenians, they all came after me. I had to flee the camp and hide in the bushes until they calmed down. When I came back, they didn't recognize me. 
-The exploration mode is cool, but to truly appreciate it you have to remove the HUD as well. It looks nice, and it was satisfying to find a place just from the description that someone gave you. The problem is, it sometimes means that finding the place is near impossible. Not because you're doing it without hints, but because the directions are unclear. 


I'm having a ball with this game, and this is coming from someone that hated AC almost religiously for years. Ubisoft has really earned back some of my trust, even if at the end of the day they're a cash cow. At least now we can say they are an honest cash cow. 

My only concern is that with the success of Origin and Odyssey, they'll just start reskinning the experience, and then we'll see nothing but a repeat of what AC has been ever since #2. But if they can incrementally improve these games, then I will gladly purchase the next title.

Highly recommended! If you do everything, then you really will hit 100+ hours on this thing.

I've played it enough to know it's definitely a good game. I wouldn't call it better or worse than Origins because at its core it's essentially the same game, just with some added things you've already seen in past games, like a 1:1 copy of the ship combat from AC4 and reducing threat levels in regions so you can take on the big boss (which is still just a big guy with a big weapon like before). It still has that horrible slow motion on detect thing from Origins that doesn't enhance the game at all and is just a terrible game mechanic all around. And unfortunately you still can't turn it off.

Two things I'll say about the game is the combat is more active and engaging, if still plenty button mashy and the underwater areas are leagues ahead of what you got in Origins. There're plenty more little enhancements but I didn't find any of them to be particularly noteworthy. I guess having a large portion of the loot items be marked as having to steal them is kind of cool. 

I find the combat to be somewhat easy despite reports to the contrary. It's just not that hard to parry and dodge your way through a horde of enemies. The hardest part is remembering which skills you have assigned to which buttons. I thought Origins was hard until you overleveled. I'm glad they took overleveling out of this game.

They seem to have taken it out that you can call your horse in a hostile zone to make a quick getaway, which I think is a bad change.

Also if you use minimal or disabled HUD then photo mode is broken. As in you can take pictures but it doesn't show you any of the photo options. Turning on any of the deactivated HUD options doesn't fix it. Even if you choose minimal HUD then turn everything back on it doesn't fix it. You actually have to have show all or light selected. If you want minimal or disabled HUD to work with photo mode then you have to choose show all or light then turn off all the HUD option you don't want. Isn't that weird?

All in all I'm happy with my purchase.

从我个人的角度而言，我并不是特别的推荐这一作的刺客信条。奥德赛说好听的话叫做和起源一脉相承，说不好听点的话就是换皮游戏。太多太多和起源相似的地方，虽然我能看到一些小的修改和增添，但是我无法否认的是他和起源实在是太像了。如果说你为了去体验他的剧情，他的文化，那么奥德赛是可以购入的，如果你只是为了喜加一（或者是三分热度）并且库里拥有起源的话，那么我建议还是省下这一笔钱吧，拿去吃一顿饭也是好的。而且奥德赛让人十分的眼熟，比如育碧自家的荣耀战魂，奥德赛可以说是沿用了荣耀战魂的战斗系统和处决系统。
有人会说到刺客信条已经不再是刺客信条了，对没错，刺客信条已经不再是原来那个刺客信条了。刺客也可以作为一个战士一路莽到头了。有人说这是一个失败的变革，也有人认为这是一个不错的革新。仁者见仁智者见智吧。其实我们试想一下，如果接下来的两作三作还是原来那个样子的话，玩家会不会变得视觉疲劳，会不会认为这个游戏已经失去了生机，从而不再购入。游戏公司出品游戏，玩家不再购入，这会是什么样的结果不言自明。所以我认为刺客信条是需要变革的，当然现在这个变革是否是合理的，每个人的看法都是不一样的。我很希望一个大IP去寻求变革，因为千篇一律的东西注定会变成历史的尘埃，只有保有活力不断变革的IP才能在历史上面留下浓墨重彩的一笔，不会化为历史车轮碾后的青烟。
刺客信条 偏离了最初的样子，他开始拥有了人物等级，拥有了装备等级与品质，他从最初的样子变成了现在这个RPG的样式，装备的品质和等级会很大程度的影响游戏性，爆肝也被添加到了游戏之中，物品收集与装备制作，佣兵系统与任务栏的增加，让我们知道这已经不是最开始的刺客信条了，这是一个新的游戏，他保留了刺客信条一部分的东西，也增添了很多不属于那个名字的东西。这是一次变革，一次极具冒险精神的变革。我们无法得知这场变革过后这个IP会变成什么样子。但愿会是一个好的结局。
对于目前的刺客信条，我认为他更多的是独立在刺客信条系列中，类似于古墓丽影三部曲那样。或许下一作就是刺客信条罗马了，这谁说的好呢，慢慢等待吧，毕竟古中国也是一个不错的题材。
育碧和玩家走的很近，他能听见我们的声音，这对于一个游戏公司是十分不容易的。而且最近我们也看到了7毛购入全系列刺客信条这样喜闻乐见的bug，我不希望这样的一个公司倒闭或者说是被人收购，就像我不希望国产独立游戏失去最后一丝的希望一样。虽然威望迪已经离去，可是又有谁知道这样一团阴霾什么时候会卷土重来呢。所以无论如何，我会一如既往的去支持育碧，支持所有我喜爱的游戏，即使他们可能存在各种各样的问题，我也依然会尽我一份绵薄之力，让游戏公司得以延续，让游戏得以延续，让我们在这漫漫长夜之中看见那一丝不灭的曙光。而不是陷入永恒的黑暗。
Was worried I was gonna buy a "Origins" reskin, thankfully that's not the case, first game in a while where I played 12 hours straight without stopping..

Best game I've played this year. The open world is very well crafted. It is massive with an impressive attention to detail with respect to geographical and urban locations (play in exploration mode to maximise immersion). Main and side quests are for the most part, very well crafted and engaging and most of the named characters are very well done. Side activities inclusive of timed quests and notice board missions can get very repetitive and monotonous, but these are entirely optional and you can do them whenever you feel like making a quick buck or to get some resources. Conquest gameplay isn't as fleshed out as Ubi made it out to be, but it still is a fairly fun feature that you could tackle for good loot if nothing else. The game is very resource grindy, but I wouldn't worry too much about that early on, playing the game casually and completing as many side quests and locations as you can will progressively get you pretty much everything you need by the time you reach a later stage in the game, though I understand that most people may not have the leisure to do this due to real life obligations and time constraints.

So far, ACOD has been a very smooth experience on PC but it is a very graphically demanding game so don't expect smooth frames if you don't have the hardware for it, but so far, it runs more or less as well as ACO does for me. Gameplay and animations may look clunky from a viewer's perspective, but they play very well in person. 

If you're worried about microtransactions, they are there and I hate the fact that they are, (this shit is despicable, I mean I've already paid the full price for the game) but they are by no means invasive. The inclusion of microtransactions has not impacted my gaming experience in any way. But the oikos of the olympians and the whole thing with orichalcum is a bit of a scam though. To reiterate, these are entirely optional and they aren't fundamental to the gameplay experience. I am judging the game with respect to the core values, features and mechanics of the game, I don't think it does justice to the game if I were to place undue emphasis on some stupid sideshow money-making gimmick implemented at the behest of the game's publishers over the effort and creativity put into making the game by the dev team. Ignore them entirely if you hate them.

My biggest gripe with this game would be how spongey named enemies (normal mooks are still easy to kill) are, but there are various workarounds to combat this issue. Proper character specing and strategic use of abilities can fetch you clean and quick kills on bosses/mini-bosses. Turning down the difficulty also helps if that suits you.

In conclusion, the game has its flaws, but it is an incredibly enjoyable and engaging experience. I never found myself bored playing it due to the sheer amount of things to do. It gets a 9/10 from me, by no means the greatest game of all time and by no means revolutionary (it builds on concepts already introduced by existing IPs ie. The Witcher 3 and Shadow of War, nothing wrong with that), but a solid game nonetheless.I reckon the game is worth the full price, it is chock full of content that will keep you playing for many many hours. Reminder that this review is not definitive, it is subjective to my experience of the game. Other people may experience the game differently to me. Have a good one.

这部刺客绝对是系列游戏性最佳的一部
    猎人，刺客，战士路线
三个不同的分支，可以混搭可以专精，比上一代起源更加自由灵活
（我就是猎人刺客双精，躲在房梁上biubiubiu不要太爽！
    新的探索模式，虽说有些敷衍的味道，但还是可以看出育碧在想办法改变玩家的游戏体验，
以前的刺客就是——接了任务-在地图上标出地点-玩家过去-任务完成。
本来就很重复的开放世界在这样的机制下让玩家很容易产生为了做任务而做任务的感觉
    而这代的探索模式不会直接把目的地标在地图上，
而是给玩家一些提示，让玩家自己找，
    这种方式其实见仁见智，
我就在这种模式下收获了不错的游戏体验，
这种模式你会更有倾向去做一些路上遇到的支线
节奏也会更慢。
    当然你如果想要快速体验主线，也可以选择引导模式。
（不过主线推得太快会有等级压制问题，这代越级打怪会很难）
    这代刺客也是最让我沉浸其中的一部，
因为需要我来选择主角的对话
所以主线支线的剧情我都看的很仔细，
有些时候我的决定就是关乎剧情以及一些人的生死。
这真的带来了很棒的代入感
    其实当你投入进去一个世界时，
那些“接任务——找线索——打怪——领赏金”模式的支线任务你一个都不舍的放过，
而且这代的一些“金色感叹号”的支线是会影响主线故事的
    这一环扣一环使得这代的刺客信条真的有着系列最强的沉浸感。
    其实我个人觉得育碧要加油的是如何讲好故事，精心雕磨每个故事，
    奥德赛确实有缺点，重复、公式化
    它不是神作，但是确实有其独特的魅力。
    阿育在努力地改变，从这代奥德赛真的可以看出来
    希望越做越好，阿育牛逼！
（在最后给进游戏闪退的兄弟们支个招
    如果你是N卡显卡，更新你的Geforce EXPERIENCE，没有的去下一个
    再在驱动程序里面下载最新版本的Game Ready Driver，快速安装
    我的问题就是这么解决的。可以试一试

差评。起源开始的刺客信条已经失去了刺客信条的原味。这个游戏已经变成纯ACT，如果你想玩暗杀，去买《杀手》吧 。
我相信有很多玩家，他们跟我一样不喜欢光明正大地正面肛，就喜欢阴险龌龊地偷鸡摸狗搞暗杀。从《辛迪加》开始，《刺客信条》引入了“敌人等级”概念，但《辛迪加》的敌人等级，仅限于提高正面刚的难度，而再高级的敌人，依然可以背后秒杀，这才是最吸引人的地方---一种紧张到害怕被发现的感觉以至于寻找不同的角度和计谋暗杀敌人、夺取据点的乐趣。
自从《起源》开始，敌人等级就是一切，等级过高无法暗杀，这就是逼着玩家去肝，去刷素材，游戏“带领”玩家去按照落后的规则去玩，变成了游戏“玩”玩家。
我并不希望《刺客信条》系列走下坡路，或者变成一个无限趋向于《真三国无双》的游戏，刺客信条精髓玩的是“刺杀”，和《杀手》一样，在不同时代用有限的资源让玩家自由地暗杀/正面刚，而不是强迫玩家升级战斗！！！

I only have 6 hours in the game (so far), but to tell you something, those were 6 hours straight.

I gave up on the AC series after AC4 as they all started feeling the same. The setting was different but the future story and hilariously easy combat just felt so similar that I quit. I heard Origins made major changes and so I looked at Odyssey.

If you're coming from the old AC games, Odyssey is a pleasent breath of fresh air. The sideqests and world remind me of Witcher 3. The combat makes you respect your enemies, but still makes you powerful. Every activity is worth your time reward wise and every quest feels different. I know I don't have enough time to say this properly, but AC Odyssey is amazing. It feels like an RPG with good mechanics, story, setting, and more.

I also saw some hinted mythological stuff. I'm really excited for that, but I have no idea how they go about it as I never played Origins. 

If you're wondering if this is worth a buy, I'd say definitely. There's only so many good large RPGs out there and I'd say this is one of them.

Kurzer Eindruck zu Assassin's Creed Odyssey:

Grafisch wieder mal ein richtiger Augenschmaus geworden. Wer das rumwuseln und erkunden von Ortschaften liebt, der wird mit Odyssey ganz sicher nicht enttäuscht werden. Verglichen zu Origins hat Odyssey nun dynamisches Wetter und eine Handvoll mehr Tiere.
Während es in Origins ganztägig nur Sonnenschein und in der Wüste hin und wieder Sandstürme waren, so gibts in Odyssey Gewitter, Blitze und Regen. Auch die NPCs und Questgeber wirken viel detailreicher verglichen zu Origins.

Positive Aspekte in dem Game sind für mich auch die Ortschaften und Städte die man während des Spielverlaufes besucht. Es gibt jede Menge Nebenquests die erfüllt werden können, seien es zeitlich begrenzte Quests die auf dem "schwarzen Brett" gefunden werden können, oder Quests die von Passanten vergeben werden.
Angefangen von Bären, Wildschweinen, Hirschen, Haien, Delphine, Wale etc sind die Tierarten im Spiel sehr vielfältig geworden. Schwimmt ihr im Meer und hört genau hin, so kann man die Laute der Wale und Delphine hören. Einfach hammer wenn Schätze unter Wasser gesucht werden und ein Delphin oder Wal an einem vorbei schwimmt.

Was ein wenig komisch und teilweise schon ärgerlich ist, ist wenn ein Gegner ein Level über einem ist, diesen kann man fast oder teils gar nicht besiegen, man ist quasi unterlegen. Das bremst schon ein wenig den Spielspaß. Selbiges auch mit Gegner die 1 oder 2 Lvl drunter sind. Hat der Gegner Feuer oder Gift so nutzen einem 2lvl mehr auch nichts. Generell ist das Kampfsystem mit den Waffen und Rüstungen leicht angehaucht wie in Diablo.... Giftwiederstand, Feuerschaden, Attentatsschaden etc.. Meins ist es ehrlich gesagt nicht, passt zu AC nicht sonderlich. Und wo wir schon bei den Waffen sind, es ist verwunderlich, dass es im Vorgänger noch Schilde gab... die fehlen zur gänze in Odyssey genauso wie die versteckte Klinge...

Performance:

Die Performance ist auf mid Range Systemen echt unterirdisch... selbst eine starke CPU mit einer 1080Ti in meinem System schaffen einfach nicht permanent die 60 Bilder in der Sekunde zu halten.. CPU wird zu stark ausgelastet und der peakt gerne mal kurz auf über 80%. Schade, denn Origins welches grafisch mit Odyssey gleich auf ist, hatte keinerlei Probleme und konstante 70 bis 85fps maxed out in 1440p. Daran muss Ubi noch arbeiten.

Ansonsten gefällt mir das Spiel bis jetzt gut und macht viel Spaß

温馨提示玩这个游戏并不是让你习惯去当一个刺客。而是一个雇佣兵。（你以为开无双只是另一种战斗方式？太天真了，刺杀无双你都得去做。）
游戏有难度，硬核不在操作而在耐心。（在你和警察民工四连5个来回后才砍完一半血）
经常会用到的操作是刺杀→逃→刺杀→逃→刺杀→逃（并不是杀三个人只是杀个队长）
右下角的通缉会让你慢慢习惯作恶的日子。（交钱不存在的，即使你杀掉悬赏人依旧在飞涨）
阿碧特色据点不用刻意全收集。（因为支线大部分都带你逛了一遍，不打等级不够）
斯巴达踢很不错，点了不亏（我爱悬崖）
无脑开无双的后果是能让你打一个据点从早晨打到黑夜再打到天亮。（面对一个据点两个队长一个领主三个雇佣兵一群被烽火招来的动员兵吧）
无脑刺杀的后果同上，在你发现你一下居然刺不死的时候。（我眼睁睁看到我用矛头在他的身体上打了个对穿，他依然活了下来并叫了很多哥们）
任务做的我心烦意乱。又繁琐又墨迹，小兵层出不穷还打不动，偏偏战斗操作也并不好玩精彩。
攻略据点被发现的时候就像凯瑞甘被蒙斯克抛弃在塔桑尼斯最后没有子弹带上战术眼镜后（V）一样的感觉。我佛了。
差评。
希望更新的时候会给我们预售玩家一点福利。闪退卡死了

只说几点，其他的留给粉丝体(e)会(xin)毕竟刺客信条嘛再差都得买。1. 主角爬天爬地，啥光滑表面都能爬，简直一个彼得帕克，就是不会爬树：)
2. 海战和四年前的黑骑没啥两样很失望
3. 增加了可选角色麻烦你把妹子做好看点，好吧这严格来书不能算是缺点，那这样说，角色男女可选是满足了一部分需求，可是这会使得一直以来以历史事实为背景的刺客信条少了那么一点真实性，以前我曾经经历过蒙古大军侵略欧洲；十字军东征；我曾和著名艺术家达芬奇彻夜畅谈；我曾参与波士顿倾茶事件帮助乔治华盛顿赢得独立战争；我曾航行在加勒比海上与传奇海盗黑胡子对月饮酒(可惜没出来杰克船长哈哈)；我曾和我的兄弟主导法国巴士底狱革命；我曾在伦敦街头听查尔斯狄更斯讲故事，我曾亲眼见证了埃及艳后与凯撒大帝的恩怨情仇从金字塔端一(zuo)跃(si)而(zhi)下(yue)，我曾...[spoiler] 哎我到底男的女的[/spoiler] 
4. 不知道还有有没有人发现雅哈哈的彩蛋，官方说是致敬塞尔达，我想在地图设计和火元素方面确实有借鉴在此致敬也算可以，但是育碧的“仿生火”好像没玩好呀

不过我也看到了公式化育碧沙盒的改进

另外推荐x1x版本，PC版没感觉出画质好多少

之前并没有抱多大的期望，从他人角度来说，大家都说这是起源换皮游戏，从我自己角度来说，起源没出多久就有了这部奥德赛，我认为这是育碧有一次年货化，加上之前玩了并不能说多出彩的Far cry5.
之前看了gamersky的一个试玩评测家的演示，一整篇文章说明了这个游戏和起源的区别，客观地看了文章之后，我觉得这个游戏可能没我想的那么难堪，于是决定入手，并在十月三日凌晨上手。
事实证明，我的选择没错！从我个人角度来说这个游戏好过起源太多，也是自巫师3之后最让我沉浸的游戏（漫威蜘蛛侠同样好玩，但没让我觉得这么吃惊，可能是因为游戏本身素质在意料之内），奥德赛绝对是一个神作，全面提升的战斗系统，之前千人同屏这次运用到了战场上，略显恢弘之势，加上个人很喜欢古希腊这段历史（也包括古罗马），玩这个游戏，让我立马回去重温美剧斯巴达克斯。
可能跑题了，但这个游戏是最让我惊喜的游戏，感谢育碧，感谢魁北克，让我体验到了完美的希腊之旅
